name: Amok
description:
When you cast this spell and at the start of each of your turns for the spell's duration, roll a d4. Until the start of your next turn, your Strength and Dexterity scores increase by an amount equal to the result, and your Intelligence and Wisdom scores decrease by the same amount. This spell can't increase your ability scores above 22, and can't decrease them below 5.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you roll a d6 instead; when using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you roll a d8.

name: All is Dust
description: With a word and a gesture, you level the world before you with an immensely powerful, and highly uncontrolled, invisible blast of magical energy. Each creature and object within the radius must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 10d10 force damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. Any creature behind an object or structure large enough to provide full cover has advantage on this saving throw. Eldrazi creatures automatically succeed on the saving throw.Non-magical plant life within the spell's radius is killed and reduced to dust, and the ground within the radius of the spell's effect is torn apart by the force of the blast, turning it into difficult terrain. Any creature, object, or structure reduced to 0 hit points by the spell is reduced to a pile of fine grey dust. A creature killed this way can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.After casting this spell, you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw you suffer two levels of exhaustion, or one level of exhaustion on a successful save.

name: Rings a Bell
description: When you cast this spell, choose a word with four or more letters. Every time you, the player, say the chosen word, the DM must ring or imitate a bell within five seconds. If the DM does not, you, the character, regain an expended spell slot of 3rd level or below.

name: Accumulated Knowledge
description:
When you cast this spell, you immediately learn one factual piece of information about the creature or object you touched which you did not know before. The depth of the knowledge gained in this way varies depending upon how many times you've cast this spell since the end of your last long rest.
 1st casting: You learn one simple fact about the target which is public or widely held knowledge. This could include when the target was created or its date of birth, the name it most frequently goes by, what materials it is made of, who created the object, or the last creature to interact with it in some way.
 2nd casting: You learn one fact about the target which is not well-known, or might be considered a minor secret. This could include the target's alignment, the birth name of a humanoid, any spells affecting the target, or any resistances or vulnerabilities the target has, or a secret that the target keeps from others.
 3rd casting or more: You learn one fact about the target which is almost entirely unknown, or is considered to be a major secret. This could be the true name of a powerful being such as a devil or dragon, a list of abilities which the target has or spells that it knows, a magical ritual necessary to destroy the target, or secrets unknown even to the target itself.
 When you cast the spell, you can attempt to learn specific information by asking a question as you do so, such as "What is this object made of?" or "Who was the last one person this creature spoke to?" However, if the DM decides this question falls outside of the scope of what could be learned using this casting of the spell, they can choose to provide different information instead.If there is no information to be learned about the target that you do not already know, the spell fails; however, it still counts towards the number of times you have cast the spell since the end of your last long rest.

name: Betrayal
description:
Choose a hostile creature that you can see within range. Whenever the target hits a creature with a weapon attack, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you regain 1d4 hit points.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of hit points regained increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Abduction
components: V, S, M (a silver idol shaped like the target worth at least 100 gp, consumed in the casting)
description:
When you cast this spell, choose a creature that you can see within 120 feet, or that you are currently viewing through magical means such as the scrying spell and that is on the same plane as you. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or immediately be teleported to your location, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice within 5 feet. After it appears, chains of magical energy wrap themselves around the creature and sink into its skin, becoming magical tattoos which cause the creature to be charmed by you and place it under your control. While charmed in this way, the target obeys any commands that you issue to it (no action required). The target can repeat the saving throw if given a command that is harmful to itself, or if you or your allies harm or threaten it, ending the spell on itself on a success. When the spell ends, the target can choose to either remain in its current location, or be teleported back to its previous location before the spell was cast.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you can instead maintain concentration on the spell for up to 24 hours.

name: Arc Blade
description:
You spread your hands wide, and launch a thin, arced blade of magical energy from your fingertips. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 6d8 force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.After casting this spell, you gain three time counters. At the start of each of your turns, you lose one time counter. When you lose your last time counter, you can choose to immediately use your reaction to create another blade of magical energy with the same effects.
 Suspend. When you cast this spell, you can instead choose to suspend it using a 3rd-level spell slot. If you do, instead of the spell's normal effects, you gain three time counters. At the start of each of your turns, you lose one time counter. When you lose your last time counter, you can choose to immediately use your reaction to cast the spell as normal.

name: Aethermage's Touch
components: V, S, M (a horn, claw, tooth, and scale each taken from a different beast)
description:
At your touch, a willing creature is wrapped in thick clouds of translucent vapors, which swirl about the target and obscure its true form, transforming its appearance. Choose up to four beasts which you have seen before, and which can not be more than one size larger or smaller than the target. For the duration of the spell, the target can use an action on its turn to assume the appearance of one of the chosen creatures. The change in appearance is illusory, and does not affect the target's game statistics. A creature that physically interacts with the target can make a Wisdom (Perception) check against your spell save DC. On a success, that creature is able to see through the illusion, and identify the target's true appearance.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, you can instead choose up to six different beasts, allowing the target to assume the appearance of any of the chosen creatures.

name: Aether Tradewinds
description: Choose two creatures that you can see within range. Each of those creatures must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be lifted by magical wind, and carried to the other creature's location. If both targets fail their saving throw, they swap spaces. Otherwise a target that fails its saving throw is placed in a random unoccupied space within 5 feet of the other target. This movement does not provoke an opportunity attack.

name: Browbeat
description: You berate and antagonize a creature that you can see in range, weaving magic into your words that forces the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the target takes 6d10 psychic damage and has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes. On a successful save the target instead takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

name: Death Wind
components: V, M (a piece of bark or root from a tree used to hang a criminal)
classes: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
description:
As you finish casting this spell, a gust of hot wind, stale with the stink of death, rises all around you, choking and strangling any number of creatures of your choice that you can see within range. Each of the chosen creatures must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer a -1 penalty to all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws for the spell's duration. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Celestials have disadvantage on this saving throw, and automatically take 1d8 necrotic damage at the start of each of their turns while under the effects of the spell.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the penalty suffered on a failed save increases by 1 and the damage dealt to celestials increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Eaten by Spiders
components: S, M (a bit of spider webbing)
description:
You summon a swarm of spiders around the target, which quickly set to the work of binding its arms, legs, and wings with webbing. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be restrained until it breaks free. A creature that is flying has disadvantage on this saving throw. A creature restrained by the webs automatically takes 2d6 acid and 2d6 piercing damage at the start of each of its turns as it is attacked by the spiders. Any nonmagical armor the restrained creature is wearing and any nonmagical weapon it is carrying suffers a permanent, cumulative -1 penalty at the start of each turn that it remains restrained. If this penalty reaches -5, the armor or weapon is destroyed. A creature restrained by the webs can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer restrained, and the spell ends. The webs are flammable, and when exposed to fire burn away in 1 round, dealing 2d4 fire damage to the restrained creature.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the acid and piercing damage each increase by 1d6 for each slot level above 4th. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target two creatures within range; when you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you can instead target three creatures.

name: Exquisite Blood
components: V, S, M (a drop of blood from a creature that has been dead for no longer than 24 hours)
description: When you cast this spell, a shimmering aura of crimson energy appears around your body, which seems to sap the very life from the air around you. For the duration of the spell, whenever a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes an additional 3d8 necrotic damage as its blood is sucked from the wound and drawn through the air towards you, causing you to regain a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt this way.

name: Grave Exchange
components: V, S, M (a ruby and a jet, each worth 400 gp, both consumed in the casting)
description: You touch a dead creature that has been dead for no more than a century, and that isn't undead. You then touch a living creature that is either willing or unconscious. If the dead creature's soul is free and willing, the target returns to life will all its hit points, and the living creature is automatically reduced to 0 hit points and killed. This spell neutralizes any poisons and cures any diseases afflicting the creature when it died, and closes all mortal wounds and restores any missing body parts. Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a -4 penalty to all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks. Every time the target finishes a long rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it disappears.

name: Grapple with the Past
components: V, S, M (an object belonging to the target for at least 1 week)
description: You can use your reaction to cast this spell when a creature within range would take damage. You use the connection the target shares to the spell's material component to draw them towards yourself and out of harm's way. The target is teleported to an empty space of your choice within 5 ft.

name: Imprisoned in the Moon
components: V, S, M (a silver statuette in the shape of a bird, worth 3000 gp)
description:
Wielding powerful eldritch magic, dangerous in its unpredictability, you attempt to bind a creature within range to the statuette, forcing the target to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target's soul is drawn into the statuette, and their body immediately petrifies into solid silver. For the duration of the spell, the target's body can not be damaged or destroyed in any way, and can not be moved or magically transported. During this time, the target's soul remains trapped in the statuette. While in the statuette, the target remains aware of the world and the passing of time. If the spell ends, or dispel magic is cast on the statuette, the target's soul immediately returns to their body, which resumes its previous form, and the statuette crumbles into powder.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level or higher, the effects of the spell last until dispel magic is cast on the statuette. In addition, the statuette becomes a magic item which requires attunement, and allows the attuned creature to use an action to cast one 1st level spell of your choice from the list of spells you know. The spell must be chosen when the target is first sealed in the statuette.

name: Ironwright's Cleansing
components: S, M (silver dust worth half as much as the target item, consumed in the casting)
description: Your touch cleanses a magic item, removing any curses from the item or swaying it to your cause. The magic item must not have a creature currently attuned to it, or else the spell fails. If the magic item is cursed, the curse is removed and the effects of the curse permanently disappear. If the magic item is sentient, it must make a Wisdom saving throw or have its alignment shift by one step in the direction of your choice for the next 24 hours.

name: Lunar Force
description:
When you cast this spell, you surround yourself in a magical aura which glows a faint white, like moonlight. While surrounded by this aura, the next time you become the target of a spell of 3rd level or lower, the spell fails and has no effect, and the aura disappears as this spell ends.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the aura blocks the next spell that targets you if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

name: Nahiri's Wrath
components: V, S, M (a piece of unworked iron ore)
description: As you cast this spell, you can choose to expend any number of additional spell slots, then record the number and total level of all spell slots expended this way. You reach out with your mind and search the ground around you, feeling for solid stone and transforming it into red-hot weapons crafted from molten earth. The number of weapons created in this way is equal to the number of spell slots expended as you cast this spell. Choose a number of creatures that you can see within range equal to or less than the number of additional spell slots expended as you cast this spell, and make a ranged spell attack against each of the chosen creatures as the blazing-hot weapons fly through the air towards the targets. On a successful hit, each weapon deals 1d10 fire and 1d10 slashing damage times the total level of additional spell slots expended as you cast this spell.

name: Repel the Abominable
description: You can cast this spell using your reaction whenever an aberration, fey, fiend, monstrosity, or undead makes an attack against a creature within range. A gleaming silver shield appears in front of the target, automatically blocking the attack and preventing the damage. The target also gains a +2 bonus to AC until the start of your next turn.

name: ﻿Abelson’s Subtle Dissatisfaction
description: Creatures within 30 ft of a selected point in range must make a Wisdom save. On a failure, they perceive a subtle feeling of disquiet in the chosen area, and must use their movement on each of their turns to move directly away from the chosen point. This effect fades once they are at least 30 feet from the chosen point, and entering the spell’s area again causes them to make another Wisdom save with the same results. On a successful save, there is no effect. Any creature which approaches within 30 ft of the selected point for the first time must also make a Wisdom save, with the same results.

name: Ancestor’s Blessing
components: V, S, M (a dozen grains of any wheat)
description:
You call upon an ancestor spirit for advice or protection. You may ask it to complete one task for you.
 Oracle. You ask the spirit a question, which it answers to the best of its ability. It can not lie to you, but it may not know the answer.
 Blessing. The spirit blesses you. For the next 24 hours, you have advantage on saving throws for one ability of your choice.
 Guardianship. The spirit will guard an area for you. It will alert you instantly if there are any intruders, no matter where you are (so long as you and the spirit are on the same plane,) but it can not fight the intruder or otherwise interfere. It will remain for up to one month before departing, but you may dismiss it earlier if you choose.
 Vitality. The spirit imbues the target with health and vigor. The target may spend up to their Constitution modifier (minimum 1) in Hit Dice.

name: Ancestral Fortitude
components: V, S, M (a drop of your own blood)
description: You fortify your natural resilience with calls to your ancestors as their power runs through you. For the duration, you have advantage on all Strength and Constitution saving throws.

name: Animate Armor
description: This spell creates a construct under your control. Choose a nonmagical suit of armor in range that isn’t being worn or carried. The armor animates and becomes a creature under your control until the spell ends or until the creature is reduced to 0 hit points. As a bonus action, you may mentally command any creature made with this spell if the creature is within 120 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures you may command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one.) You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command to be followed, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends you and itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until complete. An animated suit of armor is a construct with the same statistics as an Animated Armor, except its AC is the same as the armor you animated, with a Dexterity bonus of +0. If animated along with an Animated Weapon, it is able to replace its slam attack with an attack from that weapon. The DM has the creature’s statistics.

name: Animate Weapon
description:
This spell creates a flying weapon. Choose a simple or martial nonmagical weapon in range that isn’t being worn or carried. The weapon animates and becomes a creature under your control until the spell ends or until the creature is reduced to 0 hit points. If the creature ends its turn more than 30 feet from you, the spell ends and it returns to being a nonmagical weapon. As a bonus action, you can mentally command any creature made with this spell if the creature is within 30 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures you may command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one.) You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command to be followed, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends you and itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until complete. An animated weapon is a construct with the same statistics as a Flying Sword, but deals the damage of the weapon animated, and loses its +2 to hit if you are not proficient with the animated weapon. The DM has the creature’s statistics.
 At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can animate an additional weapon for every two spell slots above 1st level.

name: Arcane Hacking
description:
You gain advantage on all Intelligence checks made using hacking tools to break software encryption or online security when using a foreign system. This spell also allows you to break 2nd-level and lower protective spells such as arcane lock or glyph of warding by making an Intelligence check using hacking tools or thieves’ tools against the spell save DC of the spell’s caster.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can attempt to counteract a spell set to secure the foreign system if the spell’s level s equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

name: Arcane Orbs
description: You trace an arcane sigil in the air and a luminescent orb forms by your head. Choose a target within range and make a ranged spell attack against that creature as the sphere hurtles towards it. On a hit, the sphere deals 1d6 force damage. At 5th level, you may choose and attack two creatures within range. At 11th level you may choose and attack three creatures, and at 17th level you may choose and attack up to four creatures within range.

name: Armor Mastery
components: S, M (the armor or shield you touch while casting this spell)
description: You run your hands across a piece of light, medium, or heavy armor or a shield when you cast this spell. If you do not have proficiency with that armor or shield, you gain proficiency for the duration of the spell.

name: Bane Shot
description:
You touch a ranged weapon that uses ammunition, infusing it with the power of vengeance. The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the target takes an extra 10d6 piercing damage, or half as much on a successful one.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 5th level spell slot or higher, the damage increases by 2d6 for each spell slot above 4th.

name: Bending Blade
description:
When you cast this spell, one melee weapon you are holding gains the finesse property until you drop the weapon, lose concentration, or until the spell ends.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level, you can maintain concentration on the spell for up to 1 hour. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level, you can maintain concentration on the spell for up to 8 hours.

name: Bernson’s Potted Bear
components: V, S, M (a small container of any sort)
description: As you cast this spell, you open the small container you have prepared and force all creatures within 60 ft that can see you to make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature which fails this throw suddenly believes that a bear has leapt from the bag when it was opened, and reacts accordingly to this development.

name: Binding Promise
description:
This spell may be cast during the statement of an oath or promise, creating a magically enforced pact or agreement. Both the caster and the target immediately know whether or not the other intends to keep their promise, and are magically informed should one or the other break their oath.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may enter an additional two individuals into the pact for every spell slot above 1st level.

name: Biography
components: V, S, M (an empty book or blank scroll)
description: When you cast this spell, you target an intelligent creature that you can see within range, forcing them to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, you create a written transcript of the target’s life on the material component used for casting the spell, a process which takes one full round. The crafted story is separated into chapters for easy reading, and is written from a third-person point of view. Only the strongest memories or most important parts of the target’s life are written by the spell. While the transcript is being written, the target is stunned. If the target succeeds on their saving throw, the material component used in the spell remains blank, and the target suffers no ill effects.

name: Blacksteel
description:
One metal weapon you touch becomes completely matte black and utterly silent for the spell’s duration- it makes no noise when being drawn or when it strikes another object. The spell ends if you lose contact with the weapon by dropping it, being disarmed, or otherwise are not touching it. Once per turn, when you reduce another creature to 0 hit points with the weapon, you gain 1 temporary hitpoint.
 The temporary hitpoints granted by the spell increase by 1 when you reath 5th level (2), 11th level (3), and 17th level (4).

name: Black Bag
components: V, S, M (a small bag of any sort)
description: Upon casting this spell, the bag required for the material component shifts into a plain leather bag, black as midnight in color. Inside are a number of small knives, scalpels, and other torture devices. If the implements are removed from the bag by anyone except the owner, or if the implements leave the owner’s hand, they immediately dissolve into dust. The bag is otherwise similar in function to a bag of holding, though any objects left in the bag after the spell ends are lost in a random location on the Astral Plane.

name: Blazing Slash
components: V, M (a weapon which deals slashing damage)
description:
As part of the action to cast this spell, you must make one melee weapon attack with a weapon which deals slashing damage against a creature within range of the spell. A crescent of energy exudes from the arc of the weapon in a flat, 30-foot cone, oriented as you choose. All creatures within range of the blast must make a Dexterity saving throw, and any creature hit by the weapon attack automatically fails this save. On a failed save, a target takes 3d6 fire damage, and all attacks made against it have advantage until the end of your next turn. On a success, a target takes only half damage, and no other effects. The crescent of energy leaves a 6-inch deep gash in any nonmagical item it makes contact with, cleaving through objects of lesser width entirely.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 3rd.

name: Blood of Lolth
components: V, M (a bit of spider web)
description: Casting this spell allows you to cut yourself at any point in time during the spell’s duration, causing you to take 1 point of damage and producing a small spider from the blood which spills (use the statistics of the Spider provided in the Monster Manual.) The summoned spider acts of its own volition on your turn in initiative, but follows the commands of the creature whose blood it was formed from. You may communicate with it telepathically as long as it is within 100 ft. of you, and it understands any languages you speak, though it can not communicate back. At any time as a bonus action, you may take total control of the spider, allowing you to see as it sees and perform the actions you choose. You may take control only if the spider is within 100 ft., but once you have done so, you may travel beyond that range. If the spell ends while you have control over the spider, your mind is shunted back to your body, causing you to take 1d4 psychic damage. While controlling the spider, you may cause your body to speak, though you may not cause it to act. You can end this effect at any time you choose, though doing so also ends the spell.

name: Bloodied Blade
description: When you cast this spell, you must spend 1 hit die as blood seeps out of your skin, running down your arm and calcifying into a thin scarlet veneer over the weapon you hold in your hand. For the duration of the spell, you are considered proficient with the weapon, and the first time each round that you deal damage with the weapon, it does additional necrotic damage. This additional damage is the same as the hit die spent casting this spell.

name: Bolt of Time
description:
A beam of blue and purple energy streaks towards a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target, dealing 1d10 force damage on a hit.
 The spell’s damage increases when you level up, dealing 2d10 at 5th level, 3d10 at 11th level, and 4d10 at 17th level.

name: Bonesword
components: V, S, M (a length of bone, which the spell consumes)
description: A bone held in your free hand grows to become a shortsword, longsword, or greatsword, doing so for the duration of the spell before crumbling to dust. Anyone may use the sword, and it is a magical weapon. While wielding the bonesword, you are proficient with it. The bonesword deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage against living creatures.

name: Borov’s Golden Compass
description: You ask a question and carve two different answers on the golden coin, one on each side. You then flip the coin, and the side with the truest answer will face upwards.

name: Bountiful Sunlight
description:
You release a wave of warm light from your body, healing non-hostile creatures within range for 1d6 hit points per round.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you heal an additional 1 hit point per round for every spell slot above 3rd level.

name: Brain Damage
description:
You send a quick, sharp blast of psychic energy into the brain of a creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d6 psychic damage, and suffers disadvantage on the first Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw it makes within the next minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and suffers no additional effect.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 2nd level spell slot or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for every level of the spell slot above 1st.

name: Broadcast
components: V, S, M (a lock of your own hair)
description: You touch a willing creature and create a one-way telepathic link between your minds. For the duration of the spell, the target shares your sense, seeing and hearing everything you see and hear. Your senses come secondary to the creature’s own, but your sense may become more clear to the creature by focusing on them. If the creature enters combat, for the duration of the fight, your senses become fuzzy and indiscernible to the creature. There is no limit to how far apart the linked creatures can move from one another, and the effect lasts even if you and the creature are on different planes.

name: Call Stronghold
components: V, S, M (a fully cleared area the size of the structure and a small, perfect model of the structure worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: You summon your structure from one area to another, and it instantly appears within range upon the completion of this spell. If any objects, debris, or similar exist in the area that the structure would materialize in, the spell fails and all components and spell slots used in casting are lost. This spell is not limited to the plane the structure currently resides in, and may summon structures across planar boundaries.

name: Chains of Doom
components: V, S, M (a chain at least three links in length)
description:
Two phantom chains spring from the walls and ground around a creature within range. That creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw for each chain created by this spell. For each chain the creature fails its saving throw against, that chain latches onto the creature. While the creature has one or more chains attached to it, it is considered restrained and takes an additional 1d4 necrotic damage whenever it takes damage. On its turn, a creature may use an action to make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw for each chain attached to it. For every success, one of the chains attached to the creature is broken or slips loose, and the creature is no longer restrained by it. When this spell ends, the chains become incorporeal and slowly fade out of sight, until they disappear entirely.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you summon an additional chain for each spell slot above 3rd level.

name: Commune with City
description:
You briefly become one with the city and gain knowledge of the surrounding area. Aboveground, this spell gives you knowledge of the area within 1 mile of you. In sewers and other underground settings, you gain knowledge of the area within 600 ft of you. You instantly gain knowledge of up to three facts of your choice about any of the following subjects as they relate to the area:
 Terrain and bodies of water
 Prevalent buildings, plants, animals, or intelligent creatures
 Powerful (CR1 or higher) celestials, fey, fiends, elementals, or undead
 Influences from other planes of existence
 Electrical currents, wireless signals, and active transit lines and tracks
 For example, you could determine the location of powerful undead in the area, the location of major sources of electrical power or interference, and the location of any nearby parks.

name: Conjure Barlgura
description: You summon a barlgura that appears in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The barlgura disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The barlgura is hostile to all non-demons. Roll initative for the barlgura, which has its own turns. At the start of its turn, it moves towards and attacks the nearest non-demon it can perceive. If two or more creatures are equally near, it picks on at random. If it can not see any potential enemies, the barlgura moves in a random direction in search of foes. As part of casting the spell, you can scribe a circle on the ground using the blood of an intelligent humanoid slain within the past 24 hours. The circle is large enough to encompass your space. The summoned barlgura can not cross the circle or target anyone in it while the spell lasts.

name: Conjure Constructs
description:
You summon a construct that appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. You may summon one construct of challenge rating 1 or lower, or two constructs of challenge rating ½ or lower. Each construct disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned constructs, which have their own turns. They obey any verbal commands you give to them, with no action required by you. If you issue no commands, they defend themselves from hostile creatures but otherwise take no actions. The DM has the creatures’ statistics.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 5th level spell slot or higher, you may summon twice as many constructs. When you cast this spell using a 7th level spell slot or higher, you may summon twice as many constructs. When you cast this spell using a 9th level spell slot or higher, you may summon four times as many constructs.

name: Conjure Hezrou
components: V, S, M (food worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: You summon a hezrou that appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The hezrou disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The hezrou’s attitude depends on the value of the food used as a material component for this spell. Roll initiative for the hezrou, which has its own turns. At the start of the hezrou’s turn, the DM makes a secret Charisma check on your behalf, with a bonus equal to the food’s value divided by 20. The check starts at 10 and increases by 2 each round. You can issue orders to the hezrou and have it obey you as long as you succeed on the Charisma check. If the check fails, the spell no longer requires concentration and the demon is no longer under your control. The hezrou then focuses on devouring any corpses it can see. If there are no such meals at hand, it attacks the nearest creatures and eats anything it kills. If its hit points are reduced to below half its hit point maximum, it returns to the Abyss. As part of casting the spell, you can scribe a circle on the ground using the blood of an intelligent humanoid slain within the past 24 hours. The circle is large enough to encompass your space. The summoned hezrou can not cross the circle or target anyone in it while the spell lasts.

name: Conjure Knowbot
description:
You touch a single computerized device or computer system to conjure a knowbot- a partially sentient piece of software imprinted with the vestiges of your own skills and computer abilities. For the duration of the spell, you can use a bonus action to have the knowbot execute a computer-related task that would normally require an action. The knowbot makes Intelligence ability checks using your ability score and proficiency bonuses (including your proficiency with hacking tools, if applicable.) You have a limited telepathic bond with the knowbot, out to a range of 500 ft from the device or system where the knowbot was conjured. If you move beyond this range, the knowbot disappears in 2d4 rounds, as if the duration of the spell had expired. Moving within this range again immediately reestablishes the bond. The knowbot is bound to the system in which it was created, and it stays there until it is dismissed or the spell’s duration expires.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the spell’s duration increases to 1 hr. Additionally, your telepathic bond with the knowbot is effective out to a range of 1,000 ft, and if you leave the range of the bond, the knowbot continues performing its last directed task until the spell expires.

name: Conjure Lesser Demon
components: V, S, M (a vial of blood from an intelligent humanoid killed within the past 24 hours)
description:
You summon up to a total of eight manes or dretches that appear in unoccupied spaces you can see within range. A manes or dretch disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The demons are hostile to all creatures. Roll initiative for the summoned demons as a group, which has its own turns. The demons attack the nearest non-demons to the best of their ability. As part of casting the spell, you can scribe a circle on the ground with the blood used as a material component. The circle is large enough to encompass your space. The summoned demons can not cross the circle or target anyone in it while the spell lasts. Using the material component in this manner consumes it.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th or 7th level, you summon sixteen demons. If you cast it using a spell slot of 8th or 9th level, you summon thirty-two demons.

name: Conjure Shadow Demon
components: V, S, M (a vial of blood from an intelligent humanoid killed within the past 24 hrs)
description: You summon a shadow demon that appears in an unoccupied space within range. The shadow demon disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. Roll initiative for the shadow demon, which has its own turns. You can issue orders to the shadow demon, and it obeys as long as it can attack a creature on each of its turns and does not start its turn in an area of bright light. If either of these conditions is not met, the shadow demon immediately makes a Charisma check contested by your Charisma check. If you fail the check, the spell no longer requires concentration and the demon is no longer under your control, The demon automatically succeeds on the check if it is more than 100 ft away from you. As part of casting the spell, you can scribe a circle on the ground using the blood of an intelligent humanoid slain within the past 24 hrs. The circle is large enough to encompass your space. The summoned shadow demon can not cross the circle or target anyone in it while the spell lasts.

name: Conjure Vrock
components: V, S, M (a gem worth at least 100 gp which the spell consumes)
description: You summon a vrock that appears in an unoccupied space within range. The vrock disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The vrock’s attitude depends on the value of the gem used as a material component for this spell. Roll initiative for the vrock, which has its own turns. At the start of the vrock’s turn, the DM makes a secret Charisma check on your behalf, with a bonus equal to the gems value divided by 20. The check DC starts at 10 and increases by 2 each round. You can issue orders to the vrock and have it obey you as long as you succeed on the Charisma check. If the check fails, the spell no longer requires concentration and the vrock is no longer under your control. The vrock takes no actions on its next turn and uses its telepathy to tell any creature it can see that it will fight in exchange for treasure. The creature that gives the vrock the most expensive gem can command it for the next 1d6 rounds. At the end of that time, it offers the bargain again. If no one offers the Vrock treasure before its next turn begins, it attacks the nearest creatures for 1d6 rounds before returning to the Abyss. As part of casting the spell, you can scribe a circle on the ground using the blood of an intelligent humanoid slain within the past 24 hrs. The circle is large enough to encompass your space. The summoned vrock can not cross the circle or target anyone in it while the spell lasts.

name: Contaminate Food and Drink
components: V, S, M (a pickled rat in a chemical concoction worth no less than 50 gp)
description: All nonmagical food and drink within a 5-foot sphere centered on a point you choose within range is contaminated with your choice of one of the following diseases or poisons: assassin’s blood, cackle fever, sewer plague, sight rot, or truth serum. A creature who ingests food or drink contaminated in this way must pass a saving throw or become infected with the disease or afflicted by the poison. These diseases and poisons are detailed in the Dungeon Master’s Guide on pages 257 and 258.

name: Creeping Doom
description:
You raise you hands and choose four spaces within range, calling forth a swarm of insects in each space. The swarms act on your turn, and are friendly to you and your allies and hostile to your enemies. Using a bonus action, you may command any number of the swarms on your turn. You can not command the swarms to move more than 120 feet from you, and if you move more than 120 feet away from a swarm, it disappears. The DM has the creature’s statistics, with the following changes. The swarms gain a bonus to their attack rolls equal to your spellcasting modifier, and the swarms deal 4d6 piercing damage with a successful attack, or 2d6 piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you summon one additional swarm for each level of the spell slot above 5th.

name: Dark Bead
description:
You create three small black beads which seem to sap away the light from around them. Each bead targets a creature of your choice that you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against each target. On a successful hit, a target takes 1d6 necrotic damage per bead.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you create one more bead for each level above 1st.

name: Dark Orb
description:
You summon a large black orb, which seems to drain away the light from around it. This orb then quickly propels itself away from you in a direction you choose, in a straight line 100 ft long and 5 ft wide. Every creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 1st.

name: Digital Phantom
components: V, S, M (a small piece of copper wire)
description: This spell works to actively hide your presence within a computer system. For the spell’s duration, you and any other users you choose on your local network gain a +10 bonus to Intelligence checks to avoid detection by administrators, knowbots, tracking software, and the like. Whenever you and your chosen users leave any computer system you are working in while this spell is in effect, all trace of your previous presence in that system is erased.

name: Elemental Claws
components: V, S, M (a claw from a beast)
description:
You create two enormous elemental claws on the back of your hands. When you cast this spell, choose a damage type from among acid, cold, fire, or lightning. For the duration of the spell, you can make an attack with one claw as an action. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the claw deals 1d10 + your Strength modifier in damage of the chosen type. If the attack hits, you may also use your bonus action to make another attack with the second claw.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by 1d10 for every two levels above 2nd of the spell slot expended.

name: Emit Force
description: You release a burst of magical force from your body, forcing all creatures within 20 ft. of you to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save they are pushed back until they are 25 ft. away from you, and knocked prone. On a successful save, they are pushed back by 10 ft., up to 25 ft. away from you, and are not knocked prone.

name: Enervation
description: You point at a target within range, and they immediately feel their life force begin to drain from them. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the target loses hit points equal to half of its maximum hit dice. On a successful save, the target takes no damage. If the target’s hit points are reduced to 0 by this spell, the target dies immediately. The lost hit points may only be restored at the end of a long rest, or by the greater restoration spell or similarly powerful magic.

name: Enlighten
components: V, S, M (a page from a book)
description:
You touch a creature and bestow upon it a magical enhancement. Choose one of the following effects, which lasts until the spell ends.
 Word From the Wise: The target has advantage on Wisdom saving throw and can not be charmed or frightened.
 Clear Thoughts: The target has advantage on Intelligence saving throws and on saving throws made to maintain concentration after taking damage.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or above, you may target an additional creature for each level of the spell slot above 2nd.

name: Evil Eye
description:
Choose a creature within range upon whom you release a minor curse. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or gain one of the following afflictions of your choice for the duration of this spell.
 Misfortune. Before the duration of this spell has elapsed, when the creature makes an ability check you may choose to give that roll disadvantage. If the creature fails that ability check, the spell ends.
 Night Terrors. The creature is plagued by paranoia and anxiety, unable to rest or relax. The creature can not take long rests for the duration of the spell.
 Outcast. The creature evokes distrust and disdain in all they meet while afflicted by this spell. Additionally, the creature has disadvantage on all Charisma ability checks for the duration.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell’s duration becomes 8 hours. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration becomes 24 hours. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the spell’s effect becomes permanent until undone by a remove curse spell or similarly powerful magic.

name: Final Confrontation
components: V, S, M (a golden gauntlet worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: One hostile target creature within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, otherwise you transport yourself and the target to an alternate, infinite plane of existence. Once on the plane, both you and the target are restored to full hit points, and neither of you is able to leave the plane by any means until either one of you is dead or the spell’s duration ends, and no other creature may enter the plane. If the target is killed before the duration expires, you return to the material plane, appearing in the space you left, and you gain the ability to shapeshift into the form of the creature you have just killed (if the space is occupied, you reappear in the nearest unoccupied space.) If the target kills you, both the target and your body are returned to the material plane, in the spaces you were both previously occupying (if either space is occupied, you reappear in the nearest unoccupied space.) In order to shapeshift into a creature you have defeated in this manner, you must use an action to do so. You assume the hit points of your new form, as well as the Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution scores. Your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores remain the same, though you gain the ability to speak and understand any languages your new form would be capable of. If your new form is incapable of speaking, you lose the ability to do so. You may revert to your original form as a bonus action. If you do so, you return to the number of hit points you had before shapeshifting. If your new form is reduced to 0 hit points, you return to your original form, and any excess damage carries over to your original form. If you choose to use this ability again before taking a long rest, your new form retains the same number of hits point you had before transforming. You may only assume the form of the creature you most recently defeated using this spell. If you use this spell to defeat another creature, you gain the ability to shapeshift into the new creature, but lose the ability to shapeshift into the previous creature.

name: Find Vehicle
description:
You summon a spirit that assumes the form of a nonmilitary land vehicle of your choice, appearing in an unoccupied space within range. The vehicle has the statistics of a normal vehicle of its sort, though it is celestial, fey, or fiendish (your choice) in origin. The physical characteristics of the vehicle reflect its origin to some degree. For example, a fiendish wagon might be painted black, with spiked wheel spokes and tinted windows. You have a supernatural bond with the conjured vehicle that allows you to drive beyond your normal ability. While driving the conjured vehicle, you are considered proficient with vehicles of its type, and you add double your proficiency bonus to ability checks related to driving the vehicle. While driving the vehicle, you can make any spell you cast that targets only you also target the vehicle. If the vehicle drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. You can also dismiss the vehicle at any time as an action, causing it to disappear. You can’t have more than one vehicle bonded by this spell at a time. As an action, you can release the vehicle from its bond at any time, causing it to disappear.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can conjure a nonmilitary water vehicle large enough to carry six Medium creatures. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can conjure a nonmilitary air vehicle large enough to carry ten Medium creatures. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can conjure any type of vehicle, subject to the DM’s approval.

name: Froststorm Breath
components: V, S, M (a scale, tooth, or claw from a white or silver dragon)
description: Following a deep, inwards breath which seems to chill your own lungs, you unleash a freezing crystal exhalation. Each creature within a 50 ft. cone must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 20d6 frost damage and their hit point maximum is reduced for 20 points for 24 hours. On a success, they take half as much damage, and their hit point maximum is reduced by 10 points for 24 hours. This hit point reduction may only be cured with a greater restoration spell or similarly powerful magic.

name: Ghost Sound
components: V, S, M (a bit of wool or a lump of wax)
description: When you cast this spell, you affix a particular noise to a location within range. As you cast this spell, choose a noise with a volume equal to up to four humans. For the duration of the spell, the noise occurs at the chosen location at a set interval. You may choose to either have the noise occur whenever you use a bonus action to will it, occur at repeating intervals of every round, or constantly occur without stopping. At 4th level, you may use this effect to simulate the noise of up to eight people, up to 12 people at 8th level, up to 16 people at 14th level, and up to 20 people at 17th level.

name: Goodbrew
components: V, S, M (the ingredients of ale and a set of brewer’s tools)
description: Sacrificing the ingredients of a good ale, up to ten ales appear in your hands and are infused with magic. A creature can use its action to drink one ale, which restores 1 hit point and provides enough nourishment to sustain a creature for a day. The ales lose their potency if they are not consumed within 24 hours of the spell’s casting.

name: Gravelord’s Sword Dance
description:
Supposedly created by the first lich to ever unlock the secrets of undeath, this spell summons several large, spectral blades which burst from the ground in a 20 ft. cube around you, forcing all creatures within range to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, creatures takes 6d6 necrotic damage and 4d6 slashing damage, or half as much on a successful save.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by 1d6 for every level above 5th.

name: Guiding Force
description: This ritual temporarily strengthens your connection with the forces that grant you your powers, divine or otherwise. As an action for the duration of the spell, you may at any time make a Wisdom (Insight) check with a DC equal to 2 + your spell save DC. If you succeed on this check, you temporarily sense the location of any object, creature, or place within 5 miles which shares a fundamental connection to the deity or patron you serve, and for the next 5 minutes you automatically have knowledge of how to find your way there. At the end of this 5 minutes, you are no longer able to sense the location of the object, creature, or place, and must succeed on another Wisdom (Insight) check in order to be able to do so again. If you fail a Wisdom (Insight) check made to sense the presence of your deity or patron, you are unable to make another Wisdom (Insight) check to do so for 1 hour. In addition, your DM may provide your character with false information about where the object, creature, or location connected to your deity or patron is.

name: Halt
description:
You briefly cease the flow of time in a small 5 foot square area, creating one of the following effects at a point you can see within range:
 One Medium or smaller creature that you choose must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frozen in time, becoming paralyzed until the end of your next turn.
 You create a small area that is capable of stopping projectiles, the flow of liquid, the movement of air, and aging. You may end this effect as a bonus action, causing all effects within the area to resume at their normal pace; i.e. liquids begin to flow again, projectiles continue to move as if they hadn’t stopped, and the process of aging starts again. This effect continues until you move further than 30 feet away from the area, or drop to 0 hit points. If you attempt to target an object worn or carried by a character in this way, that character must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the effects of the spell.
 You preserve a marking or text from fading, decaying, or being destroyed by the passage of time. This effect is indefinite.

name: Haywire
description:
This spell plays havoc with electronic devices, making use of such devices all but impossible. Each electronic device in a 10-ft-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range is subject to random behavior while it remains within the area. A device not held by a creature is automatically affected. If an electronic device is held by a creature, that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the device be affected by the spell. At the start of each of your turns, roll a d6 for each affected device to determine its behavior. Except where otherwise indicated, that behavior lasts until the start of your next turn while this spell is in effect,
 1: The device shuts down and must be restarted. Do not roll again for this device until is is restarted.
 2-4: The device does not function.
 5: The device experiences a power surge, causing an electric shock to the wielder (if any) and one random creature within 5 ft of the device. Each affected creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking 6d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
 6: The device is usable as normal.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius of the sphere affected by the spell increases by 5 ft for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Hemomancy
components: S, M (Cedar, burdock shoots, and salt; consumed during the spell)
description:
Over a flat stone, burn a bough of cedar or some dried burdock shoots. Break up the remains and rake the ash into an even bed. Add some salt if you think it necessary.The inexperienced soothsayer might be tempted to use sand, flour, or any number of other fine, granular mediums, but must resist the temptation! Calling forth spirits - especially with blood magic - is a dangerous business, and using such substitutes can cause grave insult, resulting in bad fortune.The two participants must each make a single cut into the other’s flesh with the same blade, spilling blood into the ash. Examine for markings to determine the nature of the participants’ relationship in the future. Roll 1d4 times on the table below.
 1. X : A crossing of paths
 2. I I : Separation, or an alliance
 3. .’. : A death
 4. ● : Overwhelming success, or a baby
 5. 6 : A failure
 6. ••• : Loyalty
 7. ‡ : Rivalry
 8. # : Family trouble
 9. ∞ : Success through great adversity
 10. M : Turmoil
 11. ¢ : BFFFs

name: Homeward
components: V, S, M (a piece of cloth taken from the location where you last spent a long rest)
description: When you cast this spell, you send up a prayer to the deity you serve, asking them to protect you and guide you from danger. You are then teleported to the last location where you spent a long rest, provided that location is on the same plane. The spell fails if the location is on another plane, or if the location is magically warded in some way, or is for some other reason is currently inaccessible or no longer exists.

name: Hopkin’s Frozen Caterer
components: V, S, M (a chunk of ice)
description: As you complete the spell and toss the ice onto the ground, it grows to become a Medium size humanoid. This creature is mindless, and will perform tasks at your command. It has AC 10, 1 hit point, Strength of 4, and can’t attack. If it drops to 0 hit points, the spell ends. Once on each of your turns as a bonus action, you may mentally command the frozen caterer to move up to 15 ft and interact with an object. The caterer can do simple tasks that a human is capable of doing, but is best used for fetching items, as everything it touches becomes ice cold upon receiving it. Once you give the command, the caterer performs the task to the best of its ability, and then waits for the next command. If you command the caterer to perform a task that is more than 60 ft away from you, it will begin to melt once it is 60 ft away. Once this begins to happen, the caterer will fully melt within 1 min. However, the caterer will return to full solidity upon approaching within 60 ft of you.

name: Hush
description:
Your footsteps and armor make no noise, giving you advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to remain undetected while moving.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target an additional creature for every level of the spell slot above 1st.

name: Infallible Relay
components: V, S, M ( a mobile phone)
description: With this spell, you can target any creature with whom you have spoken previously, as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. When you cast the spell, the nearest functioning telephone or similar communications device within 100 ft of the target begins to ring. If there is no suitable device close enough to the target, the spell fails. The target must make a successful Charisma saving throw or be compelled to answer your call. Once the connection is established, the call is crystal clear and can not be dropped until the conversation has ended or the spell’s duration ends. You can end the conversation at any time, but the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw to end the conversation.

name: Invisibility to Cameras
components: V, S, M ( a scrap of black paper)
description: Four creatures of your choice within range become undetectable to electronic sensors or cameras for the duration of the spell. Anything a target is wearing or carrying is likewise undetectable as long as it is on the target’s person. The target remains visible to vision.

name: Invoke Gemstone
components: S, M (an amethyst, citrine, diamond, emerald, hematite, onyx, ruby, topaz, or sapphire worth at least 50 gp)
description:
You lift a gemstone to your face and view your enemy through its facets, their image distorted and refracted as you invoke the power of the stone. Make a spell attack roll against a target creature. On a successful hit, deal 4d8 damage of a type determined by the gemstone used in the spell.
 Amethyst: Psychic damage
 Citrine: Acid damage
 Diamond: Radiant damage
 Emerald: Poison damage
 Hematite: Thunder damage
 Onyx: Necrotic damage
 Ruby: Fire damage
 Topaz: Lightning damage
 Sapphire: Cold damage
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, increase the damage done by 1d8 for each spell slot above 3rd level.

name: Lady Jennifer’s Blinding Blast
components: V, M (the eyeball of any creature)
description: You hold the component eyeball in front of you, and a blinding cone of light quickly flashes from it. All creatures within a 30 ft cone must make a Constitution saving throw or be blinded for 1d4 rounds.

name: Lightning Shock
classes: Bard, Cleric, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
description: A crackling lightning bolt arcs towards a creature within range. You can not cast this spell if you have used any of your movement this turn. Your speed becomes 0 and you can not benefit from any bonuses to your speed for this turn. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d12 lightning damage. This spell’s damage increases by 1d12 when your reach 5th level (2d12), 11th level (3d12), and 17th level (4d12).

name: Longshot
description: When you cast this spell, you double both the short and long ranges of a single ranged weapon which you are holding and with which you are proficient.

name: Nocturnal Blessing
components: V, S, M (seeds of a flower that blooms only at night)
description: When you touch a willing creature while casting this spell, that creature gains low-light vision out to a range of 120 ft. Additionally, that creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on sight when they, the target of their attack, or whatever they are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight. All of these effects end when the spell does.

name: Morph
components: V, S, M (a body part from a small reptile or avian)
classes: Bard, Druid, Cleric, Ranger, Paladin, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
description:
You touch one willing humanoid creature, causing it to adopt a dusty, spherical form, wrapped in scaled feathers which slowly revolve around its shape. The target’s AC becomes 12, its walking speed becomes 40 feet, and it gains advantage on all saving throws. While in this form, the target can not be recognized except through truesight. The creature is unable to cast spells, talk, or manipulate objects. For the duration of the spell, all of the target’s ability scores become 12. While in this form, the target is only able to make one attack, detailed below. At any time while in this form, the target may use a bonus action to resume its normal form.
 Morph Strike. Melee Weapon Attack. +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., single target. Hit: 2d6+2 force damage.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the target’s Morph Strike gains a +1 bonus to attack rolls, and deals an additional 1d6 damage for every level above 3rd.

name: Nightmare Weapon
components: V, S, M (a drop of black ink)
description:
You touch a non-magical weapon, causing to to become an inky black color. For the duration, the weapon is considered to be magical for the purposes of overcoming damage reduction. All bright-light within 15 feet of the weapon is reduced to dim light, and all dim light is reduced to non-magical darkness. Completely covering the weapon with an opaque object such as a blanket or a sheet blocks the darkening effect. If the darkening effect overlaps with an area of light created by a 2nd level spell or lower, that spell is dispelled. The weapon gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls, and deals an additional 1d4 psychic damage when it hits.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the weapon’s bonus increases to +2, and the extra damage increases to 2d4. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the weapon’s bonus increases to +3, and the extra damage increases to 3d4.

name: On/Off
description: This spell allows you to activate or deactivate any electronic device within range, as long as the device has a clearly defined on or off function that can be easily accessed from the outside of the device. Any device that requires a software-based shutdown sequence to activate or deactivate can not be affected by on/off.

name: Peerless Craftsmanship
description: You spend a minute concentrating on thoughts of finely crafted works of art, and then choose one set of artisan’s tools. If you do not have proficiency with those tools, you gain proficiency with them for the duration of the spell. If you do have proficiency with those tools, double your proficiency bonus when using those tools for the duration of the spell.

name: Power Within
description:
When you cast this spell, you body begins to literally burn with magical power, enhancing your natural skills. For the duration, your Strength and Dexterity scores each increase by 2, up to a maximum of 22, and your speed increases by 10 ft. In addition, every round for the duration of the spell, you take 10 fire damage. This damage ignores all resistances and immunities.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration increases by 1 round for every level above 4th.

name: Prophetic Painting
components: S, M (pigments worth at least 10 gp, consumed during the casting)
description: You let the divining power of spirits wash over and through you, granting you glimpses of the unwritten. Over the course of an hour, you paint vivid scenes onto a nearby plain surface, showing scenes of the future or alternate realities. The DM determines the results of this spell, which are often metaphorical and must be interpreted. Common themes involve animals and other beasts, as well as scenes of nature.

name: Protection from Ballistics
description: This spell enchants the flesh of the target against the impact of bullets. Until the spell ends, the target has resistance to nonmagical ballistic damage.

name: Quaddrano’s Express Starlight
description:
With a quick word you slice open the palm of your hand, creating a small rift between this world and another, from which springs a beam of eldritch light. Make a ranged spell attack against target creature, dealing 8d10 necrotic damage on a successful hit. Any creature reduced to 0 hit points by this spell is immediately killed as the flesh is stripped from their frame and their bones begin to liquefy.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for every spell slot above 5th.

name: Quantum Shift
components: V, S, M (an elaborately decorated sundial or similar timekeeping object, worth at least 500 gp)
description: You tear apart the fabric of space and time, leaving a gaping hole in reality and creating a magical vortex inside its area. All creatures within a 100 ft. sphere must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking 8d6 force damage and 8d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Each creature who took damage must then make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature’s Wisdom and Charisma scores both become 1, the creature loses the ability to cast spells or activate magic items, and the creature does not understand where it is or what has just happened, and is now of neutral alignment. This spell damages all objects caught within the radius of the vortex, and sucks away light items not currently being held or fixed down, depositing them in a random location on any plane.

name: Radiant Thrust
components: V, M (a weapon which deals piercing damage)
description:
As part of the action to cast this spell, you must make one melee weapon attack with a weapon which deals piercing damage against a creature within range of the spell. A beam of pure light shoots from the point of the weapon in 60-foot line, forcing all creatures within range of the blast to make a Dexterity saving throw. Any creature hit by the weapon attack automatically fails this save. On a failed save, a target takes 4d8 radiant damage, and half as much on a success. Any creature reduced to 0 hit points to this spell automatically crumbles into a fine, glowing dust, leaving behind no remains.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each level above 3rd.

name: Raging River
description: When you cast this spell, choose a point that you can see within range. Starting from that point, the ground appears to split in a straight line, 60 feet in either direction from the point you choose. The gap grows until it is 20 feet wide, but in truth the chasm is just an illusion. The split appears to be 60 feet deep, with a raging river below. Any creature which is in the area of the gap as it appears may jump out of the way to either side. Any creature which would reasonably fall into the gap as a result of movement must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 4d6 psychic damage, and believes it has fallen into the chasm, causing it to become frightened and incapacitated. Any attempts by the creature to climb out of the illusionary chasm require only a DC 10 Athletics check. If a creature succeeds on their save, they take no damage, and the spell immediately ends.

name: Raise Land
components: V, S, M (an exotic feather and a diamond worth at least 2500 gp, which the spell consumes)
description:
Upon the completion of this spell, the land beneath you and whatever else may be on that land rises skyward, 100 feet into the air. The area affected by this spell can have a radius up to 1,250 feet, and the spell fails if the radius includes an area already under the effect of a raise land spell. While standing on a piece of land affected by a raise land spell that you have cast, you may use your action to cause the landmass to move up to 50 feet in any direction that you choose. The landmass ceases to move if it impacts any object.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 9th level spell slot, the radius affected by the spell increases to 5,000 feet.

name: Reflexive Shot
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when any creature within 30 ft of you moves
description: You react to the movement of another, taking a quick but deadly shot with your weapon. Make a single attack with a ranged weapon you are holding against a creature within range. On a successful hit, the creature takes an additional 1d6 damage of the type dealt by the weapon.

name: Remote Access
description: You can use any electronic device within range as if it were in your hands. This is not a telekinesis effect. Rather, this spell allows you to simulate a device’s mechanical functions electronically. You are able to access only functions that a person using the device manually would be able to access. You can use remote access with only one device at a time.

name: Restore Mind
description:
This spell restores a mind to functionality and self-determination. If you cast this spell using an action, you may end the charmed, frightened, or frightful reaction condition on a creature you touch. If you cast this spell over the course of 8 hours, you have an extended conversation with one creature which you must remain touching for the duration, as you slowly bring its mind back to reality, curing the effect of one lesser insanity on the target.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or greater, you may use this spell to end the effect of a greater insanity upon a creature over the course of 8 hours.

name: Revert Time
description:
You touch a creature, slowly reversing time around the wounds it has suffered, creating a temporary measure against death. The creature regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8+your spellcasting ability modifier. This effect lasts for a number of rounds equal to you spellcasting ability modifier + your spellcasting level (minimum 1), at the end of which the creature suffers an amount of damage equal to the number of hit points it regained.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of hit points regained increases by an additional 2d8 for every spell slot above 1st level. In addition, the duration of the spell increases by 1 round for every spell slot above 1st level.

name: Riddle
classes: Chronomancer, Cleric, Paladin, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
description: You call upon an extraplanar entity, an alien intellect, a devious fiend, or some other source of otherworldly power, becoming a conduit and channeling its voice as you speak a complex riddle. Creatures that can not hear you or which do not have a spoken language are unaffected, but a creature understands the riddle so long as they have at least one spoken language. Until a creature answers the riddle correctly by succeeding on an Intelligence saving throw, they are subject to the crushing presence of the otherworldly intellect. On a successful save, the creature takes 2d6 psychic damage from the brush with the vast, incomprehensible power. On a failed save, the creature is stunned for the duration of the spell and at the beginning of each of the creature’s turns until the spell ends, the creature must make another Intelligence saving throw, ending the effect on themselves with a success, or taking another 2d6 psychic damage on a failure.

name: Rip Through Time
components: V, S, M (a mirror etched with an hourglass)
description: A series of portals which look out into other timelines open within a 60 foot radius centered on a chosen point within range. Each creature in the radius must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 10d6 psychic damage, and is immobilized for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes no damage and is not immobilized. A creature immobilized by this spell must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, and is no longer immobilized on a success.

name: Rolf’s Ultimate Pyre
description: As you recite the words of the spell, your body bursts into pure white flame, dealing 15d6 fire damage to yourself. All creatures within an 80 ft radius must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 24d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Any creature, including yourself, reduced to 0 hit points by this damage is immediately turned to ashes, their body burned away in the flash of heat. The spell damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren’t being worn.

name: Rune of Protection
components: S, M (charcoal or a similar material)
description:
Using charcoal or a similar material, you use your fingers to trace the rune of protection on yourself or one creature you can touch. Until you lose concentration, or at the end of your turn in a number of turns equal to your Constitution modifier + your spellcasting level (minimum of 1 turn), you or the target creature gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.
 At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the maximum duration of the spell is increased by 1 round for each level of spell slot higher than 2nd. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you gain resistance to all bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

name: Sending Stone
components: V, M (a single rock of any type)
description: You launch a single, unassuming stone at a target within range, propelling it with magical force. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. If the stone hits, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting modifier.

name: Sense Danger
description: You make an ancient motion with your hands, intended to ward off danger, and become preternaturally aware of all around you. The first initiative roll you make after casting this spell is made with advantage and you are immune to being surprised. The spell ends after the duration passes or once you use its effects.

name: Shadowcloak
components: S, M (a bit of black cloth)
description: You touch one object that is no larger than 10 ft.x10ft. in dimension. Until the spell ends, the touched object reduces all light within a 20 ft. radius. For the duration of the spell, bright light in the radius becomes dim light, and dim light becomes darkness.
