If you completely cover the object the darkness effect ends, or you may dismiss it as an action. The spell also ends if the touched object is targeted by a Light spell of 1st level or higher. If the targeted object is held or worn by an enemy, they must succeed on a Dexterity save to avoid the effect of the spell.

name: Shared Pain
description:
You may select any number of creatures within a 20-foot sphere centered on a point within range. Each of those creatures must make an Intelligence saving throw. Any creatures which fail their Intelligence saving throw become telepathically linked, and any pain one feels is felt amongst them all. Whenever any of the linked creatures take damage from a source other than this spell, each other linked creature automatically takes 1d6 psychic damage. There is no limit to how far away the linked creatures may be from one another, but the spell ends if any of the creatures enter another plane.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 5th level spell slot or higher, the damage increases to 1d8. When you cast this spell using a 7th level spell slot, the damage increases to 1d10.

name: Shutdown
description:
This spell shuts down all electronic devices within range that are not wielded by or under direct control of a creature. If an electronic device within range is used by a creature, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw to prevent the device from being shut down. While the spell remains active, no electronic device within range can be started or restarted.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or 8th level, the range increases to 500 ft, and duration increases by 1 minute per slot level. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the range increases to 1000 ft, and the duration increases to 5 min.

name: Sight of the Reaper
components: V, S, M (a ritual circle and the eye of a humanoid)
description: In order to cast this spell, knowledge of the ritual required must be acquired from a book, or passed down orally. The ritual itself takes 30 minutes to perform, and involves a specific ritual circle, at the center of which is then placed the eye of any humanoid (though one of the same size as your own is preferred.) Halfway through the ritual, the one performing it must remove their own eye, and place it into the circle as well. Just before the end of the ritual, they then take the other eye, and place it against their eye socket, where it will began to magically fuse itself into place. Completing this ritual cuts the remaining lifespan of the one casting the spell in half, but results in them receiving the ability to instantly know the name and time of death of anyone they see. A time of death is variable, and may be changed through methods such as this ritual, or those with knowledge of a person’s time of death attacking and killing them before that moment.

name: Soul Arrow
description:
When you cast this spell, you summon a magical arrow of pure force, which you then launch at a creature within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. This attack ignores cover entirely.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for every level above 2nd.

name: Sound Burst
description: Choose a point within range. All creatures within a 10-foot radius of that point take 1d8 thunder damage, and must make a Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 round.

name: Spell Blade
description: With a word and a wave, you conjure a blade of force in your free hand. The blade is similar in size and shape to a shortsword, and lasts for the duration. If you let go of the blade it disappears, and may be summoned again as a bonus action. You are proficient with the blade and can make melee weapon attacks with it. It is a magic weapon with the light and finesse properties, and it deals 1d6 slashing or force damage, your choice, on a successful hit. You may cast a spell with a range of touch on the blade, storing the magic within its ethereal length. The spell is held until is is released, or until the blade disappears, and only one spell may be held in the blade at a time. The spell is cast when a creature is hit with the blade, causing the effects of the spell to be cast upon it in addition to the damage from the blade.

name: Stasis
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when a projectile moves within 15 ft. of you, or when you are targeted by a melee attack
description:
With a quick movement of your hands, you attempt to prevent an attack on your person by locking it in time.
 Creature. If you target a creature with this spell, that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or enter stasis until the start of its next turn. A creature in stasis is incapacitated (as the condition), can not move or be moved, and is immune to all damage. The creature appears to be semi-translucent, and when inspected, radiates arcane energy. When the stasis ends, the creature completes its attack, making an attack roll against any creature which is now occupying the space you were in when you cast the spell. It then completes its turn as normal.
 Projectile. If you target a projectile with this spell, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC for the ability check is equal to 10 + the attack modifier for non-spell attacks, and 10 + the spell’s level for spell attacks. On a success, the projectile enters into stasis until the start of the next turn. A projectile in stasis can not be moved, and is immune to all damage. The projectile appears semi-translucent, and when inspected, radiates arcane energy. When the stasis ends, the projectile continues onward as if it had not stopped, potentially missing any targets which have moved out of its path. If the projectile were to still hit a target, use the attack roll made when it was launched to determine if it were to hit, and roll damage normally.

name: Stolen Life
components: V, S, M (a calendar or timepiece older than you are worth at least 1sp or more)
description: Running your fingers across a creature, their body is wracked with the pain of stolen life as years that were theirs become yours. Make a melee spell attack against an adjacent living creature. On a hit, the creature takes 8d8 necrotic damage. If that creature is a humanoid it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or else age 1d12 years. You then add the same amount of years to your natural lifespan. This spell has no effect if the creature is undead.

name: Stonefist
description: With a word and a gesture, the skin on your hands and arms grows thick and callous, and the muscles underneath become tough and powerful. For the duration of the spell you gain proficiency in unarmed attacks, and your unarmed attacks deal bludgeoning damage equal to 2d4+your Strength modifier. In addition, your grip becomes almost unbreakable, and for the duration of the spell you have advantage on all Strength (Athletics) checks made to initiate or maintain a grapple.

name: Summon Hound
components: V, S, M (a large hunk of fresh meat)
description: Tracing a pattern on the ground and calling out an offering in the form of the meat in your hand, you summon a powerful celestial hound in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The DM has this creature’s statistics. The summoned creature is friendly to you and your companions, and follows your orders. As a bonus action, you may verbally command the hound to move and attack. Otherwise the hound acts on its own on your initiative, attacking any nearby hostile creatures and defending itself if attacked. If cast using an action, the spell’s duration is a number of rounds equal to your spellcasting level. If cast using a ritual, the spell’s duration is instead 24 hours. At the end of the spell’s duration, the celestial hound fades away, returning to the plane from which it was summoned.

name: Sunlight Spear
description: You create a divine spear of pure sunlight in your hands, and hurl it at a target you can see within range, making a ranged spell attack. If the attack hits, the target takes 30d6 radiant damage, and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or else become blinded until the end of your next turn. The summoned spear is treated as real sunlight, dealing additional damage as appropriate to undead or other creatures which have a weakness to sunlight.

name: Synchronicity
description: The creature you touch feels reality subtly shifted to its favor while this spell is in effect. The target isn’t inconvenienced by mundane delays of any sort. Roads and paths are always free of obstruction, there’s always a waiting rickshaw, and a horse is always around the corner. The target can run at full speed through dense crowds, and attacks of opportunity provoked by the target’s movement have disadvantage. Synchronicity grants advantage to Dexterity (Stealth) checks, since the target always finds a handy piece of cover available. Additionally, the target has advantage on all ability checks made to drive a vehicle. In the event that two or more creatures under the effect of synchronicity are attempting to avoid being inconvenienced by each other, the creatures engage in a contest of Charisma each time the effects of the spells would oppose each other.

name: System Backdoor
description:
This spell allows you to bypass system security in order to create a secure login on a foreign system. The login you create allows you administrator-level privileges in any computer system not enhanced through technomagic. The login defeats any technomagic spells of 3rd level or lower. Once the duration of the spell expires, the login and all privileges are wiped from the system. System logs still show the activity of the user, but the user identification can not be found or traced.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you are able to bypass technological spells if the spell’s level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

name: The Grand Wizard’s Debate Tactic
description: After preparing the talisman, you must eat it. Until it dissolves, whenever you shout, creatures which can hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they believe everything you say to be true, so long as you are shouting the words. On a success, the creature does not know that your voice is magically enchanted. The average time until the talisman dissolves is 6 hours, but may be more or less depending on the metabolism of the caster.

name: Thundering Blow
components: V, M (a weapon which deals bludgeoning damage)
description:
As part of the action to cast this spell, you must make one melee weapon attack with a weapon which deals bludgeoning damage against a creature within range of the spell. A thunderous force emanates from the attack, forcing all creatures other than you within 10 feet of the target to make a Strength saving throw. Any creature hit by the attack automatically fails this save. On a failed save, a target takes 2d6 thunder damage, and is pushed 30 feet away from you in a straight line, and knocked prone. If a target collides with a solid surface during this movement, they take an additional 2d6 bludgeoning damage. On a success, a target takes only half damage, and no other effects.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the initial damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 3rd.

name: Tunneling Technique
components: S, M (a pick or a shovel, with an iron head)
description: After spending a moment assessing the earth around you and determining its composition, you gain a burrowing speed equal to your walking speed for the duration of the spell.

name: Weight
components: V, S, M (a small ball of lead)
description: This spell is used to guard against theft by increasing the weight of a container when anyone other than the caster attempts to pick it up. This spell affects a single touched container, such as a chest or pouch, which takes up no more space than a 5 ft. cube. When any creature besides the caster attempts to pick up the container, the weight of the container increases to 1d4+1 times the weight of the creature. When casting the spell, the caster may also specify a number of creatures equal to their spellcasting modifier who may also freely pick up the container. Picking up a creature who has picked up the container does not cause the container’s weight to increase.

name: Wild Guess
components: S, M (a flower with all of its petals intact)
description:
When this spell is cast, the caster immediately knows an approximate guess at the number of individuals in a certain group. This may be a group of creatures or a pile of items, but all individuals in the group must be within range of the spell, and the caster must be able to discern individual members of the group. This spell automatically rounds to the largest factor of ten within the counted group when estimating; so a pile of 1,780 gold coins will give a result of 2,000, while a group of 68 swordsmen will give a result of 70.
 At Higher Levels. When casting this spell at higher levels, it allows you to count with greater accuracy. Casting this spell with a 3rd level spell slot estimates to the second highest factor of ten instead. Casting this spell with a 5th level spell slot estimates to the third highest factor of ten. Casting this spell with a 7th level spell slot estimates to the fourth highest factor of ten, and casting it with a 9th level spell slot estimates to the fifth highest factor of ten.

name: Wind Whispers
description:
Your whispers are laced with terrible secrets of pain and sadness. Choose a target within range. Your whispered phrases penetrate the deepest layers of its mind. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 4d12 psychic damage and become stunned until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and is not stunned.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d12 for every level above 4th.

name: Witch’s Flock
description:
Your body briefly breaks apart into a flock of birds, allowing you to move up to thirty feet in any direction. When you move through a creature’s space in this way, they must succeed on a Dexterity save or take 1d8 slashing damage.
 At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases to 2d8 and by an additional 1d8 for every spell slot level above 4th.

name: Woeful Stab
components: V, S, M (a single tear of pain, consumed by the spell)
description: While a dagger in the back may hurt for some time afterwards, the pain of a woeful dagger takes much longer to end. In your free hand, you conjure a dagger of black glass from the tear, which lasts for the duration of the spell. You are proficient with the woeful dagger and you may use your spellcasting ability modifier for the attack and damage roll. The woeful dagger is a magic weapon and deals 2d4 piercing damage on a hit. Once during the spell’s duration, when you hit a creature with the woeful dagger, you may choose to make a woeful strike, planting the dagger into the creature and releasing it. If you do so, the creature you hit must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 12d10 psychic damage and suffers disadvantage on all saves for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and no disadvantage on saves. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success. Regardless of whether the creature succeeds or fails, the spell ends and the woeful dagger disappears after the attack, fading into black smoke.

name: Altar's Reap
components: V, S, M (a dagger, and the corpse of a humanoid killed in the last 24 hours)
description: Those practiced in the dark arts of necromancy know that there is power to be found even in the dead. When you cast this spell, you mutilate a fresh corpse, inscribing arcane glyphs into its skin with a ritual dagger. When you finish casting this spell, you automatically regain 2 expended 1st level spell slots. A corpse can be used for this spell only once; after it has been marked by the spell it can not be used in the same way again.

name: Army of the Damned
components: V, S, M (a shard from a tombstone and a splinter from a coffin)
description:
When you finish casting this spell, choose a point within range that you can see. The air in a 30-foot radius around the chosen point becomes heavy with foul magic, animating any corpses in the area. Any pile of bones or corpse of a humanoid of Medium or Small size in the radius that you choose animates as a skeleton if it was bones, or a zombie if it was a corpse (the DM has the creature's game statistics.) On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command any number of creatures you made with this spell, so long as the creature is on the same plane of existence. You decide what action the creatures will take and where they will move during their next turns, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creatures defend themselves and you against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete. After 24 hours the spell ends, and any creature animated by the spell becomes a mundane corpse.
 Flashback. If you've already cast this spell since the end of your last long rest, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell. If you do so, the range of the spell and the radius of the area affected by the spell both double. After doing so, you can't cast this spell again until the end of your next long rest.

name: Back from the Brink
components: V, S, M (A sprinkle of holy water, a vial of ectoplasm, and diamonds worth 2,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: You touch a creature that has been dead for no longer than 1 hour and that died for any reason. If the creature's soul is free, the creature is turned into a ghost with all of its hit points, ability scores, and saving throw and skill proficiencies. An unwilling creature can make a Charisma saving throw, resisting the effects of the spell on a success. On a failed save or if the target is willing, the ghost appears in an unoccupied space you choose within 10 feet of you. The ghost retains all of the memories of its life. The ghost is charmed by you, and must follow any commands that you give to it. If you command the ghost to do something it doesn't want to do, it can make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the ghost is not forced to follow any commands you give to it for the next hour. The ghost remains for one week, at which point it disappears unless you spend 10 minutes to cast this spell again, targeting the ghost. If the ghost does not want to remain, it can attempt another Charisma saving throw to resist the effects of the spell.

name: Baker's Caravan Vigil
description:
Your touch imbues a creature with supernatural awareness and energy. The next time before the end of the spell's duration that a target would take a long rest, they instead need half as much time to gain the benefits of a long rest, and if they would sleep during this time, they instead meditate, remaining semiconscious.
 Morbid. If the target of the spell takes damage or is killed during the spell's duration, you receive a mental alarm alerting you of the fact, which automatically awakens you if you are sleeping.

name: Blasphemous Act
description:
When you cast this spell you unleash a blast of chaotic energy which ripples outward, twisting and contorting the world around you. Choose up to thirteen creatures within range. Each target must make a Constitution saving throw, on a failed save taking 13d4 force damage and becoming stunned until the end of your next turn, or on a success taking half as much damage with no other effect.
 At Lower Levels. You can cast this spell using a spell slot of one level lower for each creature beyond the first that you target using this spell. The damage of the spell decreases by 1d4 for each slot level below 9th.

name: Bonds of Faith
components: V, S, M (a silver collar worth 200 gp)
description: This spell binds a creature with the power of faith. For some this is a boon; for others, a punishment. When you cast this spell, if the target is a willing creature, for the duration they gain resistance to radiant damage, and their weapon attacks deal an additional 1d6 radiant damage. If the target is not willing, they must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target gains the benefits of the spell, and can not willingly attack you or your allies for the spell's duration. The spell ends if you or your allies injure the target. The spell automatically fails if the target's Intelligence is 3 or lower.

name: Bramblecrush
description:
As you cast this spell, a tangle of thorny brambles grows from a spot of your choice in range that you can see, quickly spreading to fill a 20-foot radius. Each creature in the radius must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, creatures are caught in the brambles, which begin to clamp down and squeeze, causing them to begin suffocating. A creature caught in the brambles has its speed reduced to 0, and can't benefit from any increase to its speed. Creatures caught in the brambles automatically take 1d6 piercing damage at the start of each of their turns, and can use an action on their turn to make another Dexterity saving throw, freeing themselves on a success. On a failed save, a creature takes an additional 1d6 piercing damage. The radius of the brambles count as difficult terrain. Creatures that enter the brambles for the first time on their turn or which begin their turn in the brambles but aren't trapped there must make a Dexterity saving throw or become caught in the brambles. Each 5-foot section of the brambles can be destroyed, and has AC 10, 20 hit points, vulnerability to fire and slashing damage, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. When a creature hits a section of the brambles with a melee attack, they must make a Strength saving throw or be pulled into the tangling brambles. When the spell ends, the brambles immediately wither and crumble away.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the radius of the brambles increases by 5 ft. for each slot level above 6th.

name: Brimstone Volley
description:
When you cast this spell, you summon a barrage of flaming rocks to strike your enemies from above. Each creature in a 30-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d8 bludgeoning and 2d8 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Flammable objects in the radius not being worn or carried ignite.
 Morbid. You can use your reaction to cast this spell when a creature that you can see in range is reduced to 0 hit points. If you do, the spell is automatically centered on the fallen creature, and the damage for the spell is increased to 4d8 bludgeoning and 4d8 fire damage.

name: Bump in the Night
description:
You make an unearthly, haunting sound that drains the courage from your victim. One creature of your choice within 30 ft. that can hear you must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d6 psychic damage and is frightened for one minute. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and is not frightened. A frightened creature takes an additional 1d6 psychic damage and can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect if it is successful. If you are in dim light or darkness when you cast this spell, the target has disadvantage on the original saving throw.
 Flashback. If you've already cast this spell since the end of your last long rest, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher. If you do so, each creature of your choice within 30 ft. that can hear you must make an Intelligence saving throw or suffer the effects of the spell. In addition, the initial damage increases to 8d6 and the damage to frightened creatures increases to 4d6. After doing so, you can't cast this spell again until the end of your next long rest.

name: Burning Vengeance
description:
You can use your reaction to cast this spell when a creature within range hits you with an attack. You must be aware of the attacker and able to see it to do so. You wreathe yourself in wisps of fire, thirsting for revenge. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature that attacked you, dealing 8d4 fire damage on a hit. For the duration of the spell, whenever a creature within range that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to make a ranged attack against the creature, dealing 4d4 fire damage on a hit. You can also use your reaction to make the same ranged attack against a creature whenever you cast a Necromancy spell.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage for both the initial attack and the subsequent attacks increases by 1d4.

name: Cackling Counterpart
components: V, S, M (a silver hammer worth 8000 gp; or a lock of hair and a drop of blood from the target, and a silver horn worth 1000 gp, consumed in the casting)
description:
When you cast this spell, choose a creature in range that you can see. If the target is unwilling, they must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the spell components grow and twist to become a copy of the target, an almost perfect replica. The copy has the same statistics and personality as the target, except that its hit points and alignment are the same as yours, and it does not share the target's memories. The copy acts on its own initiative and willingly obeys your commands. The copy is is actively hostile towards the original target, and will actively attack the target unless commanded otherwise. If the copy is reduced to 0 hit points, it transforms back into the spell components if a silver hammer was used, otherwise the spell components are destroyed. A creature observing the copy must make a Wisdom (Investigation) check against your spell save DC in order to determine it is not the original; a creature familiar with the target has advantage on this saving throw. The creature might also automatically determine the nature of the copy, or at least become suspicious of it, through other means, such as asking the copy questions it doesn't have the answer to but should if it were the original.
 Flashback. If you've already cast this spell since the end of your last long rest, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell using a spell slot of 9th level. If you do so, the spell no longer requires concentration, and instead creates two copies of the target. After doing so, you can't cast this spell again until the end of your next long rest.

name: Claustrophobia
description:
You instill your enemy with an insidious, crippling fear that threatens to render them powerless. Choose a creature that you can see within range, forcing them to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is struck with an unendurable fear of being closed off and put into tight spaces, and is unable to willingly enter any area that is 5 square ft. or less in size. If the target begins its turns in such an area, they must repeat the saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes frightened, and can take no actions beyond attempting to leave the enclosed space. On a success, the spell ends for the target. The target must also repeat the saving throw if they begin their turn in combat surrounded by two or fewer unoccupied spaces, with the same results on a failed or successful saving throw.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration of the spell doubles for each slot level above 4th, up to a maximum of 8 hours for a 6th level spell slot. If the spell is cast using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the spell no longer requires concentration.

name: Corpse Lunge
description:
You can use your reaction to cast this spell when a creature within range dies. The creature's Challenge Rating must be equal to or lower than (1/2) your level. If the creature doesn't have a CR, treat its level as its CR instead. Your necromantic magic quickly traps and binds the spirit of the dead creature to yourself, storing its energy for later use. If the target is a construct, the spell has no effect. Any time before the spell ends, you can use an action on your turn to transform the creature's soul into pure magical energy, launching it at a target you can see within 60 ft. of yourself. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, on a failed save taking an amount of necrotic damage equal to 1d6 x the CR of the original creature, or half as much on a success. After doing so, the captured soul is destroyed entirely, and the creature can't be resurrected except through use of the wish spell.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can instead trap the soul of any creature with a CR equal to or lower than your level. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level or higher, you can trap the soul of any creature regardless of its Challenge Rating.

name: Create Ghoulraiser
components: V, S, M (an obsidian dagger worth 1800 gp)
description: Using the dagger, you carve runes into the skin and bones of a zombie or skeleton within range, chanting in a love and sonorous voice as you do so. When you finish casting this spell, the undead creature is transformed into a ghoulraiser under your control. The GM has the statistics for the new creature. The ghoulraiser acts at the end of your turn and obeys any verbal commands you issue to it. If not commanded, the ghoulraiser takes no action.

name: Creeping Renaissance
components: V, S, M (a sliver from a tombstone that is at least 50 years old)
description:
You reach out with dual tendrils of necromantic and nature magic to bring back life to where it was lost. Roll 2d4, the total is how many corpses this spell can affect. Plant growth quickly rises to cover a number of dead bodies within a 30-foot radius of yourself, animating them in a mockery of life. The corpses must be of a humanoid or Large or smaller beast, and rise as spore servants under your control in ascending order of CR (the DM has the template for the spore servant.) The spore servants act at the end of your turn, and you can use a bonus action on your turn to verbally command any number of spore servants under you control within 60 ft. If given no commands, the spore servants take no action. The corpses stay animated for the duration of the spell or until destroyed, and can't be animated again in this way.
 Flashback. If you've already cast this spell since the end of your last long rest, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell using a spell slot of 8th-level or higher. If you do so, you can instead affect up to 4d4 corpses with the spell, and the affected radius doubles to 60 feet. After doing so, you can't cast this spell again until the end of your next long rest.

name: Curse of Death's Hold
description: You touch a creature, and that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration of the spell. The cursed creature immediately suffers one level of exhaustion, which can not be removed while the target remains cursed. All other creatures related to the target and any of the target's allies must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each long rest spent on the same plane as the target. On a failed save, an affected creature suffers one level of exhaustion, and any previous levels of exhaustion are not removed after finishing a long rest. This curse can't be removed except through the use of a 9th-level spell slot.

name: Curse of Oblivion
description: You touch a creature, and that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration of the spell. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on all ability checks made to recall specific information or memories. In addition, as long as the target remains cursed, at the end of each long rest the target loses proficiency in two randomly chosen saving throws, skills, tools, or languages. The target regains these proficiencies at the end of the next long rest, only to lose two newly chosen proficiencies. This curse can't be removed except through use of a 4th-level spell slot or higher.

name: Curse of Stalked Prey
description: You touch a creature, and that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration of the spell. Whenever the target is hit by a weapon attack, the creature that hit the target gains an additional +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls until the start of their next turn, up to a maximum bonus of +3. This bonus does not cause a creature's nonmagical attacks to become magical. This curse can't be removed except through use of a 4th-level spell slot or higher.

name: Curse of the Bloody Tome
description: You touch a creature, and that creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or become cursed for the duration of the spell. While cursed, the target suffers from a random form of short-term madness.

name: Curse of the Nightly Hunt
description:
When you cast this spell, choose up to three creatures within range that you can see. Each of those creatures must make a Wisdom saving throw, or be overcome with the spirit of the beast. Whenever a cursed creature rolls initiative after the sun has set or while in darkness, it must repeat the saving throw. On a failed save, it enters into an uncontrollable rage for 1 minute. While in this rage, the creature must use its action each turn to Attack the nearest target, and has advantage on saving throws made to resist being charmed or frightened. If the target becomes charmed or frightened, the rage immediately ends. This curse can't be removed except through use of a 5th-level spell slot or higher.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th-level or higher, the level of the spell slot required to remove the curse and the number of creatures you can target both increase by one for each slot level above 5th.

name: Curse of the Pierced Heart
description:
You touch a creature, and that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become cursed for the duration of the spell. While cursed, the target automatically takes 1d4 necrotic damage at the start of each of their turns during combat. This damage ignores resistance to necrotic damage.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher, the damage increases by 1d4 and the level of the spell slot required to remove the curse increases by one level for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Dead Weight
description: Choose a creature that you can see within range. Dark mist coalesces around their legs, eventually solidifying into a heavy, iron ball-and-chain which remains for the duration of the spell, and can not be removed. While wearing the weight, the target has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and ability checks, and can not take the Dash or Disengage action. In addition, whenever the target attempts to move, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have its movement speed reduced by half until the start of its next turn.

name: Desperate Ravings
description:
You feel yourself fall into the throes of madness, all at once losing your grip on reality and seeing more clearly than ever before. You speak three statements about the future, concerning events happening no further than 1 week from now. One of the statements is the truth, while two of the others are falsehoods. You do not automatically know which are true and which are false. The statements themselves, their level of clarity, and the events they relate to are determined by the DM. Afterwards, you become afflicted with a random form of short-term madness, also determined by the DM. While you suffer from this madness, you can not cast this spell again.
 Flashback. If you've already cast this spell since the end of your last long rest, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell using a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher. If you do so, all of the statements you speak are true, and you become afflicted with a random form of long-term madness until it is cured or until the end of your next long rest. After doing so, you can't cast this spell again until the end of your next long rest.

name: Devil's Play
components: S, M (a bottle of cooking oil)
description:
Like a devil, your hands are never idle. You splash the oil from the bottle and sparks from your fingertips ignite it, forcing each creature in a 10-foot radius surrounding you to make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Creatures which fail the saving throw begin to burn, taking 2d6 fire damage at the start of each of their turns, until a creature uses its action to smother the flames.
 Flashback. If you've already cast this spell since the end of your last long rest, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell using a spell slot of 8th-level or higher. If you do so, the initial damage increases to 10d6, and the flames on creatures that fail the saving throw can't be smothered, causing them to burn for 1 minute. After doing so, you can't cast this spell again until the end of your next long rest.

name: Divine Reckoning
components: V, S, M (a holy symbol worth at least 50 gp)
description:
You draw deeply from the well of your faith, in your darkest moment relying on the brightest light of your life. As an action on each of your turns for the spell's duration, you must hold the holy symbol aloft and choose a creature you can see within 30 ft., forcing the target to make a Constitution saving throw as blinding light shines from the symbol to land on it. If you do not, the spell automatically ends. On a failed save, the target takes 6d10 radiant damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and is not blinded. Undead creatures have disadvantage on this saving throw, and on a failed save are stunned until the end of their next turn as well as blinded. When the spell ends, the holy symbol melts away in your hands from the power channeled through it.
 Flashback. If you've already cast this spell since the end of your last long rest, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell using a spell slot of 9th level or higher. If you do, aberrations, fey, fiends, and undead all have disadvantage on the saving throw, and on a failed save are stunned until the end of their next turn as well as blinded.

name: Dream Twist
description:
Your voice is a low hum as you whisper words of magic into the ear of a sleeping creature in range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, which it can not choose to fail. On a failed save, the target begins to suffer from vivid but unsettling dreams, whose basic content is determined by you through the phrases and suggestions you whisper into their ear. If you continue this whispering for the duration of the spell, the target does not gain any benefits from their sleep, and automatically suffers from one level of exhaustion when they awake.
 Flashback. If you cast this spell on a creature that has already been subject to the spell's effect in the past 24 hours, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher. If you do, instead of the spell's normal effects, the target is prevented from gaining the benefits of a long rest at any point within 24 hours of the spell's casting.

name: Endless Ranks of the Dead
components: V, S, M (bone meal, grave ash, and diamond dust worth 1000 gp, all mixed into a potion that is consumed in the casting)
description: As you drink the disgusting slurry of this spell's material components, you feel necromantic energy wash through you from the inside out. For the spell's duration, any creature killed by an undead under your control automatically rises at the start of your next turn as a zombie under your control. Undead created in this way remain under your control indefinitely, and act at the end of your turn.

name: Feeling of Dread
components: V, S, M (a vial of cockatrice venom)
description:
Choose a point that you can see within range. The area within a 30-foot cube centered on the chosen point becomes dimly lit, extinguishing any nonmagical sources of light inside the radius, and unnatural sounds and noises emanate from within the cube. Any creature that starts its turn in the spell's radius or enters it for the first time on its turn must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened until the start of its next turn. Creatures that are deafened automatically succeed on this saving throw. When a creature fails this saving throw, you can use your reaction to cause the creature to become paralyzed until the start of its next turn instead of frightened. After doing so, the spell automatically ends.
 Flashback. If you've already cast this spell since the end of your last long rest, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell. If you do so, any creature that fails the saving throw instead becomes paralyzed until the start of its next turn. After doing so, you can't cast this spell again until the end of your next long rest.

name: Forbidden Alchemy
components: S, M (the corpse of a spellcaster and 500 gp worth of alchemical reagents, both consumed in the casting)
description:
Even though others have different ways of accessing it, you know that all magic comes from the arcane laws that govern the world, and interacting with those laws leaves a mark, even after death. As you cast this spell, you use the alchemical reagents to dissolve and diffuse the body of the spellcaster, extracting the remnant magic from the corpse and injecting it into yourself. The DM chooses four spells that the spellcaster knew in life, and you choose one of those spells. For the duration of the spell or until the end of your next long rest, you can cast the chosen spell as if you knew it and had it prepared, even if the spell is not on the Wizard spell list.
 Flashback. If you've already cast this spell since the end of your last long rest, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher. If you do, you instead gain the ability to cast all four of the spells chosen by the DM. In addition, the duration of this spell becomes indefinite, and you can cast each spell up to three times before its effects end. After doing so, you can't cast this spell again until the end of your next long rest.

name: Full Moon's Rise
components: V, S, M (a canine tooth crafted from silver, worth at least 25 gp)
description: When you finish casting this spell, the silver fang begins to glow, emitting bright light in a 30-foot radius. Choose any number of willing lycanthropes within the spell's radius. The teeth of each target chosen grow longer and sharper, causing their bite attack to deal an additional die of damage until the spell ends. Additionally, if a target would be reduced to 0 hit points while affected by this spell, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead and the effects of the spell end for it.

name: Furor of the Bitten
description:
Make a melee spell attack against a target within range. If the attack hits the target takes 1d10 piercing damage and must make a Wisdom saving throw. Whether the target succeeds or fails, its melee weapon attacks deal an additional 1d4 damage for the duration of the spell. On a failed save the target loses control of itself, and on each of its turns it must move to the nearest creature and use its action to make a melee weapon attack against that creature, if possible. If several targets are equally near, the target attacks a randomly chosen creature. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage dealt to the target increases by 1d10 and the additional damage the target deals with melee weapon attacks increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Geistflame
description:
You call on the fiery rage of the restless dead, imbuing their anger into one weapon you touch, which begins to glow white-hot with flame. For the duration of the spell, all attacks made with the weapon deal an additional 1d8 fire damage on a hit. While holding the weapon, a creature can use its action to launch a vengeful spirit from it, creating a line of fire 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. After doing so, the spell immediately ends.
 Flashback. If you've already cast this spell since the end of your last long rest, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher. If you do, attacks made with the weapon deal an additional 6d8 fire damage on a hit, and the weapon can be used to create a line of fire any number of times before the spell ends. After doing so, you can't cast this spell again until the end of your next long rest.

name: Ghostly Possession
components: S, M (a piece of shredded linen)
description:
Choose up to four willing creatures that you can see in range. Each of the chosen creatures begins to fade away, becoming faintly translucent and hovering a few inches off the ground. For the duration of the spell, each of the chosen creatures gains a flying speed equal to its movement speed, has advantage on all Dexterity (Stealth) checks and ability checks made to avoid being grappled. In addition, each of the targets becomes immune to all damage except force and psychic damage, and all attacks made by the chosen creatures deal no damage. If an affected creatures becomes grappled or takes damage, the spell's effects automatically end for that creature.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can choose one additional target for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Ghoulcaller's Chant
components: V, S, M (a carved obsidian skull, worth at least 500 gp)
description:
Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Small humanoid within range. You perform a brief ritual that imbues the target with a weak semblance of life, turning it into an undead creature. The target becomes a skeleton if you chose bones or a zombie if you chose a corpse (the GM has the creature's game statistics). Choose a simple command, less than 30 words in length. The undead creature performs the command to the best of its ability for the duration of the spell or until the task is complete. If you issue no command, the creature takes no action until given a command. Once the spell ends or once its task is complete, the magic animating the creature fades, and it becomes a corpse or pile of bones once more. When you cast this spell, you can choose two targets, but only if both have already been animated by this spell once before.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration of the spell's effect increases. At 3rd level, the duration becomes 1 hour, and at 5th level, the duration becomes 24 hours. At 7th level or higher, the spell's effects last until it is dispelled.

name: Gnaw to the Bone
description:
You touch a dead beast, dragon, or monstrosity that has been dead for no longer than 24 hours. The dead creature's flesh suddenly turns to swirling dust, leaving behind only bones. You then regain a number of hit points based on the size of the creature - 4d10 for a Small or smaller creature, 5d10 for a Medium creature, and 6d10 for a Large or larger creature.
 Flashback. If you've already cast this spell since the end of your last long rest, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher. If you do, you instead regain three times as many hit points as you normally would. After doing so, you can't cast this spell again until the end of your next long rest.

name: Grasp of Phantoms
description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. A dozen long, pale arms reach from the shadows around the target, grabbing firmly onto its clothing, equipment, hair, and anywhere else they can grasp. Until the spell ends, the target is grappled. At the start of each of its turns, the target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pushed 10 feet in the direction of your choice, and takes 2d6 psychic damage. If the target is in dim light or darkness, the psychic damage is doubled. On a successful save, the target temporarily frees itself from the effects of the spell until the start of its next turn.
 Flashback. If you've already cast this spell since the end of your last long rest, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell using a spell slot of 9th level or higher. After doing so, you can't cast this spell again until the end of your next long rest. If you do, if the target fails the Strength saving throw, the hands instead pull the target into the Shadowfell, causing it to disappear. The target reappears at the start of its next turn in the space it previously occupied, or the nearest unoccupied space. The target then takes 4d6 psychic damage, and is frightened until the start of its next turn.

name: Gruesome Deformity
components: S, M (a vial of pus from a boil)
description: You slather the pus on a willing creature's face, and as it begins to dry and crack, it flakes away to reveal that their face, neck, and shoulders have been twisted and scarred. These deformities give the target advantage on all Charisma (Intimidation) checks and disadvantage on all Charisma (Persuasion) check. In addition, the scarring grants the target a +5 bonus to Charisma (Deception) checks made to hide its true identity. When the spell ends, the target's face returns to normal, and the deformities disappear.

name: Gutter Grime
components: V, S, M (slime from an ooze and a vial of liquefied bone marrow)
description: You pour the liquid ingredients onto the ground, which grow and spread into a black pudding that appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The ooze disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The ooze is friendly to you and your allies for the duration, acts at the end of your turn, and obeys any mental commands that you issue to it (no action required). If you don't issue any commands to it, the ooze defends itself from hostile creatures, but otherwise takes no actions. Whenever the ooze reduces a Small or larger creature to 0 hit points with a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to command it to swallow the dead creature, destroying the body in the process. If you do, the ooze gains 20 hit points. Then, if the ooze has at least 100 hit points, you can command it to split into two new oozes, as if it had used the Split reaction. Any oozes created by the splitting of the original ooze remain friendly and obey any commands you issue, as if they had been summoned by the spell. Any oozes created by the splitting of the original ooze disappear when they drop to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The GM has the black pudding's statistics.

name: Harvest Pyre
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher
description: You can use your reaction to cast this spell when you finish casting another spell of 1st level or higher. You ignite the remnant magical energy in the air, creating a blazing fire. Choose a creature that you can see within range that was affected by the spell you previously cast. The target automatically takes an amount of fire damage equal to 1d6 x the level of the spell you previously cast.

name: Heartless Summoning
description: You reach into the ether and prepare to drag forth an ally, kicking and screaming if you must. The next time before this spell ends, when you cast a spell that allows you to summon other creatures, you instead summon twice as many of those creatures, except that each creature that appears has half as many hit points as it normally would.

name: Heretic's Punishment
description: When you cast this spell and as a bonus action on each of your turns for the spell's duration, choose a creature that you can see within range. A burning red light appears above the target, illuminating it and forcing it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the target takes 3d10 radiant damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a success the target takes half as much damage and is not blinded. Whether the target succeeds or fails, it then rolls 3d10. If two or more of these dice have the same result, the target must make another Constitution saving throw against the spell's effects.

name: Hysterical Blindness
description: Each creature in a 30-foot radius, including yourself, must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be blinded for the spell's duration. A blinded creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Whenever a blinded creature is hit by a melee attack or hits another creature with a melee attack, the other creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or also be blinded for the spell's duration.

name: Infernal Plunge
description: You ready yourself to draw the life force from your enemies, transforming it into pure power. The next time you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a spell or attack before this spell ends, you can use your reaction to cast a spell of 3rd level or lower that you know and have prepared without expending a spell slot.

name: Intangible Virtue
description: As a reward for their service, you offer a noble strength to the allies that you summon from the ether. The next time you cast a spell that allows you to summon other creatures before this spell ends, you can instead cast that spell as a bonus action, and the summoned creatures each gain a +1 bonus to all attack and damage rolls for as long as they remain your ally.

name: Into the Maw of Hell
components: V, S, M (a piece of volcanic rock worth at least 250 gp carved to resemble a fiend, consumed in the casting)
description: Choose a creature that you can see within range. You whisper a few words in Infernal, and as the rock in your hands begins to grow unbearably hot, you crush it into pieces. The ground opens up beneath the target, exposing a pit of sizzling magma and forcing the target to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a success, the target leaps into an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks. On a failed save, the target plummets into the pit and falls into the magma, immediately taking 10d10 fire damage. A creature within 5 feet of the pit can attempt to pull the trapped creature free by making a Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC, freeing the target on a success At the start of its next turn, the target can repeat the saving throw or make a Strength (Athletics) check, its choice. On a success, the target successfully climbs free of the pit, into an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet. On a failed save, the target remains in the magma, taking an additional 3d10 fire damage, and the entrance to the pit closes, trapping the target inside. Unless the target has some other method of leaving the pit, such as digging through the earth or teleporting out, it remains trapped and continues to take 3d10 fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

name: Kieryluk's Unbridled Curiosity
description: You turn violence into a proxy for your curiosity, gaining information by any means necessary. For the duration of the spell, you can use an action on your turn to make a melee spell attack against any creature within 5 feet, striking out with a dagger or other cutting instrument made of pure energy. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 psychic damage and must make a Charisma saving throw. If the target fails the saving throw, you learn one piece of information about it. You can determine the nature of the information you want to learn, but not the exact information discovered. For instance, you might choose to learn a secret the target knows, but the DM determines what secret you discover; or you might try to learn one of the target's ability scores, but you are not able to choose which one.

name: Moonmist
description: When you cast this spell, a cloud of shining mist rises up from the ground around you, reflecting a gold and silver light. This mist remains for the spell's duration, and covers an area within a 60-foot radius. Each creature that begins its turn within the mist's radius must make a Constitution saving throw.Creatures that aren't shapechangers that fail this saving throw have disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks made until the start of their next turn. Shapechangers that fail this saving throw automatically transform, even if they could not normally. A shapechanger that transforms this way remains transformed until the spell ends.

name: Night Terrors
components: V, S, M (a bit of grave dust and an animal skull)
description:
You infect the dreams of a creature with an unnerving, creeping, and exhausting dread. For the duration of the spell, whenever the target begins to sleep it must make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the spell ends. On a failed save, its dreams during sleep are filled with lurking terrors and horrifying visages, leaving it tossing and turning and preventing it from gaining the benefits of a long rest. If the target fails the saving throw by 10 or more, it also suffers from one level of exhaustion after waking.If a creature affected by this spell is woken in the middle of its sleep, it must immediately make the saving throw again. On a success, the target takes 3d6 psychic damage and the spell ends. On a failed save, the target takes 3d6 psychic damage and the spell's effects continue, forcing it to make the saving throw again the next time it falls asleep.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the spell's duration is doubled.

name: Spidery Grasp
components: V, S, M (a set of spider's legs)
description: Your fingertips warp into spinnerets, letting you spin webs of spider's silk at will. For the duration of the spell, you can use an action on each of your turns to shoot webbing from your fingertips, wrapping it around a creature you can see within 30 ft., and forcing the target to succeed on a Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced by 10 ft. A target whose speed is reduced in this way can't move more than 30 ft. from you, and if a target's speed is reduced to 0 ft. in this way, they become restrained until the webbing is removed. The webbing has 15 hit points, immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage, and vulnerability to slashing and fire damage. A creature can remove the webbing by using an action to make a Strength (Athletics) check with a DC equal to your spell save DC, or by reducing the webbing to 0 hit points. You can also use the webbing to move around, using an action to launch the webbing at a point you can see within 30 ft. and pulling yourself towards that point. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

name: Wreath of Geists
description: As you cast this spell, a swirling ring of tormented souls appears around you, defending you and growing as you cut down more foes to add to their ranks. For the duration of the spell, you gain a +1 bonus to AC. Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points, this bonus increases by 1, up to a maximum of +3. In addition, whenever you would be hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by half. Doing so reduces the bonus to AC provided by the spell by 1. If this bonus is reduced to 0, the spell immediately ends.

name: Rite of Replication
components: V, S, M (a number of pearls equal to the number of copies being made, each worth at least 500 gp, consumed in the casting)
description:
Magic flows through your fingertips as you imprint all of the information about the target onto the pearl. After doing so, the pearl rapidly expands and shapes itself into an exact duplicate of the target in an unoccupied space of your choice within 10 feet. The copy has the same AC, ability scores, proficiencies, equipment, and remaining hit points as the target. If the copy is summoned while in the middle of combat, it immediately rolls initiative as normal. If the target can cast spells the copy can do so as well, but any spells the copy casts uses the target's own spell slots. The copy is aware that it is a duplicate created by you, but shares the same affiliation towards you as the original target, and if the original target is hostile towards you, the copy will be as well. If the copy is reduced to 0 hit points or the spell ends, it immediately disappears, as its body disintegrates into salt water and seaweed.
 Kicker. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th-level, it instead creates five copies of the target. Each copy has the same statistics as listed above.

name: Act of Treason
components: V, M (a heliotrope stone worth at least 150 gp, consumed in the casting)
description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. At the start of its turn, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a haze of red settles over its mind, filling its thoughts with uncontrollable anger toward another creature of your choice within range that it can see. For the duration of the spell, the target becomes hostile to the chosen creature, and must use its action on its turn to attack that creature.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the spell's duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 3rd. The target can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the spell's effect on a success.

name: Angelic Blessing
description: Feathery wings sprout from the back of a creature of your choice that you can see within range, and their body is illuminated with holy radiance. Until the start of your next turn, the target gains a flying speed of 60 feet, resistance to nonmagical damage, and its weapon attacks all deal an additional 1d8 radiant damage on a hit. If the target would be reduced to 0 hit points before the spell ends, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

name: Bitterblossom
components: V, M (a drop of your own blood and a jewel of any type worth at least 50 gp, both consumed in the casting)
classes: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Ranger, Warlock, Wizard
description: You craft a magical deal with a minor court of the feywild, trading riches and blood for assistance in a time of need. When you cast this spell, you summon four pixies or sprites (your choice of which), which appear in unoccupied spaces of your choice that you can see within 10 feet.The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your allies. In combat, they share your initiative count, and act immediately at the end of your turn in the order of your choice. You can communicate telepathically with the summoned creatures, even if you do not share a language, and do their best to obey any mental commands you issue (no action required). If you don't issue any commands, the summoned creatures remain within 30 feet of you at all times, and in combat defend themselves and each other, but otherwise take no actions.For the duration of the spell, you can use an action on each of your turns to summon additional fey from the same court. When you do, an additional 1d4 pixies or sprites (your choice of which) appear in random unoccupied spaces that you can see within 10 feet, and you lose 5 hit points for each fey summoned this way.If a pixie or sprite summoned this way is reduced to 0 hit points, it is not killed, and instead disappears, returning to its home in the Feywild.

name: Mayael's Aria
components: V, M (a hyacinth flower, a pearl worth 500 gp, ruby dust worth 1000 gp, and an emerald worth 2000 gp, all consumed in the casting)
description: When you cast this spell, you begin a song written ages ago, when the world was still a primal place. Choose a creature that you can see within range and that can hear you. At the beginning of each of your turns for the duration of the spell, the target gets a cumulative +1 bonus to its attack rolls, and all of its melee attacks deal an additional cumulative 1d6 damage. At the beginning of each of your turns, you must use your action to continue the song. At the start of each of your turns, if the creature can not hear you for any reason, or if you do not use your action to continue the song, the spell ends, and any bonuses the creature received from the song fade away. If the song continues for 1 full minute, at the end of your turn, the target transforms into a solar, and its statistics, including its mental ability scores, are replaced with those of its new form. It retains its personality and alignment, and any equipment it is wearing or carrying grows to match its new form. This transformation lasts for 10 minutes or until the target uses a bonus action to end it, after which the target suffers one level of exhaustion.

name: Goldhawk's Spell Absorption
casting_time: 1 reaction, which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell
description:
You attempt to absorb the magical power of a spell being cast by another creature. If the creature is casting a spell of 6th level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect, and you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to 5 x the level of the spell being cast.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the absorbed spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

name: Blustersquall
casting_time: 1 reaction, which you take when a creature you can see within range makes a melee attack against you
description:
You kick up a brief but powerful gust of wind, attempting to disrupt the creature's attack. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone, and suffer disadvantage on the attack roll.
 Overload. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, instead each creature of your choice within range must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone. In addition, the target's attack automatically misses.

name: Cyclonic Rift
description:
A large whirlwind appears above you, crackling with magical energy. One creature of your choice that you can see within range must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be lifted into the cloud and thrown 1d10 x 5 feet away from its original location in a random direction, landing prone and taking 1d8 bludgeoning damage for every 5 feet it was thrown in this way. If the target would strike an object or creature, its movement is halted, and both take the bludgeoning damage.
 Overload. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can instead target any number of creatures you can see within range, and each creature is thrown 4d10 x 5 feet away from its original location. You determine the order in which creatures are thrown by the spell.

name: Electrickery
description:
You unleash a burst of electricity in a 10-foot radius around yourself, attempting to stun and confuse nearby threats. One creature of your choice within the radius must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 1d10 lightning damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. A creature that fails this saving throw is also blinded until the start of its next turn.
 Overload. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, instead each creature within the radius suffers the spell's effects. In addition, the lightning damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Ancestral Recall
components: V, S, M (a spellcasting focus worth at least 100 gp, consumed in the casting)
description: Like using a minnow to bait a shark, you spend a first level spell slot to drag forth incredible energy from the magical weave surrounding the world. When you use this spell, you may recover up to three expended spell slots, in any combination less than or equal to 3rd level. This can be three 1st level spell slots, one 2nd level spell slot and a 1st level spell slot, or one 3rd level spell slot.

name: Animate Artifact
description: You touch one magical item to which you or an ally are currently attuned. The item animates for the duration of the spell, gaining a fly speed of 30 feet, and acting on your turn. Items animated in this way will follow within 5 feet of you unless otherwise commanded, and any item which is more than 30 feet away from you at the end of your turn becomes inanimate once again. As a bonus action on your turn, you can command the item to perform a specific action, but otherwise it will perform its intended function for the nearest ally. Shields and armor will defend allies, weapons and wands will attack enemies, and other magical items will simply attempt to act as expected. Shields and armor defending an ally grant that creature a +2 bonus to AC, as well as any benefits normally conferred from wearing the item. Weapons will automatically swing at any hostile creature which enters their range, dealing damage as appropriate. Attacks made by these items are made using your spell attack bonus. You are unable to command an item to perform something it would not normally be capable of doing, such as commanding a weapon to defend an ally, or a set of armor or shield to attack an enemy.

name: Animate Dead
components: V, S, M (a drop of blood, a piece of flesh, or a sliver of skin from yourself)
description: This spell works exactly like the animate dead spell found on page 212 of the Player's Handbook, except for the changes presented below. As an additional cost to animate the skeleton or zombie, you must take 1d12 necrotic damage, reducing your maximum hit points for the duration of the spell by the amount of damage taken. The creature which you animate has disadvantage on all attack rolls.

name: Animate Wall
components: V, S, M (a shard or splinter of the wall which you are attempting to animate)
description:
You touch a non-magical section of wall, placing it under your control. This spell affects a section of wall no larger than a 5 foot cube. For the duration of the spell, you may use a bonus action to shape the wall into any form you choose which would not cause it to collapse. For instance, you may shape a hole into the wall to move through, or may use the wall to strike out at targets on the other side. You may not stretch a wall more than 5 feet beyond its original size and shape. Any attacks made against targets using part of the wall are made using your spell attack bonus, and deal 1d4 bludgeoning damage.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may affect another 5 foot cube of wall for every slot level above 2nd. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may target magical walls cast using a spell slot of the same level, without requiring material components.

name: Anson's Instant Lure
description: Your touch causes a nearby creature or object to become an irresistible target. If you target a creature with this spell, whenever a creature hostile to the target enters within 30 feet of the target, they must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is compelled to approach as close as possible to the target. If the creature is able to attack the target, they are magically compelled to do so on their turn. The creature may use an action to end this effect on itself with a successful Wisdom saving throw. If you target an object with this spell, all creatures other than yourself and two others within 120 feet of the object which can see the object must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or become magically compelled to stay as close to the object as possible. If the target of this spell, whether it is a creature of object, leaves the sight of any creature magically compelled to approach it, the effect on the creature automatically ends.

name: Anson's Quiet Pass
description: For the duration of the spell, you have advantage on all Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to avoid being detected, and may take the Hide action even when you are not behind cover. If you are detected, the spell automatically ends.

name: Anson's Short-Term Paralyzation
components: V, S, M (a bit of venom from any venomous creature)
description: Make a spell attack roll against a creature within range. If the attack hits, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become paralyzed for 1d4 rounds. The creature may make another Constitution saving throw at the start of each of their turns, ending the effect on themselves on a success.

name: Armageddon
components: V, S, M (a piece of obsidian)
description: Each creature in a 60 foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, taking 18d8 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The area of the sphere is then considered to be difficult terrain, as the heat from the spell twists, warps, and melts the ground. Any creature which failed their saving throw becomes stuck in the resulting wasteland, and is considered to be grappled. A creature may escape by using their action to make a DC 22 Strength (Athletics) check. Another creature may use their action to free a trapped creature by making a DC 18 Strength check.

name: Aspect of Wolf
components: V, S, M (a twig from a pine tree)
description:
You touch a creature, granting it a +2 bonus to Dexterity and Wisdom for the spell's duration, as well as advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track other creatures, and advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to hear other creatures.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3, and the target gains advantage on all Wisdom based ability checks. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the bonus increases to +4, the target gains advantage on all Wisdom based ability checks, and advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

name: Bad Moon
description:
When you cast this spell, all non-hostile undead creatures within 60 feet of you gain advantage on all saving throws and the first attack roll they make each round, for the duration of the spell. Each round, you may grant one non-hostile undead creature within 60 feet of you 1d8 temporary hit points for the duration of the spell.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 7th level spell slot or higher, the temporary hit points granted increase to 1d10. When you cast this spell using a 9th level spell slot, the temporary hit points granted increase to 1d12.

name: Balance
description: When you cast this spell, you may expend any number of spell slots as you do so. All creatures in a 30 foot radius sphere centered on a point within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. All creatures within the radius which fail their saves lose spell slots equal in level to the combined level of spell slots sacrificed during the casting of this spell, beginning with spell slots of the lowest available level. If the remaining combined levels of the spell slots sacrificed to cast this spell are lower than the lowest level of the spell slot available to a target, the spell has no further effect. The spell slot used to cast this spell does not apply to the total level of spell slots sacrificed. For instance, if three 3rd level spell slots are sacrificed when this spell is cast, the total combined level of spell slots sacrificed is considered to be nine. If a creature has four 1st level spell slots, two 2nd level spell slots, and one 3rd level spells slot available to them, the spell will first eliminate their five 1st level spells slots, then their 2nd level spell slots, and will then stop- because it no longer has enough energy left to eliminate a 3rd level spell slot.

name: Berserk
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when a creature within range makes an attack roll
description: When a creature in range makes an attack roll, you may use your reaction to cast this spell, granting the attacking creature the raw strength and power of a wild beast. The target doubles the attack and damage rolls for the attack. If the attack reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the target of the spell may make an additional attack this turn. After making the attack, the target automatically takes 6d8 necrotic damage. If the target reduced a creature to 0 hit points with the attack, they take 12d8 necrotic damage instead.

name: Black Ward
components: V, S, M (a lock of hair from a warlock)
classes: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard
description: You use the remnant magic in the material component to shield the target from spells of a similar origin, protecting them from all such danger despite the variations found within. For the duration of the spell, a mark reminiscent of a horned skull appears somewhere on the target's skin, and the target is immune to all damage and effects from spells and other magical abilities of warlocks.

name: Blaze of Glory
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when an ally is targeted by an attack
components: V, S, M (a small metal shield)
description: You may cast this spell when an ally within range becomes the target of an attack. When you cast this spell, the target gains the features of the Sentinel feat until the end of your next turn. In addition, the target may take any number of reactions until the end of their next turn.

name: Blessing
description: When you cast this spell, choose an ally within range. If you're of a good alignment, a thin beam of radiant light stretches between you, before quickly fading away. If you're of an evil alignment, a tangled rope of darkness connects you both before fading. For the duration of the spell, you may use a bonus action to grant the target advantage on the next attack roll they make against a creature within 15 feet of you.

name: Blue Elemental Blast
casting_time: 1 reaction taken when a target casts a spell
components: V, M (a drop of unsalted water)
description: You may cast this spell when another creature within range casts a spell. When you cast this spell, if the target spellcaster was a sorcerer, they must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target's spell is countered and the spell slot is lost. If the spellcaster is not a sorcerer, they must instead make a Wisdom saving throw, taking 3d6 psychic damage on a failed save.

name: Blue Ward
classes: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock
description: You use the remnant magic found within the spellbook to shield a target for the duration from all damage and effects caused by spells cast by Wizards.

name: Braingeyser
description: When you cast this spell, you must expend an additional spell slot of any level.
