description:
Choose up to three willing creatures you can see within range. For the spell's duration, you and each of those creatures gain a number of benefits. These benefits last for the spell's duration, or until a chosen creature is knocked unconscious or killed, or travels to a different plane of existence, at which point the spell's effects end for that creature, but not the others. The spell ends for all creatures if you are knocked unconscious or killed, if you travel to a different plane, or if you lose concentration or choose to end the spell.
 You establish a telepathic link with the chosen creatures, which allows you to communicate with them regardless of distance, though they can not communicate telepathically with each other.
 You can use a bonus action to automatically determine the location of each of the chosen creatures.
 As an action, you can see through the eyes of one of the chosen creatures and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the target has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.
 All creatures under the spell's effects immediately know if the spell ends for one of the chosen creatures, and which creature, though not the reason the effects ended.
 Choose one spell that you know and have prepared of 3rd level or below. For the duration, each of the chosen creatures can cast that spell a number of times equal to your spellcasting modifier. The spell uses your own spell save DC and spell attack bonus when cast.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can choose one additional creature to receive the spell's benefits, and the level of the spell chosen for the last benefit increases by one, for each slot level above 4th.

name: Necrotic Wound
components: V, S, M (a vial of poison, consumed in the casting)
description:
As part of the casting of this spell, you whisper a few words and apply the vial of poison to one weapon that you are holding. The next time you hit a creature with an attack using that weapon before the end of your next turn, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the target takes an additional 2d6 poison damage and an additional 2d6 necrotic damage, or half as much on a success. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it automatically dies.
 Undergrowth. When you cast this spell, the additional poison and necrotic damage each increase by 1d6 for every creature that has failed its saving throw against the spell since the end of your last long rest.

name: Quasiduplicate
description:
You create an illusory duplicate of yourself, which appears in your space and mimics your movements and actions. For the duration, whenever you cast a spell the duplicate automatically casts one cantrip of your choice that you know. The spell attack bonus and spell save DC for the cantrip are equal to your own. In addition, whenever you cast a spell that requires you to maintain concentration on its effects, you can instead have the duplicate maintain concentration for you. If you take damage, you must still succeed on a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on that spell's effects, as well as any spell that you are concentrating on yourself. The spell automatically ends and the duplicate disappears if you are knocked unconscious or killed.
 Jump-Start. When you cast this spell, you can choose to expend an additional spell slot of the same level. If you do, you can cast the spell an additional time as part of the same action. Doing so creates a second illusory duplicate, allowing you to gain the benefits of the spell's effects twice. After doing so, you can not cast this spell again until the end of your next long rest.

name: March of the Machines
components: V, S, M (the helmet from a suit of plate armor)
description: You summon a suit of animated armor, which appears in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. The summoned armor uses the statistics found in the Monster Manual, with the exception of being able to make two attacks per round. The animated armor is friendly to you and your companions, acts at the end of each of your turns, and you may use a bonus action on your turn to mentally command the armor, which follows any orders which you give it. If the armor is not given a command, it acts only to defend itself or you. The animated armor can be given any simple or martial weapon to use in place of its normal slam attacks. If the animated armor is reduced to 0 hit points it immediately dies, and a new suit of animated armor is automatically summoned 1d4 rounds later in a random unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.

name: Curse of Leeches
description: Choose a creature you can see within range. Black ink clouds the creature's eyes, forcing it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends. On a failed save, the ink spreads, becoming a mass of writhing leeches. Constructs, oozes, plants, and undead automatically succeed on this saving throw.If it is day, the leeches attach themselves to the target's skin, siphoning away its life and magically transferring it to you. While the leeches are attached to the target, it is blinded. At the start of each of the target's turns, it automatically takes 2d12 necrotic damage, and you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt this way.If it is night, the mass of leeches transform at the end of your next turn, becoming a leeching lurker, which falls off of the target and into a randomly chosen unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The leeching lurker is friendly to you and your allies, and obeys any commands you mentally issue to it (no action required). Your GM has the creature's statistics. The leeching lurker dies when the spell ends or when it is reduced to 0 hit points, quickly withering away into a pile of viscous slime.

name: Galvanic Iteration
description:
You duplicate the effects of your own magic precisely, extending the reach of your arcane web. The next time you cast a spell which has only one target before the start of your next turn, you can choose an additional target within that spell's range. If the spell requires you to make an attack roll, you must make separate attack rolls for both the original target and the new target.
 Flashback. If you've already cast this spell since the end of your last long rest, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell. If you do, you can instead choose two additional targets for the next spell you cast which normally has only one target. Both of the new targets must be within range of the spell. After doing so, you can't cast this spell again until the end of your next long rest.

name: Join the Dance
components: V, S, M (a crown of woven branches)
description:
You summon two spectral revelers, who dance and weave around you, working to protect you from dark forces. The spirits take the form of humanoid creatures the same race as you. Whenever you take damage from a spell or magical ability, you can use your reaction to interpose a spirit between you and the effect, causing the spirit to take damage instead. If the damage reduces the spirit to 0 hit points, it vanishes, and you take any remaining damage. Each spirit has hit points equal to 5 x your spellcasting modifier, and is immune to necrotic and poison damage.In addition, the spirits summoned using this spell count as allies for the purpose of spells with the coven tag.
 Flashback. If you've already cast this spell since the end of your last long rest, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher. If you do, you instead summon four spirits, and the duration of the spell is increased to 1 hour. After doing so, you can't cast this spell again until the end of your next long rest.

name: Olivia's Midnight Ambush
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when a creature within range makes an attack or cast a spell
description: As a creature attempts to make an attack or cast a spell, you take their momentary distraction and turn it to your own advantage. When you cast this spell, you teleport to a different unoccupied space of your choice within 5 feet of the creature. If the target was making an attack or casting a spell with you as the target, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or else the attack misses or the spell fails.If it is nighttime, after you teleport, you may immediately make a single weapon attack against that creature as part of the same reaction.

name: Ritual of Hope
components: V, S, M (a wooden mask painted with magical inks costing 150 gp, carved to resemble a bear, elk, fox, or wolf)
description:
Placing the mask used as the spell's material component on your face, you invoke a protective incantation, warding yourself and those near you against harm. For the spell's duration, you emanate a 15-foot radius aura of magic that grants yourself and allies creatures in the aura a benefit determined by the shape of the mask:
 Bear. Advantage on Strength-based ability checks and saving throws made to avoid being frightened.
 Elk. Advantage on Dexterity-based skill checks and a bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks equal to your spellcasting modifier.
 Fox. Advantage on Intelligence-based ability checks and saving throws made to avoid being charmed.
 Wolf. Advantage on Wisdom-based ability checks and a bonus to Wisdom (Perception) checks equal to your spellcasting modifier.
 Coven. If there are two or more allies within 5 feet of you when you cast this spell, the radius of the spell's effect increases to 30 feet, and the duration increases to 1 hour.

name: Rotten Reunion
components: V, S, M (a bit of dead skin and a drop of blood)
description:
This spell creates an undead servant, though one greatly weakened, and held together only by a minimum of magic. Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Small humanoid within range. Your spell imbues the target with a foul mimicry of life, raising it as an undead creature. The target becomes a skeleton if you chose bones or a zombie if you chose a corpse (the GM has the creature's game statistics). However, the animated creature has only 1 hit point, and can not gain temporary hit points. If reduced to 0 hit points, it automatically dies.On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 60 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.The creature is under your control for the spell's duration. When the spell ends, the magic animating the creature fails, and it immediately dies. A creature previously animated by this spell can be animated again. You can extend the duration of the spell by an additional 6 hours by casting it again on the same target, before the duration of the previous casting ends.
 Flashback. If you've already cast this spell since the end of your last long rest, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher. If you do, the creature is animated with the normal number of hit points, and the duration of the spell increases to 12 hours. After doing so, you can't cast this spell again until the end of your next long rest.

name: Secrets of the Key
classes: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
description:
You gain a clue die, which is a d6. Whenever you make an Intelligence or Wisdom ability check or make a spell attack, you can use your reaction to expend a clue die, rolling the die and adding the result to the ability check or attack roll.You lose all unused clue dice whenever you finish a long rest.
 Flashback. If you've already cast this spell since the end of your last long rest, you can instead choose to cast it as a Flashback spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher. If you do, you instead gain a number of clue dice equal to the level of the spell slot used to cast the spell. After doing so, you can't cast this spell again until the end of your next long rest.

name: Pyromatics
description:
A small missile of fire streaks from your hand to strike a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 3d10 fire damage.
 Replicate. When you cast this spell, you can choose to expend any number of spell slots of 2nd level or higher. For each additional spell slot expended in this way, you create an additional missile, which you launch at a creature of your choice within range. Make a separate attack roll for each missile.

name: Mimeofacture
components: V, M (a silver mirror, worth at least 50 gp)
description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. An illusory copy of that creature leaps from the mirror, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice within 5 feet. The copy has the same statistics as the original, except that it has half as many hit points, does not have any class features that the target has, and can not cast spells. The copy acts at the end of your turn, and obeys any verbal commands you issue to it (no action required). The copy immediately disappears once the spell ends, if it enters the area of an antimagic field, if the target is knocked unconscious or killed, or if the copy is reduced to 0 hit points.
 Replicate. When you cast this spell, you can choose to expend any number of spell slots of 8th level or higher. For each additional spell slot expended in this way, you summon one additional copy of the target.

name: Thunderheads
components: V, S, M (a rod of metal 1 foot in length)
description:
A cloud of dark-blue smoke begins to take shape at a point you can see within range, crackling with static and marked with a grimacing face. The cloud fills a radius of 10 feet and has a height of 20 feet. When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. Whenever an affected creature attempts to enter the cloud or move while inside the cloud's radius, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d6 lightning damage and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of the turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and its speed is unaffected. If you end your turn more than 60 feet from the cloud, it breaks apart, vanishing into the air.
 Replicate. When you cast this spell, you can choose to expend any number of spell slots of 4th level or higher. For each additional spell slot expended in this way, you summon an additional cloud at another point of your choice. A creature can only be affected by one cloud each turn.

name: Aggressive Instinct
source: Global Series_ Jiang Yanggu _ Mu Yanling
description: Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. That target can choose to use its reaction to make a single melee weapon attack with advantage against a target of its choice within reach.

name: Angelic Destiny
components: V, S, M (a feather from a celestial, a pearl worth at least 50 gp, and a piece of ivory carved with the image of an angel, all consumed in the casting)
description:
You touch a willing creature, infusing their essence with divine light. For the duration of the spell, the target is transformed into a celestial. This transformation is marked by a number of effects:
 The target grows large, feathery wings which grant it a flying speed of 40 feet.
 Divine radiance shields the target from harm, granting it a +2 bonus to AC, immunity to necrotic and radiant damage, and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical sources.
 Once per turn, when the target hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can choose to deal an additional 3d8 radiant damage.
 The target's skin glows with heavenly light, shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius around the target. Any creature friendly to the target that begins its turn in this radius automatically regains a number of hit points equal to the target's Charisma modifier. The target can choose to suppress or activate this ability at will, causing the light to disappear or reappear.
 If the target is reduced to 0 hit points or killed, it immediately regains a number of hit points equal to half its maximum, and becomes fully conscious. Afterwards, the spell immediately ends.

name: Accelerated Mutation
description: Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Your magic suffuses the target, rapidly altering their essence and causing strange and unpredictable changes in their physiology.At the start of each of the target's turns, it is transformed into a random creature of a CR equal to 2 + the target's own, up to a maximum of 20. If the target does not have a CR, use its level instead. While transformed, the target's statistics, except for its mental ability scores, are replaced with those of its new form. If the target's new form would allow it to cast spells, any spells it casts automatically end when it transforms again. The target reverts to its original form when the spell ends, or if it is knocked unconscious or killed.

name: ﻿Domino
description:
With a wave of your hand, you interlock the destinies of previously unconnected beings. Choose two creatures that you can see within range. Each of the targets must make a Wisdom saving throw. They have disadvantage on the save if they are unaware of your presence. If both targets fail the saving throw, they become linked. Whenever one linked creature takes damage or becomes subject to a condition, all other linked creatures automatically take the same amount of damage of the same type or suffer the same condition.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each level of the spell slot above 3rd.

name: Doppelganger
description:
When you cast this spell, you summon an illusory duplicate of yourself in any open space within range where you would normally be able to stand. The duplicate is tangible, has 5 hit points, and uses your Armor Class and saving throws. The copy acts immediately after you in initiative order, and is unable to take any action other than the Dash action. The duplicate immediately flees from combat on its turn. If the copy is reduced to 0 hit points, it collapses prone, and any creature which interacts with it may make a Wisdom saving throw to see through the illusion. The duplicate disappears at the end of the spell’s duration.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the copy may make a single melee or ranged weapon attack on its turn that you are capable of performing. This attack uses your attack modifier, and if the attack would hit, the target instead takes 1d6 psychic damage.

name: Far Reach
description:
A mass of tendrils stretch from your hand to any unoccupied space within range, and then pulls you to the target location. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may use the spell to target objects that you can see within range, pulling them towards you. If the object is being worn or carried, the creature in possession of the object must succeed on a Strength saving throw, or the object is forcibly taken from their possession. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you may target creatures that you can see within range. A targeted creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled directly to you, landing prone in the nearest unoccupied space between you and the creature’s original location. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

name: Mesmerize
description:
You summon a spirit from the void at a point you can see within range. When the spirit appears, all creatures within 15 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or spend their next turn staring at the spirit, incapacitated.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration of the spell increases by 1 round for each level of the spell slot above 2nd.

name: Shadow Walk
description:
For the duration of the spell, you and everything you are wearing and carrying take on the form of a smoky, shadowy presence. When you make an attack, or are reduced to 0 hit points while in shadow form, the spell ends. While in shadow form, you can not cast spells, you advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in dim light and you are invisible while in darkness. When you take the Attack action, you may make a single melee spell attack, which deals 3d8 necrotic damage plus your spellcasting modifier on a hit. In addition, when attacking a target that is surprised or has not yet acted in initiative, your attacks deal double damage.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, when you take the Attack action, you may make an additional melee spell attack for each level of the spell slot above 4th.

name: Boulder Salvo
description:
You launch a volley of heavy rocks at a target of your choice that you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 8d10 bludgeoning damage and must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.
 Surge. If you or an ally already cast a spell since the start of the previous turn, you can instead cast this spell using a 3rd-level spell slot as a bonus action. If you do, the spell deals 4d10 damage instead.

name: Fall of the Titans
description:
Choose two creatures that you can see within range that are within 40 feet of each other. A gout of scorching flame bursts from each of your palms, racing toward the targets. Make a ranged spell attack against each target, dealing 8d6 fire damage on a hit. If you or an ally already cast a spell since the start of the previous turn, this spell deals 12d6 fire damage on a hit instead.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, it deals an additional 2d6 damage for each slot level above 6th.

name: Didn't Say Please
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when you see a creature within 30 feet of you casting a spell
description:
You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell fails and has no effect. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect, and it must make the Charisma saving throw or be unable to speak.If a creature's spell is countered in this way, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be unable to speak for 1 minute. The target can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to one level lower than the level of the spell slot you used.

name: Giant Stomp
components: V, M (a pinch of bonemeal and a large rock)
description:
Your muscles and bones stretch and swell, temporarily increasing your size by one category. You then strike out, attempting to crush a creature within 5 feet of you that is at least one size smaller with your oversized hand or foot. The target takes 2d10 bludgeoning damage and must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. You then revert to your previous size.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 4th. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, your size instead increases by two categories, allowing you to crush larger creatures.

name: Swift End
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when you become the target of a melee attack
description: As your foe's weapon swings towards you, you strain your muscles, empowering them with necromantic energy in the hopes of striking before their blow can land. As part of the reaction used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack with a weapon against your attacker, otherwise the spell fails. On a hit, the attack deals an additional die of damage, and the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of your next turn. If the target becomes stunned in this way, it's attack against you automatically fails. If the attack misses, you instead take 2d10 necrotic damage, and the attack against you continues as normal.

name: Turn into a Pumpkin
components: V, S, M (a piece of a pumpkin, such as a seed or stem)
description:
Tendrils of green vines begin to sprout from one creature or nonmagical object of your choice that you can see within range, as it slowly turns a deep shade of orange. If the target is an unwilling creature, it must make a Wisdom saving throw to avoid the effect. The spell has no effect on a shapechanger or a target with 0 hit points. If the target fails the saving throw or the target is an object, it is transformed into a pumpkin. The transformation lasts for the duration, or if the target is a creature, until the target is reduced to 0 hit points or killed. While in the form of a pumpkin, the target has AC 5, 10 hit points, and is incapacitated and entirely unaware of its surroundings. When it reverts to its normal form, the target returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If the target is a creature and it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked unconscious. If the target is an object and it is reduced to 0 hit points while transformed, it is destroyed and remains in the form of a pumpkin indefinitely. If the target is a creature, its gear melds into its new form. The creature can't activate, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.
 Adamant. When you cast this spell, if you cast it as a Wizard spell, you also gain one Food Die, which is a d8. You can use an action on your turn to spend one or more Food Dice. For each Food Die spent in this way, you roll the die and regain a number of hit points equal to the result.

name: Act on Impulse
components: V, S, M (three rubies, each worth 50 gp, consumed in the casting)
description:
When you cast this spell, choose up to three 1st-level spells that you know. The chosen spells must have a casting time of 1 action or 1 bonus action. As part of the action of casting this spell, you can then cast those three spells, in the order of your choice. When you cast these spells, you must still expend spell slots as normal, and can only cast them at 1st level.
 At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the chosen spells can be of either 1st or 2nd level.

name: Adamant Will
description:
Your magic coalesces into a exceptionally-crafted, shining shield, which appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. The shield is ephemeral, and can't be affected physically in any way. For the spell's duration, whenever an allied creature within 15 feet of the shield takes damage, that damage is reduced by 1d4. If at any time during the spell's duration an allied creature within 15 feet of the shield would be reduced to 0 hit points, that creature can use it's reaction to expend the shield's magic, causing their hit points to instead become an amount equal to the maximum possible die roll of the shield, and causing the shield to disappear, ending the spell.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage prevented by the shield increases to 1d6; at 6th level or higher it becomes 1d8; and at 8th level it becomes 1d10.

name: Adventurous Impulse
description:
As you cast this spell, choose a creature you can see within range, and a point you can see within range. A shimmering field of magical force appears, enclosing the chosen point in a 20-foot radius. The target creature must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target can't willingly cross the exterior boundary of the barrier. If the target is inside of the barrier, it must use its movement on each of its turns to move away from the origin of the spell's effect, until it is on the outside of the barrier. If an affected creature starts its turn inside the radius of the barrier, or within 5 feet of the barrier's exterior, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of creatures you can choose to be affected increases by one for each slot level above 1st.

name: Ancient Animus
components: V, M (the bark of a yew tree)
description: Choose both an allied creature and a hostile creature that you can see within range and that are no more than 30 feet from each other. The allied creature gains a number of temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting modifier. Then both targets take psychic damage equal to 1d8 + the other target's Strength modifier.

name: Arbor Armament
components: V, S, M (an arrow crafted from oak wood)
description:
As you cast this spell, choose a weapon that you can see within range. The target weapon begins to shift and warp as wood and bark quickly grow over it, transforming the weapon in a magical longbow. The range for attack rolls made with this weapon is 600 feet, and attacks made with the longbow ignore cover and do not have disadvantage as a result of distance. In addition, all attacks made with the longbow deal an additional 1d4 piercing damage.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the range of attacks made with the longbow increases by 25 feet and the additional piercing damage increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Arcane Flight
classes: Bard, Druid, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
description:
Your touch transforms an otherwise ordinary animal into a magical one, causing them to sprout glowing wings and take flight. This spells grants one Beast that you touch a flying speed for the duration equal to its movement speed.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 1st.

name: Befuddle
components: S, M (a puzzle or riddle, written on parchment)
description: When you cast this spell, choose a creature that you are aware of within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, bands of magical energy appear around the target's wrists and neck, causing them to be restrained for the duration of the spell. A restrained creature can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, freeing themselves and ending the spell on a success. For as long as the target remains restrained, you have advantage on Intelligence saving throws and all Intelligence-based ability checks, and can use an action on your turn to automatically learn one piece of information which the target has knowledge of, related to a topic of your choice. The DM determines the exact nature of the information learned in this way.

name: Blessed Light
description: Your touch imbues a single weapon with the power to fight otherworldly forces of all kinds. If the touched weapon was not magical, it becomes magical for the duration. In addition, the touched weapon deals an additional 2d6 necrotic or radiant damage, your choice, on all attacks made with it during the spell's duration. Attacks made with this weapon against aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, or undead ignore damage resistance, and deal an additional 1d6 damage of the chosen type. If an attack made with the weapon against one of these types of creatures is a critical hit, the target of the attack must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or automatically be transported to its plane of origin if it is not already there. If you cast this spell as a ritual, the duration instead becomes 1 hour.

name: Blessing of Belzenlok
description:
You can use your reaction to cast this spell when your or a creature you can see in range makes a melee weapon attack, suffusing the weapon with negative energy. If the attack hits, it deals an additional 2d4 necrotic damage, and the attacking creature automatically takes 1d4 necrotic damage.
 oo
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both the additional damage and the damage to the attacking creature increase by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the attacking creature takes no damage, and instead regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

name: Blink of an Eye
description:
When you finish casting this spell you fade from existence, as your body becomes an physical, corporeal void in space that is filled with a teeming swarm of eyeballs. For the spell's duration, you can see through the swarm of eyeballs, with darkvision to a range of 60 feet and a 360-degree field of vision. During this time you are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from all nonmagical attacks, and have advantage on all Wisdom (Perception) checks related to sight. Until the spell ends, your speed becomes 0, and the only action you can take is to cast cantrips. If you lose concentration on the spell as a result of taking damage, you are automatically blinded for 1 minute after the spell ends.
 Kicker. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you also gain the ability to cast spells from the Divination or Illusion spell schools while under the effects of the spell.

name: Board the Weatherlight
components: V, S, M (an item over 100 years old worth 100 gp, consumed in the casting)
description:
After you finish casting this spell roll 5d20. For every 20 rolled in this way, you gain one history point. You can use an action on your turn and expend a history point in order to cast any spell of 1st level or lower from the spell list of any class. Casting the chosen spell still requires all components listed in the spell's requirements. All unused history points disappear at the end of your next short or long rest.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can roll an additional d20 for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Broken Bond
description:
With your touch, you attempt to end the harmful effects of one spell currently affecting a creature in range. When you cast this spell, choose one spell currently affecting the target that was not cast by you or an ally. If the spell is of 1st level or lower, it's effect on the target automatically ends. If the spell is of 2nd level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level, on a success ending the spell's effect on the target. If the spell's effect is successfully ended, you automatically regain an expended spell slot of your lowest available level.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell's effects automatically end if its level is less than the level of the spell slot you used.

name: Call the Cavalry
description:
This spell summons two otherworldly knights, decked in plate armor and with blades drawn, ready for battle. The summoned knights appear to be celestial, fey, or fiendish in origin, your choice. The knights are immune to all damage, can not be targeted by spells or attacks, and follow you closely, never leaving your space. You can use a bonus action on your turn to command one of the knights to make an attack against a creature you can see within 5 feet. When a knight attacks a creature, make a melee spell attack, which deals 3d8 force damage on a hit. Once a knight has successfully hit a creature with an attack, it fades from existence. While any of the knights remain, you can use your reaction whenever you become the target of an attack to cause all of the remaining knights to step forward and protect your from harm, granting you a bonus to AC against the triggering attack equal to the number of knights remaining. After doing so, whether the attack hits or not, one of the knights fades from existence. When the last knight disappears, the spell automatically ends.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you summon one additional knight for each slot level above 4th.

name: Cast Down
components: V, S, M (skin from a corpse)
description:
You can use your reaction to cast this spell whenever a creature fails its saving throw against a spell cast by you. The presence of your magic tears at the target's mind, filling their consciousness with insidious, unbearable horrors. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save the target takes 6d6 psychic damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and is not stunned.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

name: Chainer's Torment
components: V, M (a length of spiked chain)
description: The shadowy horrors filling your mind leap from it to manifest in the real world, creating a black fog filled with terrifying shapes that surrounds you in a 30-foot radius. After you cast this spell, each creature in the fog's radius other than yourself must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking 4d10 psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. You then regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage dealt. At the beginning of your next turn this process repeats. Then, at the start of your third turn after casting the spell, you automatically lose a number of hit points equal to half your hit point maximum, and the black fog coalesces into a shadowy horror with a form chosen by you. The horror appears in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet. For the next minute, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to mentally command the horror to move up to 30 feet and make an attack against a creature within 10 feet. When the horror attacks a creature, it makes a melee spell attack against the target using your spell attack bonus, dealing 4d10 psychic damage on a hit. If the horror is more than 30 feet from you at the end of your turn, or if you are knocked unconscious or use a bonus action to dismiss it, the horror disappears and the spell ends.

name: Chandra's Outburst
description: As you cast this spell, you feel intense anger welling up inside of you, pure and uncontrollable. When you finish casting the spell the anger you feel suddenly explodes outwards in a manifestation of fire and flames, scorching everything in a 60-foot radius around yourself. Each creature in the radius of the flames must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 14d6 fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. Flammable objects in the radius not being worn or carried ignite and begin to burn. The flames remain, leaping and dancing around you, and for the spell's duration you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to force one creature you can see within 60 feet to make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. Damage from the flames caused by this spell ignores damage resistance.

name: Charge
description: With a wild yell you rush forward, moving up to 30 feet in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks. At any point during this movement, you can make a single melee weapon attack with advantage, dealing an additional die of damage if the attack hits.

name: Curator's Ward
description:
You touch a single object no more than 10 cubic feet in size, enveloping it in a translucent sphere. The sphere is invisible to the naked eye, but can be seen using detect magic, truesight, or some other form of seeing magical effects. For the spell's duration the object in the sphere is immune to all magical damage, can not be destroyed through magical means, and can not become tarnished, rusted, or corroded.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level, the duration increases to 1 hour. When using a spell slot of 6th or 7th level, the duration becomes 24 hours. When using a spell slot of 8th level, the duration becomes a year and a day. When using a spell slot of 9th level or higher, the effect becomes permanent until dispelled.

name: Dark Bargain
description: Whenever you make a saving throw or ability check that you have advantage on, you can use your reaction to cast this spell. When you do so you attempt to call on higher powers for greater assistance, though at a steep cost. Instead of rolling twice, you can instead roll three times and take the highest result. After rolling, whether you succeed or fail, you automatically take 2d6 psychic damage as the power of these other forces temporarily overwhelms you.

name: Deep Freeze
description: This spell causes the temperature around one creature you can see in range to drop sharply, and the water in the air around them begins to freeze, clinging to their body. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, ending the spell on a success save and on a failed save suffering several effects for the spell's duration. The target's speed becomes 0, it takes 2d8 cold damage at the start of each of its turns, and all attacks the target makes or that are made against it have disadvantage. Any time a creature within 5 feet of the target hits it with a melee attack, the attacking creature automatically takes 2d8 cold damage. In addition, the target can only take an action or bonus action each turn, not both. If the target takes fire damage or another creature uses its action to free the target from the ice surrounding it, the spell automatically ends. Any creature that frees the target from the ice automatically takes 2d8 cold damage.

name: Deharme's Knightly Dub
components: V, S, M (a magical weapon or a sign of office)
description: Your touch bestows upon a creature grace, poise, a sense of purpose, and strength of mind, beknighting it into the service of a greater cause. The target has advantage on all Wisdom saving throws made to resist being charmed or frightened, as well as advantage on all Charisma (Persuasion) and Charisma (Intimidation) checks. In addition, the target's weapon attacks deal an additional die of damage against any charmed or frightened creature. These benefits remain until the end of the target's next long rest, or until the target becomes charmed or frightened, or is reduced to 0 hit points.

name: Demonic Vigor
components: V, S, M (the flesh of a fiend)
description: This spell infuses the touched creature with a small amount of infernal energy, energizing and renewing it beyond mortal limits. For the spell's duration, the target's melee weapon attacks deal an additional amount of necrotic damage equal to your spellcasting modifier. In addition, if the target is reduced to 0 hit points at any time during the duration of the spell, it automatically regains 1 hit point and the spell ends.

name: Divest
description: You reach out with your mind to touch that of a creature you can see within range, attempting to scramble their thoughts and slow their thinking. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw, on a failed save becoming unable to activate and losing any benefits from any magic item that requires attunement, and being unable to cast spells from the conjuration school. These effects last until the start of your next turn.

name: Evisceration of Min
components: V, S, M (the tooth of an ogre)
description:
When you cast this spell, one of your arms becomes blackened and charred, before splitting into a number of stiff, but flexible tendrils, each tipped with a wickedly sharp point. Make a melee spell attack using the tendrils against up to two creatures that you can see within 60 feet. On a hit, a target creature takes 3d8 piercing and 3d8 necrotic damage. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the target immediately dies and you regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt to that creature.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can make an attack against one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

name: Fall of the Thran
components: V, M (a piece of moon rock)
description: After casting this spell you are cloaked in a brilliant, blindingly bright light, as the air fills with magic that seems to freeze the entire world. Yourself and each creature within 300 feet of you when you cast this spell is incapacitated and can't move. Then, beginning with you and going in initiative order, each creature affected by the spell takes three turns. Creatures affected by the spell which have not yet had a chance to take these turns are still incapacitated and unable to move until they do so.

name: Fervent Strike
components: V, S, M (a weapon with the thrown property)
description:
As part of the bonus action used to cast this spell, you must make a ranged attack with a thrown weapon against one creature within the spell's range, otherwise the spell fails. The thrown weapon catches fire mid air, and on a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects plus an additional 1d6 fire damage. The flames then leap to each creature within 5 feet of the original target, dealing an amount of fire damage to each of those creatures equal to your spellcasting modifier.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both the fire damage from the ranged attack and the fire damage to the additional creatures increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Fiery Gauntlet
components: V, S, M (a pair of scarlet gloves)
description:
You cloak your hands in burning flames, capable of searing the flesh of your foes while leaving your own untouched. You can use an action on each of your turns for the spell's duration to make a melee spell attack with the flames, dealing 2d10 fire damage on a hit. In addition, any creature you grapple during the spell's duration automatically takes 1d10 fire damage at the start of each of its turns it remains grappled by you. At any time during the spell's duration, you can use an action to launch the flames from your hand, making a ranged spell attack against a creature within 30 feet and dealing 4d10 fire damage on a hit. After doing so, the spell ends.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage for all attacks made with the flames and the damage dealt to creatures you grapple both increase by 1d10 for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Fiery Intervention
description:
You launch a whirling ball of fire through the air, making a ranged spell attack against a target. If the target is a construct, you have advantage on this attack. On a hit, the target takes 6d10 fire damage, or twice as much if it is a construct.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 5th.

name: Fight with Fire
description:
When you cast this spell, you cause fire to well up from the ground beneath the feet of one creature that you can see in range, creating a pillar of flame that rises 30 feet into the air. Any creature caught in the flames must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d10 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.
 Kicker. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, you can summon fire from beneath any number of creatures you can see in range, and the damage increases to 10d10 and the height of the flames increases to 60 feet.

name: Final Parting
components: V, S, M (a glove made from 500 gp worth of spun silk)
description: When you cast this spell, you inextricably bind the fates of two creatures that you can see in range, but only for a brief moment. If either of the chosen creatures is reduced to 0 hit points before the end of your next turn, both targets must make a Charisma saving throw. If the creature reduced to 0 hit points fails this saving throw, it dies immediately, and on a successful save it instead automatically fails its first death saving throw. If the creature not reduced to 0 hit points fails its saving throw, it dies automatically if it has less than 100 hit points, otherwise it takes 10d8 psychic damage. On a successful save, nothing happens to the target.

name: Find Assistant
components: V, S, M (50 gp worth of scrap metal, consumed in the casting)
description: When you finish casting this spell, the scrap metal used as the material component shapes itself into an assistant for you, taking the form of any creature of your choice with a CR of (1/8) or lower, and assembling itself in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. The created assistant has the statistics of the chosen from, except that it is a construct instead of its normal type, it is immune to exhaustion, and can not cast spells or make attacks if it would normally be able to do so. The assistant moves and acts independently of you, rolling initiative and taking its own turns, but it always obeys any commands given to it by you. While you are within 100 feet of the assistant, you can telepathically communicate with it, commanding it on your turn, no action required by you. The assistant understands any languages you know but can't speak, though it can telepathically communicate simple ideas and feelings to you on its turn. While the assistant can't make normal attacks, it can take the Dash, Disengage, Dodge, Help, or Hide actions when commanded to. If the assistant is reduced to 0 hit points it automatically breaks, crumbling into scrap metal not suitable for reuse. As a ritual which takes 10 minutes to perform, you can imprint onto the assistant the abilities of one magic item which requires charges to function. To do so, you, the assistant, and the magic item must remain within 10 feet of each other for the duration of the ritual, and you must be attuned to the magic item if it requires attunement to function. An assistant can be imprinted with the abilities of only one magic item at a time, though you can spend another 10 minutes to perform the ritual again with another magic item to change the abilities imprinted on the assistant. Once per day, you can use a bonus action on your turn to command the assistant to use one of the abilities imprinted upon it, as if it were a magic item of that type. The assistant uses the ability immediately, on your turn, and you choose any targets for the effect as normal. If the effect requires an attack roll or saving throw, the assistant uses your own spell attack bonus and saving throw DC instead of that of the imprinted item.

name: Frenzied Rage
description:
You fill yourself with an intense fury, drawn from the deepest pits of your psyche, then infuse that rage into a willing creature that you touch. For the duration of the spell, all of the touched creature's melee weapon attacks deal an additional amount of fire damage equal to 1d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. In addition, the target can take a bonus action on each of its turns to make a single melee weapon attack. Once the spell ends, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or automatically suffer one level of exhaustion.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the additional fire damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd. Additionally, when you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the target can use a bonus action to make two melee weapon attacks, and suffers two levels of exhaustion if it fails the Constitution saving throw. When you cast this spell at 9th level, the number of attacks the target can make with a bonus action and the levels of exhaustion it suffers on a failed save both increase to three.

name: Fungal Infection
components: V, M (a dried mushroom and a weapon)
description:
As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack with a weapon against one creature within the spell's range, otherwise the spell fails. On a hit, you transfer a parasitic fungus to the target, dealing an additional 1d6 necrotic damage and reducing the target's maximum hit points by an amount equal to the necrotic damage dealt. If the necrotic damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it automatically dies. If a creature dies as a result of this attack, the fungus immediately spreads throughout their body, consuming it and transforming into a saproling under your control. The DM has the statistics for the saproling, except that it has a number of temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt by the spell. The saproling acts at the end of your turn, and you can use a bonus action on your turn to verbally command it. Unless you command it, the saproling defends itself from harm but takes no other action.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Fungal Plots
components: S, M (fresh mulch or soil, consumed in the casting)
description:
When you finish casting this spell you scatter the mulch and soil onto the ground around you, and a saproling quickly grows from the dirt, appearing in a random unoccupied space within 10 feet of you. The saproling acts at the end of your turn, and obeys verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you do not issue any commands to the saproling, it moves to follow you and acts to defend both you and itself against threats but otherwise takes no action. Until the spell ends, you can use an action to magically consume the saproling, killing it and regaining a number of hit points equal to half the saproling's hit points, and automatically ending the spell. The saproling is automatically consumed when the spell ends. If your concentration is broken, the saproling isn't consumed. Instead, you lose control of the saproling, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack. The DM has the saproling's statistics.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the saproling is created with an additional 10 temporary hit points for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Gift of Growth
components: V, S, M (an acorn and the tooth of a predator)
description:
You ever so slightly subvert the balance of nature, transforming one beast that you can see in range into an apex predator, enhancing their physical abilities. Until the start of your next turn, the target's speed is doubled and its melee weapon attacks deal an additional 2d6 damage. In addition, the target can take one additional action on its next turn.
 Kicker. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the target's speed is instead tripled, its melee weapon attacks deal an additional 5d6 damage, and it can take two additional actions on its next turn.

name: Goblin Barrage
components: V, S, M (a shiny rock or an artifact with at least 1 charge)
description:
So long as goblins continue to exist, you might as well take advantage of nature's biggest annoyance. Casting this spell causes you to summon 2d4 phantasmal goblins, which go flying through the air as they appear. For each goblin summoned, make a ranged spell attack against a creature within 60 feet, dealing 4d4 force damage for each successful hit. Whether a goblin successfully strikes the target or not, it disappears after the attack is made.
 Kicker. As part of the action used to cast this spell, you can choose to expend all charges from a single magic item that you are holding and attuned to. If you do, the number of goblins that you summon increases to 4d4, and you can choose to attack any number of creatures within 60 feet, using one goblin per attack. This same effect occurs if you are a goblin.

name: Grow from the Ashes
description:
Through your magic a magnificent creature, taken before its time, is given a second chance. You touch a beast or plant that has been dead for no more than 1 year, that didn't die of old age and isn't undead. The target is resurrected, with 1 hit point and one level of exhaustion. The spell closes all mortal wounds and restores any missing body parts. The spell can also create a new body for the target if the majority of the original no longer exists, though the spell requires at least some part of the body to touch. If a new body is created by the spell, it incorporates all remaining and available pieces of the old body.
 Kicker. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the resurrected creature is instead revived with its maximum number of hit points and without levels of exhaustion.

name: Haphazard Bombardment
components: V, S, M (a large rock, weighing at least 10 lbs)
description: As you cast this spell, select up to four creatures or objects that you can see within range, marking each of the chosen targets. Each creature targeted by the spell must make a Dexterity saving throw at the start of its turn, as a magically summoned boulder comes hurtling at them from the sku. On a failed saving throw the target takes 10d10 bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and is not knocked prone. At the start of each of your turns after casting the spell, for as long as the spell's effects continue, each targeted object is struck by a boulder in the same manner, instead taking 20d10 bludgeoning damage. The spell ends if either yourself or at least one target has 0 remaining hit points at the start of your turn.

name: Healing Grace
components: V, S, M (a divine spellcasting focus)
description:
The gifts of your god were meant to be shared among those deserving, rather than hoarded by the ungrateful. You touch a willing creature, granting it a small part of your own divine blessings. The touched creature gains a pool of healing power, which can restore a total number of hit points equal to your spellcasting modifier. To use this healing pool, the target must use an action to touch a willing creature, restoring a number of hit points up to the maximum remaining in the healing pool. This healing has no effect on undead and constructs. This healing pool disappears once it has been expended, or at the end of your next long rest.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the size of the healing pool is multiplied by the level of the spell slot expended.

name: History of Benalia
components: V, M (a magic weapon or set of magic armor)
description: When you cast this spell, ribbons of multicolored light stream from the material component used in the spell's casting, as if it were shining through stained glass. After casting the spell, and at the start of each of your next two turns, the ribbons of light meet in an unoccupied space of your choice within 5 feet, forming into the shape of a heavily armored knight. Each summoned knight has an AC of 13 + your spellcasting modifier, a number of hit points equal to half your own, a bonus to all saving throws equal to your proficiency bonus, and are immune to radiant damage. When a summoned knight takes the Attack action, it can make a single melee weapon attack with a blade of pure light, dealing 2d8 radiant damage if the attack hits. These knights are friendly to you and your companions, and obey any verbal commands that you issue to them. You can use a bonus action on your turn to command any number of the summoned knights within 60 feet, which act at the end of your turn. If you do not issue any commands to a knight, it takes no actions other than to follow you if you move, attempting to remain no further than 15 feet away. A summoned knight remains for 1 hour, or until it is reduced to 0 hit points or you use a bonus action to dismiss it.

name: In Bolas's Clutches
components: V, S, M (the claw of a dragon)
description:
You offer a magical contract to a willing creature, allowing them to lend you their life in return for enormous power. If the target accepts the contract, it becomes your thrall, and for the duration of the spell it gains the ability to cast a number of spells per day equal to your Intelligence modifier. The saving throw DC and spell attack modifier for these spells is determined by your Intelligence score. Whenever the thrall finishes a long rest, you choose a number of spells that you know equal to your Intelligence modifier. The chosen spells must be of 5th-level or lower. You lose the ability to cast the chosen spells and the thrall gains the ability to cast those spells. At the end of the thrall's next long rest, you regain the ability to cast the spells, and the thrall loses the ability to cast them. For the spell's duration, you can use a bonus action on your turn to attempt to take full control of the thrall. The thrall must make a Charisma saving throw with disadvantage. On a failed save, you gain full control over the thrall and its actions, and can dictate what it does on each of its turns. While the thrall is under your total control, it can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. If it succeeds, the thrall regains control over its actions, and can choose to end the effects of the spell when it does. On a failed saving throw, the thrall instead takes 4d6 psychic damage. If this damage reduces the thrall to 0 hit points, its mind is destroyed, and it dies immediately.
 Legendary Spell. You must be 20th level or above in order to cast this spell.

name: Invoke the Divine
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when a creature uses a magic item
description:
By calling upon the power of your faith, you attempt to disable the tools of your enemy. You can cast this spell using your reaction when a creature that you can see in range becomes the target of an attack made with or spell cast using a magic item. If the magic item is of uncommon rarity or below, it ceases to function for 24 hours as you draw the energy from it, causing you to gain 4d4 temporary hit points.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can disable rare magic items, and gain 8d4 temporary hit points. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, you can disable very rare magic items and gain 12d4 temporary hit points.

name: Jaya's Immolating Inferno
description:
When you cast this spell, you must expend an additional spell slot of 1st level or higher. You create several powerful blasts of fire, equal in number to the level of the expended spell slot, which seem to ignite the sky as they rip through the air. Choose a number of creatures up to the number of blasts created, and make a ranged spell attack against each target. The blasts all strike simultaneously and you can direct them to hit one creature or several. A target hit by a blast takes 10d6 fire damage, and a creature reduced to 0 hit points by this damage is automatically killed and turned to ash.
 Legendary Spell. You must be 20th level or above in order to cast this spell.

name: Kamahl's Druidic Vow
components: V, S, M (a slashing weapon, and a sapling less than a year old)
description:
You use the weapon to dig a hole in the ground, into which you plant the sapling, before driving the blade of your weapon into the ground behind the newly-planted tree, where it instantly rusts and tarnishes. You speak a small prayer over the plant, a promise of your new dedication to protecting nature's balance. When you finish casting this spell, choose a number of spells that you know or have prepared equal to the level of the spell slot used to cast this spell. You permanently lose the ability to cast those spells, and can not relearn them. You then choose an equal number of spells from the druid spell list, and gain the ability to cast those spells. The spells chosen must be of equivalent level to the spells lost. For example, if you choose to give up three 2nd level and two 3rd level spells that you know how to cast, you gain the ability to cast three 2nd level and two 3rd level spells from the druid spell list. Casting these spells requires preparing them and expending spell slots as normal.
 Legendary Spell. You must be 20th level or above in order to cast this spell.

name: Karn's Temporal Sundering
components: V, S, M (a piece of silver worth at least 400 gp, consumed in the casting)
description:
As you cast this spell, the silver used as the material component melts and becomes liquid, then swallows a willing creature that you touch before vanishing entirely and reappearing in the same location at the end of your turn. The target is sent a short ways back in time, appearing in the same location or the nearest unoccupied space and allowing it to interact with the past without being interacted with. The target can take a number of actions up to or equal to your spellcasting modifier, whose effects are then retroactively applied, as determined by the DM. When the target reappears, it suffers one level of exhaustion for each action it chose to take. If you cast this spell as a ritual, you instead send the target back in time a number of hours of your choice, up to your spellcasting modifier, following the same rules as if the spell had been cast using a spell slot as normal. When the target reappears, it automatically suffers one level of exhaustion for each hour that it was sent back in time.
 Legendary Spell. You must be 20th level or above in order to cast this spell.

name: Lich's Mastery
components: V, S, M (the soul of a humanoid trapped using soul cage or some similar method and 5000 gp worth of magical black iron, both consumed in the casting)
description:
As you cast this spell, you perform a ritual that slowly enmeshes your soul with the one that you've trapped, entwining them together into the iron, which shapes itself into a suit of armor made for you and bound forever to your skin. After casting this spell, you become an undead creature, and you no longer need to breathe, drink, eat, or sleep. You are immune to necrotic and poison damage, can not be diseased or poisoned, and can not suffer exhaustion except as a result of this spell. The magical iron binds itself to your skin in a highly painful process, becoming a suit of armor. You can not remove this armor, and while wearing it your AC is 17 and you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. The armor has a number of hit points equal to your maximum hit points at the time you cast the spell, and whenever you would take damage, the armor takes that damage instead. Damage to the armor manifests as pieces of the iron chipping off and falling to the ground, at which point they vanish into black dust. To repair the armor and restore its hit points, you must perform a magical ritual that takes 8 hours to complete, requires you to expend a 9th-level spell slot, and costs a number of gp equal to 10 x the number of hit points being restored to the armor. If the armor is reduced to 0 hit points it shatters, leaving behind only a few scraps attached to your body, and you must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you are reduced to 0 hit points and begin dying, and automatically fail any death saving throws. On a success, you instead take 4d10 necrotic damage and suffer one level of exhaustion, which can not be removed by taking a long rest. At the end of each long rest that the armor remains broken and unrepaired, you must make another Constitution saving throw, with the same results. In addition to the normal costs, repairing the armor once it has been reduced to 0 hit points also requires the soul of another humanoid trapped using soul cage or another method, which is expended in the process of repairing the armor.
 Legendary Spell. You must be 20th level or above in order to cast this spell.

name: Oath of Teferi
description:
You press your palm flat to the air and speak the words of the spell, and a glyph made from white smoke appears in the air in front of your hand. When you cast this spell and at the beginning of each of your turns for the spell's duration, you can choose a creature you can see within range. If the target is an enemy, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or vanish without a sound. The target returns to the space it disappeared from at the end of its next turn. If the target is an ally, it can immediately move up to its speed and take one additional action. If it does, at the end of the turn, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion.
 Legendary Spell. You must be 20th level or above in order to cast this spell.

name: On Serra's Wings
components: V, S, M (a dove's feather and a piece of stained glass)
description:
Wings of beautiful rainbow glass sprout from the back of a creature that you touch, and a shining aura of golden light emanates from their skin. For the duration of the spell, the target gains a flying speed equal to its movement speed, can take one reaction on each turn in combat, and can make one additional attack when it takes the Attack action. In addition, the target's weapon attacks deal an additional 1d10 radiant damage, and whenever the target hits a creature with a weapon attack, it regains a number of hit points equal to the radiant damage dealt.
 Legendary Spell. You must be 20th level or above in order to cast this spell.

name: Phyrexian Scriptures
components: V, M (a vial of black oil)
description: When you cast this spell, you splash the oil into the air around you, where it evaporates and turns into a cloud of black smoke. Choose up to two creatures that you can see within range. The smoke moves and curls to wrap around those creatures, layering along their skin and transforming it into a shiny, black carapace. For 1 hour, each of those creatures is immune to necrotic damage and automatically succeeds on saving throws made to avoid becoming exhausted. Then at the start of your next turn, the cloud of smoke expands to fill a 60-foot radius around you where the smoke lingers until the spell ends. Each creature that begins its turn in the radius must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 14d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Then at the start of your third turn after casting this spell, each creature in the cloud of smoke must succeed on another Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion. Afterwards the smoke dissipates and the spell ends.

name: Pierce the Sky
components: S, M (a feather at least 6 inches long)
description:
You touch a ranged weapon or a single piece of ammunition. The next time before the end of your next turn that a creature makes a ranged attack roll with the weapon or ammunition, the range of the attack is doubled and it deals an additional 2d10 damage on a hit. If the target of the attack is a flying creature, the attack instead deals an additional 4d10 damage and the target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or immediately fall prone.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the additional damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Precognition Field
components: V, S, M (two crystal lenses each worth 1,500 gp)
description: You carefully line up the crystal lenses so that they are exactly opposite each other, with yourself in the middle. As you cast the spell, a cloud of swirling dust filled with twinkling motes of light begins to appear around you, eventually coalescing into a thick gas. This gas remains for the duration of the spell, floating in the air between the two lenses without moving or dissipating, flashing with sparks of light and glimpses of movement. For every 10 minutes that you spend studying the gas and the movements within, you can ask the GM one question about the future and make a DC 20 Intelligence (Investigation) or Wisdom (Insight) check. On a success, the GM answers the question to the best of their abilities with a short phrase, 25 words or less. The question must be related to events that will occur in the next 24 hours after the casting of this spell, and events which you will be present for. For instance, you may ask the chances of success for a particular course of action, whether or not a specific companion might betray the others, or whether a specific event will occur. You could not ask whether you will successfully arrive at a destination further than 24 hours away, or what might happen in a specific location that you could not reasonably get to in the allotted time. After receiving an answer to a question that you have asked, you can immediately expend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher to receive further information about the answer, another short phrase of 25 words or less. You must expend the spell slot immediately after receiving the answer; you can not spend 10 minutes and ask another question, then attempt to receive further information about a previous question unless you spend 10 minutes to ask the question again.

name: Blood Reckoning
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when a source within 30 feet of you causes you to take damage
description:
Faced with dangerous circumstances, you turn to necromantic magic to weaponize your own blood, turning it against your enemies even as it drains from your body. You can cast this spell using your reaction when a source within 10 feet of you causes you to take damage. For the duration of the spell, the minute drops of blood that spray from your body when you are struck by a weapon or spell are transformed into bubbling acid, draining globules, or razor-sharp shards.When you cast this spell, choose one of the following damage types: acid, necrotic, or slashing. Each creature within 15 feet of you whenever you take damage must make a Dexterity saving throw, on a failed save taking 2d6 damage of the chosen damage type, as they are sprayed with the weaponized ichor.Once per round, when you take damage, you can choose to direct the spray of blood instead, unleashing it at an extended range as a pressurized blast. Choose a creature that you can see within 30 feet. That target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 damage of the chosen type on a failed saving throw, or half as much on a successful one.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

name: Switcheroo
description: Choose two creatures that you can see within range. You attempt to yank those creatures' minds from their bodies, only to swap and replace them. If a target is unwilling, it must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a success, the spell fails. If the spell succeeds, each target's mind is placed into the body of the other. Each target's race, size, and physical ability scores are replaced with those of the other target. Its mental ability scores and personality remain the same. Each target loses any abilities granted by its race and any innate spellcasting abilities, but retains all class abilities and feats except those its new form no longer qualifies for. Each target gains any physical abilities tied to its new form, at the DM's discretion.7

name: Absorb Identity
components: V, S, M (a wicker doll tied with a piece of hair from the corpse used in the casting)
description:
You wrap a piece of hair from the corpse of a Small or Medium humanoid around the wicker doll used in the spell's casting, then touch the wicker doll to up to three willing humanoids. The face of the dead body slowly disappears, becoming a blank surface for the spell's duration, giving creatures disadvantage on checks made to identify the body.The body and facial features of the humanoids touched with the doll morph and shift to resemble the dead creature, changing in size as appropriate. The target's voices change as well to match the voice of the dead creature, including any vocal quirks that the dead creature had in life. Any equipment the targets are wearing or carrying does not change with them. The targets do not gain access to any of the dead creature's memories.Observers attempting to identify any of the targets as a fake must succeed on a Wisdom (Insight) check against your spell save DC. Creatures that are very familiar with the dead creature, such as family or close friends, have advantage on this roll. An observer might attempt the roll if something occurs which gives them reason for suspicion, such as one of the targets acting in a way that does not align with the character or personality of the dead creature, or if they see more than one target of the spell in the same location.A target of the spell can end the spell's effects on themselves at any point during the spell's duration using a bonus action. The effects of the spell also end for a target if the target is knocked unconscious or killed, or if you and the target are on different planes. Once the effects of the spell have ended for all of the affected targets, the facial features of the dead creature reappear on the body.
 At Higher Levels. The duration of the spell's effects increase to 8 hours if cast using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, or 24 hours if cast using a spell slot of 7th level or higher.

name: Anger of the Gods
components: V, S, M (a bit of sulfur, or a used match)
description:
Dark clouds, glowing with the light of a fire's embers, begin to swirl in the sky above you. You must be outside to cast this spell. For the duration of the spell, small pellets of fire rain down in a 1-mile radius surrounding you. Flammable objects and structures in the radius ignite and begin to burn. Whenever a creature starts its turn in the spell's radius or enters it for the first time on its turn, it must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 1d6 fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. Creatures that have full cover from the sky while in the spell's radius, such as those indoors or underneath solid outdoor coverings, are immune to the spell's effects. If damage caused by this spell reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the creature is immediately killed as its body begins to burn, leaving behind nothing but ash.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the duration becomes concentration, up to 10 minutes.

name: Annul
casting_time: 1 reaction, which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell
description:
You attempt to disrupt the divine bonds connecting a creature to its spellcasting power. If the creature is casting a Cleric, Druid, Paladin, or Ranger spell it must make a saving throw using its spellcasting ability. On a failed save, the creature's spell fails and it has no effect.
