If the creature is casting a spell of 1st level or lower, any material component or spellcasting focus used in the casting of the spell is immediately destroyed.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the material component or spellcasting focus is destroyed if the spell's level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

name: Aqueous Form
description: You dip your fingers into the vial of water before touching a willing creature, infusing them with the essence of the sea. For the duration of the spell, the target's body and any equipment it is wearing or carrying are transformed into pure water. While in this form, the target can not attack or cast spells. The target's movement speed is reduced to 10 feet, it has vulnerability to lightning damage, and has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to move silently. The target can move through spaces as narrow as 1-inch wide without squeezing, and can enter and occupy other creature's spaces. The transformation ends if the target is reduced to 0 hit points, knocked unconscious, killed, or uses a bonus action to end the spell early. While in other bodies of water, the target's movement speed is doubled, and it can't be detected while it remains motionless. The target can talk while transformed, but its voice sounds strange and muted, as if it were speaking from underwater, and any creature attempting to understand it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to do so.

name: Artisan's Sorrow
description: When you cast this spell, you touch a creature or object and automatically end one spell currently affecting the target. After casting this spell, roll 2d20 and record the result. Once before the end of your next short or long rest, when you roll a d20 you can choose to replace the roll with the recorded one. You can do so after seeing the roll, but before you know the result. If you have already cast a spell that allows you to roll any number of d20s and record the results, you lose the results of any previously recorded rolls.

name: Battlewise Valor
components: V, S, M (small gold disk shaped like a shield, worth at least 250 gp)
description: Magical energy lines whatever weapon you are holding, and a hovering shield of translucent magical energy appears near you. For the duration of the spell, you gain a +2 bonus to AC, and all weapon attacks you make deal an additional 1d8 force damage. Once before the spell ends, when you would be hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to automatically cause that attack to miss instead. After doing so, at the end of your next turn, the spell automatically ends.

name: Boon of Erebos
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when a creature in range is reduced to 0 hit points
description:
Acting quickly, before death can take grip, you pull life from your own body to grant it to another. When you cast this spell, you take 2d6 necrotic damage, and the target gains a number of temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. In addition, until the start of your next turn, the target has advantage on all saving throws.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Boulderfall
description: Choose up to five points that you can see within range. Each creature within 10 feet of one of the chosen points must make a Dexterity saving throw as a small avalanche of rocks and dirt comes tumbling down around them. On a failed save, an affected creature takes 7d10 bludgeoning damage, and if it is Large or smaller it is trapped and restrained by the debris. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and is not restrained. A restrained creature or a free creature within 5 feet of it can use its action to make a Strength (Athletics) check to attempt to free the trapped creature from the debris. The avalanche of debris creates a 10-foot radius of non-magical difficult terrain around each of the chosen points, which remains until cleared.

name: Chained to the Rocks
components: S, M (an iron chain of at least 3 links)
description:
When you cast this spell, choose a creature that you can see within range. Iron chains burst from the ground around the target, wrapping around its arms and legs and forcing the target to succeed on a Strength saving throw or become restrained. While restrained in this way, the target can't take actions or reactions, is immune to all damage and conditions, does not need to sleep, eat, or drink, and does not age. The target can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you no longer need to maintain concentration on the spell. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, the duration becomes 1 hour; with a spell slot of 7th or 8th level, the duration becomes one week; with a spell slot of 9th level, the duration becomes one year. If you are a sorcerer, when you cast this spell it is automatically treated as having been cast with a spell slot of one level higher.

name: Chosen by Heliod
description: Your touch grants a single willing creature the divine blessing of Heliod. For the duration of the spell, the target gains a +2 bonus to AC and has resistance to radiant damage.

name: Commune with the Gods
components: V, M (an offering of gold, silver, or gems worth a total of 500 gp, consumed in the casting)
description:
You offer up the material component of the spell to your deity, watching as their power consumes it. When you cast this spell, you can immediately exchange any number of spells from your list of currently prepared spells with an equal number of spells from the cleric spell list. The spells that you add to your list of prepared spells must all be of 5th level or below.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the level of the spells that you can add to your list of prepared spells increases by one for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Coordinated Assault
description:
With a single word, you align your thoughts with an allied creature that you can see within range, allowing you to attack your target in a single strategic strike. The next time before the start of your next turn that you make a melee weapon attack against a creature that is within reach of both you and the target of the spell, the target can use its reaction to make a single melee weapon attack at the same time. If they do, both attacks are made with advantage, and both deal an additional 2d4 force damage.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the additional damage increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Curse of the Swine
components: V, S, M (the snout or hoof of a pig)
description:
You attempt to transform one creature of your choice that you can see within range into a lowly pig. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw to resist the transformation. A shapechanger automatically succeeds on the save. On a failed save, the target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of a boar, but the target retains its hit points, alignment, and personality. A target reverts to its normal form if the effect is dispelled or when it dies. The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form. It can't speak, cast spells, or do anything else that requires hands or speech. The target's gear melds into the new form. The target can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can target an additional two creatures for each slot level above 6th.

name: Cutthroat Maneuver
classes: Bard, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
description:
Choose up two two allied creatures that you can see within range. Lines of purple energy criss-cross their skin, glowing the same color as their eyes. The next time the target hits another creature with a melee weapon attack before the start of your next turn, the attack deals an additional 4d8 necrotic damage, and the target gains a number of temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt this way. The damaged creature must then succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the start of your next turn.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you may target an additional creature for each slot level above 5th.

name: Dark Betrayal
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when you cast a spell that targets an allied creature
components: S, M (a miniature dagger made from black iron)
description:
You can use your reaction to cast this spell whenever you cast a spell that targets a willing creature. You twist what was once a blessing into a curse, striking the target with a crippling sickness. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the target takes 3d8 necrotic damage and is blinded for 1 hour. On a success the target takes half as much damage, and is not blinded.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, on a failed save the target also suffers one level of exhaustion.

name: Dauntless Onslaught
components: V, S, M (a miniature dagger made from gold, worth at least 300 gp)
description: Choose up to two creatures that you can see within range. You wave the dagger in intricate patterns through the air, and matching lines of golden energy appear on the targets' bodies as you do. For the duration of the spell, each of the chosen targets gains a +2 bonus to AC, attack rolls, and damage rolls, and has advantage on saving throws made to avoid being charmed or frightened. At the end of each of the targets turns, if that target has not hit a hostile creature with an attack roll this turn, the spell's effects end for it.

name: Defend the Hearth
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when an object or structure you can see within range is hit by an attack
description: A group of soldiers, ethereal but armed with very solid-looking shields and spears, springs up around the object or structure. For the duration of the spell, the object or structure is immune to all damage, including from the triggering attack. In addition, if the object is a structure, creatures are magically prevented from entering or exiting the structure for the duration.

name: Destructive Revelry
description:
When you cast this spell, a roaring bonfire springs up in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range, and remains for a number of rounds equal to your spellcasting modifier. For the duration of the spell, whenever a creature within 30 feet of the bonfire other than you casts a spell or activates a magic item, a tongue of flame leaps from the fire towards that creature, forcing it to succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 3d6 fire damage. In addition, whenever a creature within 30 feet of the bonfire other than you casts a spell or activates a magic item, the spell's duration increases by 1 round.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radius of the spell's effect increases by 10 feet and the damage of the spell increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 4th.

name: Dissolve
casting_time: 1 reaction, which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell
description:
With a wave of your hand, you interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell, transforming their power into mist, whose movements allow you a brief glimpse of the future. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect.After casting this spell, roll a d20 and record the result. Once before the end of your next short or long rest, when you roll a d20 you can choose to replace the roll with the recorded one. You can do so after seeing the roll, but before you know the result. If you have already cast a spell that allows you to roll any number of d20s and record the results, you lose the results of any previously recorded rolls.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or above, the level of the spell that you can successfully interrupt increases by one spell level.

name: Fade into Antiquity
description: When you cast this spell, and as an action on each of your turns for the spell's duration, you can touch one nonmagical object that is Huge or smaller. If the object isn't being worn or carried, it receives a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to its AC. If this reduces its AC to 0, the object crumbles to dust and is destroyed. If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the touch. If the object touched is either armor or a shield being worn or carried, it takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object touched is a weapon, it takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed.

name: Fate Foretold
components: V, M (a gold coin and a bottle of ink, consumed in the casting)
description:
You dip the coin into the ink, then touch it to a willing creature, watching as the coin melts away and lines of scrawled text begin to appear across the creature's body. Roll a d20, and record the number rolled. Until the end of your next long rest, whenever the target rolls a d20, if the number rolled is the same one, both you and the target gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting modifier. If you cast this spell again before the end of your next long rest, the effects of the spell automatically end.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, the number of temporary hit points you gain is increased - twice as many with a 5th-level spell slot, four times as many with a 7th-level spell slot, and eight times as many with a 9th-level spell slot.

name: Feral Invocation
description:
You reach out and commune with the spirits of nature, drawing their power into yourself. For the duration of the spell, you gain the following benefits:
 Your speed increases by 30 feet, and you gain a climb speed and a swim speed equal to half your movement speed, rounded down.
 You have advantage on all Strength and Dexterity saving throws and ability checks.
 Whenever you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make one additional attack using a weapon that you've already made an attack with this turn.
 You can take one additional reaction each round.

name: Gift of Immortality
components: V, S, M (a bar of pure gold worth 1000 gp, consumed in the casting)
description: As you finish casting this spell, the gold block melts to coat your hands, before spreading to cover one creature that you touch. The creature's skin takes on a brilliant golden hue, so bright that it gives off dim light in a 5-foot radius. The spell lasts until the end of your next long rest. For the duration, whenever the target's hit points are reduced to 0, it automatically regains an amount of hit points equal to the damage dealt. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points again before the end of its next turn, the spell immediately ends.

name: Glare of Heresy
description:
Choose a creature that you can see within 5 feet and that can see you. Your eyes blaze with a powerful, shining light that burns the target with its touch. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 3d8 radiant damage and is blinded for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the blindness on a success. On a successful save, the target takes half as much radiant damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radiant damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Gods Willing
description: You bestow a blessing of the gods on a creature, granting them both protection from the elements for a short time, as well as a glimpse into the future. Choose a willing creature that you can see within range, then choose a damage type from the following: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, radiant, necrotic. The target gains resistance to damage of the chosen type until the end of your next turn.After casting this spell, roll a d20 and record the result. Once before the end of your next short or long rest, when the target rolls a d20 it can choose to replace the roll with the recorded one. The target can do so after seeing the roll, but before it knows the result.

name: Hero's Downfall
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when hit a creature with a weapon attack
classes: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
description:
As your weapon strikes the target, curling wisps of shadow blossom from the injury, and tainted lines of darkness begin to spread across the target's body from the point of impact. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 8d10 necrotic damage and becomes poisoned for 1 minute. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and is not poisoned. The target's maximum hit points are reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage dealt this way.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a higher level spell slot, it deals an additional 1d10 necrotic damage for each slot level above 6th, and the effect changes depending upon the level of the spell slot used. If cast using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, on a failed saving throw the target also suffers one level of exhaustion.

name: Hunt the Hunter
components: V, S, M (the tip of a spear)
description:
Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. The target is filled with the fury of the hunted, turning from prey to predator in the blink of an eye. For the duration of the spell, whenever a creature hits the target with a melee weapon attack, the target can use its reaction to make a single melee weapon attack against the attacker. If this attack hits, it deals an additional die of damage.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a higher level spell slot, the duration of the spell changes. When cast using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, the duration becomes 10 minutes. When cast using a spell slot of 5th level or above, the duration becomes 1 hour, and the spell no longer requires concentration.

name: Lash of the Whip
components: S, M (the thigh bone of a beast, monstrosity, or humanoid)
description: A whip of malevolent, purple energy springs forth from your hand, twisting and writhing as if it were a living creature, seeking blood. As part of casting the spell, and as an action on each of your turns for the spell's duration, you can make a melee spell attack using the whip against a creature you can see within 20 feet. When you hit a target with the whip, it takes 4d8 necrotic damage, and if the target is a creature, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks until the start of your next turn.

name: Lightning Strike
description:
Lightning leaps from your fingers towards a target that you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d12 lightning damage, and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d12 for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Lost in a Labyrinth
description:
One creature of your choice that you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target can only watch as its surroundings disappear, replaced with the walls of an illusionary labyrinth. While under the effects of the spell, the target can't see any creature further than 10 feet away from it. At the start of the target's next turn, it must roll a d20, and move up to its speed in the resulting direction. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks, and if the direction rolled is blocked, the target doesn't move. At the end of the target's next turn, the illusionary walls disappear, and the spell ends.
 1-5: North
 6-10: East
 11-15: South
 16-20: West
 After casting the spell, roll a d20 and record the result. Once before the end of your next short or long rest, when you roll a d20 you can choose to replace the roll with the recorded one. You can do so after seeing the roll, but before you know the result. If you have already cast a spell that allows you to roll any number of d20s and record the results, you lose the results of any previously recorded rolls.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target an additional creature for each slot level above 1st. Each of the targets must be within 10 feet of a previous target.

name: March of the Returned
components: V, S, M (an object of importance to the dead creature, consumed in the casting)
description: Using the creature's personal connection with the material component of the spell, you conjure its body and soul back to life, causing each to separately manifest on the Material Plane. The creature's body returns to life with 1 hit point, except that it is an undead, and has no memory of its life before death. The creature's soul returns to life as a ghost, which also has no memory of its life before death, and which appears in a random unoccupied space within 100 feet.This spell also neutralizes any poisons and cures nonmagical diseases that affected the creature at the time it died. This spell doesn't, however, remove magical diseases, curses, or similar effects; if these aren't first removed prior to casting the spell, they take effect when the creature returns to life. The spell can't return an undead creature to life.This spell closes all mortal wounds, but it doesn't restore missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survival -- its head, for instance -- the spell automatically fails.

name: Messenger's Speed
description: When you cast this spell, the muscles in your legs begin to burn with an overwhelming desire to move, as thin lines of red lightning trace their way across your body. For the duration of the spell, your movement speed is doubled, your movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity, and you can move through other creatures' spaces as if they were difficult terrain. Whenever you do so, that creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take 1d8 bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. At the end of each of your turns, if you have not moved your full walking speed since the start of your turn, the spell automatically ends. When the spell ends, you automatically suffer one level of exhaustion for each hour of the spell's duration, rounded up.

name: Nylea's Presence
description:
As you finish casting this spell, you drive the arrow into the ground beneath your feet, blessing the land in a 120-foot radius around yourself. For the duration of the spell, whenever a creature takes a short rest here and expends any number of hit dice, it automatically regains the maximum number of hit points possible. In addition, whenever you spend a short rest within the radius of the spell's effects, you automatically regain two expended spell slots of 1st level or below.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the maximum level of the expended spell slots that you regain on a short rest increase to one less than the level of the spell slot used. In addition, if you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration increases to 1 week; if cast using a spell slot of 9th level, the duration increases to 1 year.

name: Peak Eruption
description: Choose a point you can see within range. A small peak of earth and rock, 15 feet high and filling a 5-foot square, bursts from the ground at the chosen point. For the duration of the spell, the peak emits an intense heat, forcing each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the peak or that enters the area for the first time on its turn to make a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d6 fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a success.When you cast this spell and as an action on each of your turns for the spell's duration, you can cause the peak to erupt in a small burst of magma, forcing each creature within 30 feet of the peak to make a Dexterity saving throw. Affected creatures take 2d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.When the spell ends, the peak erupts with a final blast of lava, then immediately cools. Each creature within 30 feet of the peak when the spell ends must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d6 fire damage and is restrained as the wave of molten rock cools around its legs. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not restrained. A creature restrained in this way can use an action to escape by making a successful Strength check against your spell save DC. A creature can also escape by breaking the rock around its legs, which has AC 17 and 15 hit points; vulnerability to bludgeoning damage; and immunity to cold, fire, necrotic, poison, and psychic damage.

name: Pharika's Cure
components: S, M (the fang of a viper)
description:
As you cast this spell, you touch the tip of the viper's fang to a willing target. The fang begins to slowly leech the life from the creature, and transfers it to you. The target loses a number of hit points equal to 3d10 + your spellcasting modifier, and you regain an equal number of hit points.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the number of hit points transferred increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Portent of Betrayal
description: Choose two hostile creatures that you can see within range, and that are both within 30 feet of each other. Each of those targets must make a Wisdom saving throw. If a target fails its saving throw, on its next turn, it becomes hostile to the other target. On its turn, it must use its movement to get closer to the target, and if possible, it must take the Attack action and make a melee weapon attack against the other target.After casting this spell, roll a d20 and record the result. Once before the end of your next short or long rest, when you roll a d20 you can choose to replace the roll with the recorded one. You can do so after seeing the roll, but before you know the result. If you have already cast a spell that allows you to roll any number of d20s and record the results, you lose the results of any previously recorded rolls.

name: Psychic Intrusion
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when a creature you can see within range casts a spell
description: You can use your reaction to cast this spell when another creature that you can see within range casts a spell. You attempt to tear through the psychic protections around the target's mind, forcing it to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a successful save, the target takes 6d8 psychic damage and nothing else happens. On a failed save, the secrets once held within the target's mind become yours, and you learn the actions and methods necessary to cast the spell which the target just cast. Until you cast this spell again, or until the end of your next short or long rest, you can cast the same spell the target just cast as if it were a spell that you know and have prepared. You must still expend a spell slot of the appropriate level to cast the spell, and must provide all necessary material components for the spell's casting.

name: Rage of Purphoros
components: V, S, M (a piece of obsidian or lava rock)
description: Choose a creature that you can see within range. The ground beneath that creature wells up and cracks, spewing molten magma and forcing the target to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save the target takes 6d8 fire damage and is knocked prone. On a success it takes half as much damage and is not knocked prone.After casting this spell, roll a d20 and record the result. Once before the end of your next short or long rest, when you roll a d20 you can choose to replace the roll with the recorded one. You can do so after seeing the roll, but before you know the result. If you have already cast a spell that allows you to roll any number of d20s and record the results, you lose the results of any previously recorded rolls.

name: Ray of Dissolution
description: Choose a willing creature that you can see within range that is currently charmed or frightened. A ray of powerful light, blinding in its eminence but full of warmth, descends upon the target. The target is no longer charmed or frightened, and any spell causing the condition on the target automatically ends. In addition, the target gains 3d6 temporary hit points as the warm light soothes its aches and pains.

name: Read the Bones
components: S, M (the bones of a medium or smaller creature, each carved with runes)
description: As you cast this spell, you toss the bones before you, and use the runes that appear to help foretell the future. When you cast this spell, roll 4d20 and record the result of each roll. Then, unless you cast this spell as a ritual, you take 2d12 necrotic damage as the spirits of the dead take their vengeance. Up to four times before the end of your next short or long rest, when you roll a d20 you can choose to replace the roll with one of the recorded rolls. You can do so after seeing the roll, but before you know the result. You can use each recorded result only once in this way. If you have already cast a spell that allows you to roll any number of d20s and record the results, you lose the results of any previously recorded rolls.

name: Rescue from the Underworld
components: V, S, M (an object once owned by the creature you are attempting to resurrect, two gold coins, and a musical instrument)
description: You attempt to resurrect a deceased creature in the most direct way possible - by traveling to the land of the dead, and bringing their spirit back to the mortal coil. The creature that you are attempting to resurrect must have been dead for no longer than 1 year, and must have an Intelligence of 5 or greater. After casting this spell, you immediately die. Then, if the soul of the creature you are attempting to resurrect is free and willing, you both return to life. Otherwise only you return. When the target returns to life, it either returns to its body if it is whole and available, or a new body is magically created for it, your choice. A new body created this way resembles the target's original body exactly. When the creature is resurrected, it returns to life with all its hit points. This spell neutralizes any poisons and cures any diseases afflicting the creature when it died, and closes all mortal wounds and restores any missing body parts. Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. Both you and the target take a -4 penalty to all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks. Every time you or the target finishes a long rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it disappears. This penalty occurs for you even if you fail to resurrect the target.

name: Sea God's Revenge
components: V, S, M (a seashell carved with the symbol of an oceanic deity)
description: You summon the ancient and primordial anger of the sea god, and brandish the power of the waves for your own needs. As you cast this spell, you create a powerful blast of water. The jet of water appears as your choice of either a 45-foot cone, or a 60-foot long, 5-foot wide line. Each creature caught in the area must make a Strength saving throw. A creature that fails this saving throw takes 3d8 bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone; a creature that succeeds takes half as much damage and is not. As an action on each of your turns for the spell's duration, you can summon another jet of water, and can be either shape.When the spell ends, roll a d20 and record the result. Once before the end of your next short or long rest, when you roll a d20 you can choose to replace the roll with the recorded one. You can do so after seeing the roll, but before you know the result. If you have already cast a spell that allows you to roll any number of d20s and record the results, you lose the results of any previously recorded rolls.

name: Shredding Winds
description:
You whip the air around you into a powerful frenzy, with gusts so strong they rip the branches from the trees. Each flying creature within 30 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw, taking 4d6 slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A creature that fails this saving throw is automatically knocked prone, and falls 60 feet toward the ground. If that creature does not hit the ground, it automatically recovers from being prone at the start of its turn, and can continue flying as normal.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the range of the effect increases by 5 feet and the damage increases by 2d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Sip of Hemlock
description: You touch a piece of prepared food no larger than 1 lb. in size or a container holding 4 pints or less of liquid, contaminating it with an incredibly potent poison. Any time a creature eats or drinks the touched food or liquid before the end of the spell, it must make a Constitution saving throw. Creatures immune to being poisoned automatically succeed on this saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 12d10 poison damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it is automatically killed. If the target succeeds on the saving throw, it is instead poisoned for 12 hours. Each hour that the creature remains poisoned, it must make another Constitution saving throw, taking 1d10 poison damage on a failed save, or ending the poisoned condition on itself on a success.

name: Spark Jolt
description: You slam the ground with great force, causing a shower of red-hot sparks. Each creature of your choice within 15 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A creature that fails this saving throw is also blinded until the start of your next turn.After casting this spell, roll a d20 and record the result. Once before the end of your next short or long rest, when you roll a d20 you can choose to replace the roll with the recorded one. You can do so after seeing the roll, but before you know the result. If you have already cast a spell that allows you to roll any number of d20s and record the results, you lose the results of any previously recorded rolls.

name: Steam Augury
description: You coat one hand in flame and the other in water, and crash the two together, generating a powerful cloud of steam. As the cloud slowly dissipates, you watch its movements for any sign of a pattern, detecting in its subtle movements vision of the future. When you cast this spell, roll 5d20, and choose and record one result. Then choose attack roll, saving throw, or ability check. For the duration of the spell, whenever you make a roll of the chosen type, you can instead choose to use the recorded result in place of the roll, allowing the possible futures you have seen to guide you.

name: Stymied Hopes
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell
description:
You attempt to interfere with a creature in the process of casting a spell, forcing it to expend additional magical energy to continue the casting. At the same time, you steal this energy for your own, and use it to help yourself divine the future. If the creature is casting a spell of 2nd level or lower, it must expend an additional spell slot of 1st level or higher, otherwise its spell fails and has no effect. Then, if its spell fails, roll a d20 and record the result. Once before the end of your next short or long rest, when you roll a d20 you can choose to replace the roll with the recorded one. You can do so after seeing the roll, but before you know the result. If you have already cast a spell that allows you to roll any number of d20s and record the results, you lose the results of any previously recorded rolls.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the level of spell affected and the level of the spell slot that must be expended both increase by 1 for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Swan Song
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell
components: S, M (the feather of a swan, goose, duck, or other bird capable of swimming)
description:
You attempt to wrest control of a spell from the creature casting it, turning the magical energy away from its intended use and towards the summoning of new life instead. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails, and instead of the intended effect, the spell summons a beast of the opposing spellcaster's choice of a CR equal to or less than the level of the interrupted spell. The summoned creature is under the opposing spellcaster's control, acts at the end of its turn, and obeys any mental commands the opposing spellcaster issues to it (no action required).
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the interrupted spell instead fails and instead summons a beast under the spellcaster's control if its level is less than or equal to 1 + the level of the spell slot you used.

name: Thassa's Bounty
components: V, M (a conch shell, and gold dust worth 150 gp, consumed in the casting)
description: You pour the gold dust into the conch shell, and whisper into it the details of a problem you are currently facing, then hold the shell to your ear to hear the careful reply. After casting this spell, your deity reveals to you the location of one item with a value of 500 gp or greater within 5 miles that could prove useful in handling the problem you whispered into the shell.

name: Time to Feed
description: Choose a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be marked with the instinctual sign of prey. Until the start of your next turn, any creature that begins its turn within 30 feet of the target and is not friendly to it must use its action to attack the target. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points by an attack before this spell ends, both you and the creature that made the attack each regain a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting modifier.

name: Titan's Strength
components: S, M (a small piece of lava rock)
description: Your touch imbues a willing creature with all the magnificent physical strength of the titans of myth. Until this spell ends, the target has advantage on all Strength based ability checks and saving throws.After casting this spell, roll a d20 and record the result. Once before the spell ends, when the target rolls a d20 it can choose to replace the roll with the recorded one. The target can do so after seeing the roll, but before it knows the result.

name: Vanquish the Foul
description: As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack with a weapon against one creature within the spell's range, otherwise the spell fails. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, and radiant light bursts from your weapon, searing the target and dealing an additional 6d10 radiant damage. If the target is an aberration, fey, fiend, giant, or monstrosity, it takes an additional 4d10 damage from this spell and has disadvantage on the saving throw made to avoid being blinded.After casting this spell, roll a d20 and record the result. Once before the end of your next short or long rest, when you roll a d20 you can choose to replace the roll with the recorded one. You can do so after seeing the roll, but before you know the result. If you have already cast a spell that allows you to roll any number of d20s and record the results, you lose the results of any previously recorded rolls.

name: Viper's Kiss
components: S, M (the fang of a snake)
description: You strike with the fang in your hand, making a melee spell attack against a creature within range. If the attack hits, the target takes 1d4 piercing damage, and for the duration of the spell, the target must make a Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns. On a failed save, the target can only take the Attack, Dash, and Disengage actions this turn.

name: Blazing Shoal
description: As you cast this spell, a wreath of flames appears around your body, which quickly takes on the identifiable shape of a school of fish, floating in the air around you as if swimming. These fish fill a 10-foot radius around you, and follow along with your movements. Until the end of your next turn, your melee attacks deal an additional 4d8 fire damage, and each creature that starts its turn within the radius must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 3d8 fire damage.

name: Back for More
components: V, S, M (a bone gilded with previous metals and jewels, worth 100 gp)
description: This spell revives the corpse of a Small or larger Beast, Dragon, or Monstrosity within range, returning it to a mimicry of life, animated by necromantic energy. The target retains its ability scores and statistics, except that its type is now undead.You can cast this spell normally as an action on your turn. However, if a creature within range of you dies, you can instead cast this spell as a reaction, consuming the spell's material components in the process. If you do, at the end of the current turn, the creature can immediately move up to its speed and take an action.The animated creature acts immediately after you in initiative, and on each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 60 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete. If you issue no commands, the creature acts as it would have in life, except that it is not hostile to you and your allies, and will not willingly venture further than 60 feet from you. The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you've given it. To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends.

name: Perilous Research
components: M (a spellbook, and 300 gp worth of ink, papers, and other components, expended during the casting)
description:
You use your arcane power to glimpse secrets beyond reality, attempting to learn one spell of 3rd-level or lower from the wizard spell list. To do so, the time you spend casting the spell must be spent in deep meditation, taking no other actions. Your hands move on their own, using the material components of the spell to record the secrets you learn into your spellbook, culminating in the instructions for casting a new spell. During this time, you are unaware of your surroundings and are considered to be unconscious. You can choose to end the casting of the spell at any time. If you take damage, become affected by a spell or other magical ability, or choose to willingly stop casting the spell, the process is interrupted and the spell fails, and you gain no benefits from its casting. For each hour spent casting the spell, you must make a Constitution saving throw or an Intelligence (Arcana) check, your choice, with a DC equal to 10 + the level of the spell slot expended. On a failed save or ability check, you automatically suffer one level of exhaustion as your mind is overwhelmed by the burden of the knowledge you encounter, but can otherwise continue the process of casting the spell. On a successful save or ability check, you continue casting the spell as normal with no negative effects. When you finish casting the spell, you can attempt a single DC 20 Intelligence (Arcana) check to attempt to influence what spell you learn.
 If the check is successful, you decide exactly what spell you have learned, as long as it of 3rd-level or below. If you fail the check by 5 or less, you can decide what level the spell you learn is, as long as it is 3rd-level or below, but not the exact spell. If you fail the check by 6 or more, you can decide what school the spell you learn is in, but not the exact spell or it's level.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the cost of the spell's material components increases by 100 gp for each slot level above 3rd, and the maximum level of the spell learned increases to the level of the expended spell slot.

name: Cinder Storm
description: You launch a fireball high into the air, where it hovers as thick storm clouds begin to form around it, centered on a point of your choice that you can see. Fiery rain then begins to pour from the clouds in a 120-foot radius around the chosen point. Each creature that starts its turn in the area under the clouds (no more than 5,000 feet below the clouds) must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Flammable structures and objects in the area not being worn or carried catch fire and begin to burn.As a bonus action on each of your turns, you can move the center of the storm up to 30 feet in a direction of your choice to sit above a point you can see. At the start of each of your turns, if you can not see the center of the storm, the spell ends and the storm immediately dissipates.If you are outdoors in stormy conditions when you cast this spell, the spell transforms the existing storm instead of creating a new one, giving you control over the existing storm. Under such conditions, the spell's damage increases by 1d6, the radius of the storm increases to 360 feet, and you can move the storm up to 60 feet on each of your turns.

name: Allied Strategies
components: V, S, M (four interlocking metal rings)
description: Choose up to four willing creatures you can see within range. Each of the chosen targets then chooses one skill which they are proficient in. Knowledge, techniques, and strategies related to that skill are magically shared between the chosen creatures, granting each of them proficiency with any skill chosen by another target for the spell's duration. If two or more targets each choose the same skill, no additional benefit is given.

name: Cinder Hatchet
description: You create a fiery axe made of smoke and ashes, and throw it at a creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack, ignoring half and three-quarters cover. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 fire damage and the axe explodes, forcing the target and each creature within 10 feet of it succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the start of your next turn by the cinders.

name: Lava Axe
description:
You create a fiery axe made of magma, and throw it at a creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack, ignoring half and three-quarters cover. On a hit, the target takes 8d6 fire damage and the axe explodes, creating a pool of magma in a 10-foot radius centered on the target. The magma is difficult terrain, and any creature that begins its turn in the magma or enters the radius for the first time on its turn automatically takes 2d6 fire damage. The magma cools and solidifies after 1 minute, becoming safe to step on.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the initial damage and the damage caused by the pool of magma both increase by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

name: Armed // Dangerous
components: V, S, M (a magnet and a small iron rod)
description:
When you cast this spell, choose a willing creature that you can see within range, and choose to make them either Armed or Dangerous. If you choose Armed, red lightning crackles along the target's arms, arcing across their weapon. Until the end of their next turn, the target's weapon attacks deal an additional 3d6 lightning damage, and the target can make an additional weapon attack when it takes the Attack action. If you choose Dangerous, the target's weapon attacks deal an additional 3d6 thunder damage, and any creature the target successfully hits with a weapon attack on its next turn has disadvantage on all attack rolls against any creature other than the target for one round.
 Fuse. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can choose both Armed and Dangerous. If you do, the lighting and thunder damage each increase to 4d6.

name: Catch // Release
description:
When you cast this spell, choose a creature that you can see within range, and choose either Catch or Release. The target must make a Wisdom on saving throw. If the target succeeds on the saving throw, nothing happens. If the target fails the saving throw and you choose Catch, the target becomes charmed by you for the duration. The charmed creature will treat you as an ally and will act to defend you, even against its own allies. If the target fails the saving throw and you choose Release, the target enters a state of frenzy. While frenzied, the target has disadvantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws and ability checks, and can take no other action except to attack the nearest creature. A creature affected by this spell can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
 Fuse. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level or higher, you can choose both Catch and Release. When you do, you can instead choose two creatures within range and must choose one for the Catch effect of the spell, and one for the Release effect of the spell.

name: Debt to the Deathless
components: V, S, M (a vial of blood, and 10 pp for each creature targeted by the spell, consumed in the casting)
description:
You hold the coins in your hand and drip blood onto them from the vial, watching as they fade away when the ruby liquid hits their shining surface. The payment is well worth the debt to be collected. Choose any number of creatures that you can see within range. Each of those creatures must make a Constitution saving throw, losing 12d4 hit points on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. You then gain a number of temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt this way.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 6th.

name: Protect // Serve
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when an ally within range is attacked
description:
You can use your reaction to cast this spell when an ally that you can see within range becomes the target of a melee or ranged attack. When you cast this spell, you can choose to either Protect or Serve. If you choose to Protect, until the start of your next turn the target gains a +2 bonus to AC and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. If you choose to Serve, the attacking creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or suffer disadvantage on the attack roll.
 Fuse. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can choose both Protect and Serve. If you do and the attack misses, the target can use its reaction to make a single melee weapon attack against the attacking creature.

name: Riot Control
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when you become the target of an attack made by a creature
description: As you cast this spell, your eyes glow with a powerful radiance, and your body shines like the sun, obscuring it from attack. For the spell's duration, any attack that a creature makes against you, including the triggering attack, has disadvantage. Attacks made by creatures with blindsight or those immune to being blinded, as well as attacks made by objects such as traps, are not affected. For the spell's duration, whenever a creature makes an attack against you and misses, you automatically regain a number of hit points equal to your spellcasting modifier. In addition, whenever a creature within 10 feet of you makes an attack against you, you can use your reaction to cause a sudden burst of light, forcing each creature within 10 feet to succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of its next turn. If you do, the spell automatically ends.

name: Turn // Burn
components: V, S, M (a caterpillar cocoon, that you burn during the casting)
description:
When you cast this spell, choose either Turn or Burn, then choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. This spell has no effect on a shapechanger or a creature with 0 hit points. If you chose Turn, on a failed save the target is transformed into an elemental weird with AC of 10, 10 hit points, all of its ability scores are 4, and it loses all proficiencies, bonuses, and abilities. This transformation lasts until the end of its next turn or until it is reduced to 0 hit points. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked unconscious. The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment. If you chose Burn, on a failed save the creature's skin turns to flame, and it takes 8d6 fire damage at the end of its next turn. Any creature that begins or ends its turn within 10 feet of the creature before that time must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a success.
 Fuse. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can choose both Turn and Burn. The target suffers the effects of Burn before the effects of Turn end.

name: Acolyte's Reward
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when you would be dealt damage by a spell
description:
Acting quickly, you call upon your sworn deity to protect you, crafting a shield of glimmering light around yourself. The damage that triggered the spell is reduced by 1d8 for each level you have in the cleric or paladin class.If this spell reduces the damage dealt to 0, you can redirect the magical energy as part of the same reaction, making a ranged spell attack against a creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet. On a hit, the target takes 3d8 force damage.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage dealt by the spell increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Ad Nauseum
description: You speak a short command, up to 25 words in length, to a creature that you can see within range. At the start of each of its turns for the spell's durations, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or use its action that turn to follow the given command to the best of its ability.If the target dies while under the effects of the spell, it is reanimated as a zombie after 1 minute. The zombie then continues to follow the given command until it is killed. If a creature attempts to interfere with the zombie while it is carrying out the command, the zombie becomes hostile to that creature until it is allowed to freely continue carrying out the command.

name: Aid the Fallen
components: S, M (a pinch of bone dust mixed with metal shavings)
description: Choose up to two living creatures you can see within range that have 0 hit points. Both of those creatures regain 2d4 hit points, and gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting modifier.

name: Aether Storm
description:
You summon a powerful storm of energy, which whirls and rips at the threads of magic in the surrounding area. When you cast this spell, choose one school of magic other than evocation. For the duration of the spell, any creature within 300 feet of you can not cast spells from the chosen school of 5th level or below. Any creature within range of the spell's effects can disrupt the magical storm by choosing to take 5d10 force damage, ending the spell's effects if it does so.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, all spells from the chosen school of a level equal to or below the level of the spell slot you used are prevented from being cast.

name: ﻿Crystal Magic Weapon
description: With a touch, you cause a nonmagical weapon to grow razor sharp crystals, which hum with magical energy. The weapon gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage for the duration, and deals an extra 1d8 psychic damage on a successful hit. Treat the weapon as magical for the purposes of overcoming damage resistance.

name: Crystal Soul Spear
description: With a gesture, you summon a massive spear above your head, with large magical crystal protruding from it. With a flick of your wrist, you launch it at a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, taking 12d6 psychic damage and 12d6 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

name: Dorhys’ Gnawing
components: V, S, M (a handful of dead bugs)
description:
A cloud of biting, stinging insects bursts forth from the palm of your hand, swarming on a point you can see within range. For the duration, all creatures within 15 feet of the chosen point must make a Constitution saving throw when they enter the radius for the first time on a turn or when they start their turn in the radius. On a failed save, the creature takes 4d8 necrotic damage, and has disadvantage on saving throws made to maintain concentration until the start of its next turn.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for every level of the spell slot above 4th.

name: Lightning Spear
description:
You create a spear of pure light in your empty hand, which crackles like lightning with divine energy. You then hurl the spear at a target within range, forcing them to make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 radiant damage and 3d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 radiant or 1d6 lightning, your choice, for each level above 3rd.

name: Tears of Denial
description: When you finish casting this spell you touch a willing creature, granting it a ward against death itself. The next time during the spell’s duration that the target would be reduced to 0 hit points, it’s reduced to 1 hit point instead. Afterwards, the spell ends.

name: Alpha Brawl
description: Choose a creature that you can see within range, which must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, that creature must use its action on its next turn to make a single weapon attack against each creature in range. Each other creature hit by the target must then make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the hit creature must immediately use its reaction to make a single weapon attack against the target, if possible.

name: Curse of Echoes
components: V, S, M (a crystal idol worth 1500 gp)
description: You strike a creature you can see within range with a curse, binding its magic to your own and vice-versa. For the duration of the spell, whenever the target finishes casting a spell of 6th level or below, you can use your reaction to attempt to cast the same spell. To do so, you must succeed on a spellcasting ability check with a DC of 14 + the level of the spell being cast, and the spell can not require a material component with a gold cost, one that is consumed by the spell's casting, or one which can not be physically replicated without the necessary material component, such as booming blade or green-flame blade, but otherwise you must be able to replicate the spell's components.If successful, you cast the spell without expending a spell slot, at the same level as the original caster, except that you can choose new targets for the spell's effects. If the spell required the caster to choose between several effects, such as the bestow curse spell, you can choose different effects than the original caster.If you cast a spell in this way that requires concentration, the spell's effects and your concentration on it immediately end when this spell ends.

name: Better than One
description:
You touch a willing creature that is both the same size and type as you. Slowly at first, and then with increasing speed, the magic melds you and the target together, transforming both of you into a single, two-headed creature. This transformation grants several benefits for the duration:
 Your hit points become equal to the sum of the remaining hit points of both you and the target.
 Your AC and ability scores each become equal to the highest value between you and the target (for example, if you have a Dexterity of 12 and the target has a Dexterity of 16, your Dexterity is 16 for the spell's duration.)
 You have access to all racial traits and class abilities available to both you and the target. For the Spellcasting feature, the number of spell slots you have while transformed is equal to the number of spell slots you have normally. If both you and the target have the Spellcasting feature, you have access to any spells that you and the target both know and have prepared that are of a level you could normally cast.
 You can now take two actions, two bonus actions, and two reactions each round. In addition, you can concentrate on up to two spells at a time. In order to take any actions, both you and the target must agree on the action to be taken.
 You have advantage on all Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws made to avoid being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious. In addition, magic can't put you to sleep.
 When the spell ends, you and the target are split into two separate creatures once more, and the target appears in an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of you.

name: Felidar Umbra
components: V, S, M (the fur of a beast, tied around a rock totem carved to resemble a lion)
description:
A deep green aura of energy surrounds the creature you touch, growing larger, eventually resolving into the shape of a maned big cat, with a crown of horns. Though this umbra is translucent, it surrounds the target with a physical presence, protecting them from harm. The umbra has a number of hit points equal to 5 x your spellcasting modifier. Any damage that would be dealt to the target during the spell's duration is dealt to the umbra instead. If the umbra is reduced to 0 hit points, the spell immediately ends, and any excess damage carries over to the target. The umbra can not regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.In addition, the target is granted the following effects by the umbra:
 The target's size increases by one category, up to Huge, and its speed becomes 60 feet. In addition, if the target takes a 10-foot running start, it can long jump up to 25 feet.
 When the target takes the Attack action on its turn, it can choose to attack with the umbra's claws, making two melee weapon attacks. Each attack deals slashing damage equal to 2d8 + the target's Strength modifier. Whenever the target hits a creature with an attack from one of these claws, it regains a number of hit points equal to your spellcasting modifier.
 When a creature within 30 feet of the target would be reduced to 0 hit points by a spell or attack, the target can use its reaction to transfer the umbra to that creature. Any damage that would be dealt to the creature is instead dealt to the umbra, and that creature gains the benefits of the spell's effects for the remainder of its duration.|
 If you cast this spell as an action, its duration is 1 minute; if cast as a ritual, its duration becomes 1 hour instead.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration increases by 1 minute if cast using an action, or 1 hour if cast as a ritual, for each slot level above 3rd. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the umbra instead has a number of hit points equal to 10 x your spellcasting modifier.

name: Apex of Power
description: Unlimited magical energy rushes through you, and you can feel the power surge through every fiber of your being. Choose seven spells that you know, one for each spell level 1st through 7th. The chosen spells must have a casting time of 1 action, and can not require material components that have a cost associated with them. On each of your turns for the next seven rounds, you can use an action to automatically cast one of the chosen spells without expending a spell slot. You can cast each chosen spell only once, and each spell is cast at its minimum possible level.

name: Vivien's Invocation
components: V, S, M (the bone of a wild animal, and a diamond worth 2000 gp)
description: Powerful nature magic surges through your body, and you feel the primal instincts of bygone animals surging through you, waiting to be released. For the duration of the spell, you are swathed in shimmering emerald light and can use a bonus action on your turn to summon a beast of CR 7 or below. A summoned creature appears in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet, acts at the end of your turn, is friendly to you and your allies and obeys any verbal commands you issue to it (no action required). A summoned creature is also considered fey, and disappears after 1 hour or when reduced to 0 hit points. The spell ends when you have summoned seven creatures, or when you have summoned a number of creatures whose total CR is greater than or equal to 7. When the spell ends, any summoned creatures remain as normal, but you can no longer summon additional creatures.

name: Aminatou's Augury
components: V, S, M (a filigreed hourglass worth 400 gp, and a jewel worth 250 gp, consumed in the casting)
description: Choose up to eight spells of 6th-level or below that you know or have written in your spellbook. Using the hourglass as a focus for your power and the jewel as an offering of power, you use strange and unstable time magic to draw the power of the chosen spells from the future, allowing you to use them as you wish. For the next 24 hours, you gain the ability to cast the chosen spells without expending a spell slot. You can cast each spell chosen this way only once, and can cast only one spell from each spell school.

name: Aether Charge
description: Choose an allied beast that you can see within range. The target begins to shine with magical energy, which is released in a single burst as the target launches into the air, moving in an arc and landing at a point of your choice within 100 feet.Each creature within 30 feet of the target when it lands must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails this saving throw is pushed 10 feet away from the target. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.If the creature is a druid using its Wild Shape feature, the companion granted to a ranger by the Ranger's Companion feature, or the familiar of a wizard summoned by the find familiar spell, it instead deals 6d6 force damage when it lands, and each creature that fails the Dexterity saving throw is knocked prone instead of pushed.

name: Metallic Mastery
components: V, M (a drop of oil and a length of knotted rope)
description: Choose a magic item or construct that you can see within range. If the target is a construct or sentient magic item, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you until the end of your turn. If the target is a magic item that is worn or carried, the creature wearing or carrying the item must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the magic item teleports to your location, appearing in your hand as long as you have at least one hand free. If the target is a construct, you can use your action to verbally command the construct to move up to its speed and take one action of your choice. If the target is a magic item, you gain any benefits granted by the magic item until the end of your turn, and the previous owner loses any benefits provided by the item. If the magic item normally requires attunement to gain these benefits, you are considered attuned to the item until the end of the turn. When the spell ends, the magic item teleports back to its previous location, and its previous owner regains any benefits granted by the item.

name: Phyrexian Rebirth
components: V S, M (a drop of oil, a bit of bonemeal, and 2500 gp worth of binding unguents and glues, expended in the casting)
description: You mix the oil and glue together, creating a disgusting and foul-smelling blob. Then choose a point that you can see within range. Each creature within 30 feet of the chosen point must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 6d10 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Then, creatures affected by the spell with less than 20 remaining hit points automatically die. If at least one creature is killed as a result of the spell, you can then mix the bonemeal with the oil and glue and fashion it into a simplistic doll. As you do so, the corpses of those killed by the spell begin to merge together, their skin and fleshing overlapping and molding together. At the start of your next turn after casting the spell, the corpses are transformed into a boneclaw under your control. The boneclaw's statistics are the same as those found in Modernkainen's Tome of Foes, except that its Charisma score is equal to 15, plus one additional point for every creature killed by the spell, potentially changing its hit points as a result. The boneclaw can not regain hit points, and when reduced to 0 hit points, it automatically crumbles into dust. The created boneclaw is friendly to you and your companion. Roll initiative for the creature, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the boneclaw, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions. You can only have one boneclaw under your control at a time as a result of this spell, and if you create a new one, the original is automatically reduced to 0 hit points, causing it to crumble to dust.

name: Bureaucracy
components: V, M (a stack of at least 20 pieces of parchment, an inkwell, and a quill or other writing instrument)
description: When you cast this spell, you magically bind every creature currently in the initiative order, as well as any creature that joins the initiative order before the spell ends, into a specific sequence of actions, known as the ACTION ORDER. After casting this spell, you must either move up to your speed or make a single weapon attack. This act is then added to the ACTION ORDER. At the start of each creature's turn in the initiative order, that creature must perform all acts currently in the ACTION ORDER, in the same order they were added. Movement made or actions taken to complete the ACTION ORDER do not count towards that creature's total movement speed or number of actions taken during the turn. If the creature succeeds in following the ACTION ORDER, the next act they take during their turn is then added to the ACTION ORDER. Adding a new act to the ACTION ORDER does require the use of the creature's normal movement speed and number of actions per turn. Only one act can be added to the ACTION ORDER each turn. If a creature fails to perform all acts in the ACTION ORDER in the correct sequence, or performs an act in the ACTION ORDER incorrectly, that creature is immediately reduced to 0 hit points and begins dying.Acts added to the ACTION ORDER only apply in the general sense. For example, if a creature adds a movement of 30 feet to the ACTION ORDER by flying 30 feet in any direction after performing the rest of the acts in the ACTION ORDER, any creature repeating that act must only move 30 feet in any direction by any means. Similarly, if a creature makes an attack, it doesn't matter what the attack was made with or who the attack was made against. Casting a spell can not be added as an act to the ACTION ORDER, and if a creature takes the Cast a Spell action as the first act on their turn, they do not add any acts to the ACTION ORDER.

name: Aether Gale
description: As you cast this spell, a large whirlwind forms in a 10-foot radius around you, stretching 60 feet up into the air. Creatures and objects within 10 feet of you when you cast this spell and at the start of each of your turns for the spell's durations must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be thrown 10 feet away from you. If a creature pushed this way strikes an object or another creature, both take 1d8 bludgeoning damage for every 5 feet they were thrown.When you cast this spell and at the start of each of your turns for the spell's duration, choose a Huge or smaller creature or object you can see within 100 feet. That creature or object must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be lifted off of the ground and pulled into the center of the whirlwind, where magical winds and loose debris batter it, causing it to take 4d6 bludgeoning damage. At the start of your next turn, that creature or object is ejected from the top of the whirlwind, and is thrown 60 feet in a randomly determined direction. The ejected creature or object falls to the ground, landing in an unoccupied space 60 feet away in the determined direction. Unless an ejected creature has some way of stopping the fall, it takes damage from the fall as normal.

name: Anchor to the Aether
description: Choose a creature that you can see within range. Floating motes of light in the shape of magical runes appear in the chosen space, telling hidden stories of the target's past and future, distracting and disorienting it. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save the target is stunned for the duration of the spell or until it takes damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell's effects on a success.After casting this spell, roll a d20 and record the result. Once before the end of your next short or long rest, when you roll a d20 you can choose to replace the roll with the recorded one. You can do so after seeing the roll, but before you know the result. If you have already cast a spell that allows you to roll any number of d20s and record the results, you lose the results of any previously recorded rolls.

name: Abuna's Chant
description:
As you chant the words of the spell, bands of golden light appear around your arms, head, and chest. These golden bands shed bright light in a 10-foot radius, and dim light for an additional 10 feet. Choose one:
 The golden light soothes your wounds. You regain a number of hit points equal to your spellcasting modifier at the start of each of your turns for the spell's duration.
 The bands of light wrap tightly around you, providing a temporary shield against harm. For the duration of the spell, whenever you are hit by an attack, any damage dealt by that attack is dealt to the shield of light instead. The shield has a number of hit points equal to 5 times your spellcasting modifier. When the shield reaches 0 hit points, it disappears and the spell ends. When the shield is reduced to 0 hit points, any remaining damage from the attack is dealt to you instead.
 Entwine. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th-level or higher, you gain both effects of the spell instead of just one.

name: Blessed Sanctuary
components: V, S, M (the horn of a unicorn, obtained without violence)
description: You summon a unicorn of shining gold and opalescence from the celestial plane in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The unicorn is friendly to you and your allies, and remains in the spot it was summoned unless you use a bonus action on your turn to politely ask it to move, at which point it will move up to 30 feet to a new spot you designate.The unicorn exudes a 120-foot holy aura, represented by a halo of golden light. Fey, fiends, and undead within 120 feet of the unicorn when it appears must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be pushed directly away from the unicorn until they are 120 feet or further from it. A fey, fiend, or undead that attempts to enter the radius of this aura must succeed on another Wisdom saving throw to do so, and must repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns while within the aura or be pushed back outside of it.Creatures within the aura are immune to damage, and creatures inside the aura can not attack or target creatures outside of it and vice-versa. Any creature within the aura that regains hit points from a spell of 1st level or higher automatically regains the maximum number of hit points.At the start of each of your turns for the spell's duration, you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your own spell save DC. On a failed save, the spell immediately ends. If the spell ends, or if the unicorn is attacked or targeted by a spell or ability, it vanishes, returning to the celestial plane and causing the holy aura to disappear.

name: ﻿Ancestral Memory
description: When you cast this spell, roll 1d100 + your spellcasting ability. On a roll of 70 or higher, you successfully recall a memory of your ancestor related to a single problem or question you have. The DM determines exactly what this information is, and how much you know, but it is always pertinent to the current situation. For example, an ancestor may have fought the same type of enemy you are currently facing, allowing you to suddenly recall what types of damage are most effective against that creature.

name: Bleed
description: When you cast this spell, choose a creature that you can see within range that is at 0 hit points. If the creature is stable, they begin dying, and must roll death saving throws as appropriate. If you cast this spell on a creature who is currently dying, they automatically fail their next death saving throw.

name: Blend with Surroundings
components: V, S, M (a piece from a gaming set)
description:
The spell changes the appearance of the touched creature so that it better blends into its surroundings. While the target remains motionless, they gain a +20 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks. The target’s armor blends perfectly into the illusion, and for the duration, the target loses any disadvantage to stealth checks that their armor would impose.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration increases by 10 minutes for every level of the spell slot above 1st.

name: Body Double
