description: When you cast this spell, choose two creatures that you can see within range. Designate one the primary target and the other the secondary target. The primary target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the primary target’s appearance, scent, mannerisms, and sounds change to match those of the secondary target. The two targets are indistinguishable. As a result, if the targets are adjacent, any actions taken which affects only one target has a 50% chance to affect the other target instead.

name: Burst of Insight
description: You draw deep into the depths of your mind, leaving yourself temporarily frazzled, but allowing for greater insight. You may cast this spell when you make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma based ability check in which you are proficient. You double your proficiency bonus for that check, but you are stunned until the beginning of your next turn.

name: Calm Spirits
description: This spell functions like the calm emotions spell, except that it only affects undead creatures, rather than humanoids.

name: Cloak of Dreams
components: V, S, M (a rose petal and a drop of perfume)
description: You surround yourself with a soporific aroma, lulling those around you to sleep. Creatures which start their turn or move within 5 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw, or immediately fall asleep for 1 minute. Creatures which have the keen smell trait have disadvantage on this saving throw.

name: Detect Technology
components: V, S, M (a piece of wire)
description: This spell functions like detect magic, except that it detects the presence of electronic technology. If you sense technology in this way, you can use your action to determine where the technology draws power from, what power it runs on, and a general idea of what the device’s purpose is. This does not allow you to determine how the technology functions or how to use it.

name: Divide Mind
description: You partition your mind to better focus and organize tasks. For the duration, you have advantage on all Intelligence saving throws and ability checks, and your concentration on spells can not be ended as a result of taking damage. You may take an additional action each round for the duration of the spell, which may only be used to cast a spell of 5th level or lower with a duration of instantaneous.

name: Drain Poison
components: V, S, M (the fang of a venomous creature)
description: You touch a weapon or piece of ammunition to the fang of a poisonous creature, causing the creature’s poison to coat the surface of the weapon. The poison remains until you strike a creature with the weapon, wipe the poison off, or the spell ends. The spell has no effect if the creature whose fang was used was a summoned creature, if it has been dead for more than 1 minute, or if the poison has already been extracted through some other means.

name: Echolocation
description:
When you cast this spell, you gain blindsight out to a range of 30 ft. This ability functions like the echolocation of bats and similar creatures, allowing you to use subtle, non-perceivable sounds to detect the world around you. This blindsight does not work if you are deafened, and if you enter an area affected by the silence spell, this spell immediately ends.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the duration increases to 1 hour. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration increases to 12 hours. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the duration increases to 24 hours.

name: Excruciating Deformation
description: Your touch causes the target to become painfully malformed, and its limbs twist and buckle while its body contorts wildly and uncontrollably. For the duration, the target’s speed is reduced by 10 feet, it has disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throw and ability checks, and it takes 2d6 necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. As an action, the target may make a Constitution saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Explode Head
description: This spell only affects creatures which have heads and which would die from the loss of their head. You choose one creature within range. If that creature has less than 20 hit points, their head explodes, causing them to immediately die. Otherwise the creature must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 6d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, their head explodes, immediately killing them.

name: Garden of Peril
components: V, S, M (a pinch of spores)
description:
A vividly colored mushroom springs into existence in a space within range that you can see. As a bonus action on your turn, you can command the mushroom to release spores, forcing all creatures within 5 feet of the mushroom to make a Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 2d4 rounds. The mushrooms all release spores simultaneously.The mushrooms are Tiny and can not provide cover, but they are sturdy, with AC 7 and 30 hit points. The mushrooms are too small to prevent creatures moving through their squares. When a mushroom is destroyed, it releases one last burst of spores.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you summon one additional mushroom for each level of the spell slot above 2nd.

name: Invigorating Poison
description: The body of the creature gains a metabolic response that allows it to benefit from normally deadly toxins. If the creature would normally be affected by a poison which would cause a penalty to an ability score, the creature instead gains a +2 bonus to that score, and the spell immediately ends. The bonus to the score lasts for 10 minutes. If the poison would have other effects besides the ability score penalty, the other effects take place as normal.

name: Iron Body
components: V, S, M (iron from an iron golem, a hero’s armor, or a war machine)
description:
This spell transforms your body into living iron, turning you into a nearly indestructible, and almost entirely unstoppable machine. For the duration, you gain resistance to acid, fire, and bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-adamantine weapons; immunity to lightning and poison damage; and you are immune to the blinded, deafened, poisoned, and stunned conditions. You also become immune to diseases, and do not need to breathe, eat, or drink for the duration. Any spell which attempts to alter or change your form for the duration, including your own, automatically fails, wasting a spell slot in the attempt. You gain a +4 bonus to your Strength score, a -4 penalty to your Dexterity score, and you move at half speed. Your unarmed attacks now deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage on a hit. Your weight increases by a factor of 10, and you can not swim or float- instead, you automatically sink in water.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the duration increases to 1 hour.

name: Irradiate
description:
When you cast this spell, choose a point within range. Dangerous Low-level radiation suddenly floods a 15-foot radius sphere center centered on the chosen point. All creatures subjected to this radiation are subjected to the normal rules of radiation exposure. The radiation is immediate, and dissipates after the spell is cast- it does not linger in the area, and any creature exposed to it is exposed only once.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radiation released is of a Medium level. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the radiation released is of a High level. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level or higher, the radiation released is of a Severe level.

name: Mad Hallucination
description: One creature which you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you induce a mild hallucination in the target’s mind. The target has disadvantage on all Wisdom saving throws and ability checks for the duration.

name: Mass Pain Strike
description:
When you cast this spell, choose up to three creatures that you can see within range, none of which may be more than 30 feet from each other. Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, those creatures take 3d6 psychic damage and have disadvantage on all attack rolls and ability checks until the start of their next turn. At the start of each of their turns, the targets must make another Wisdom saving throw, suffering the same effects on a failed save, or ending the effect on themselves on a success. If a target succeeds on their original saving throw, they take 4d6 psychic damage and suffer no other effects.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each level of the spell slot above 4th. In addition, when you cast this spell using a 5th level spell slot or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each level of the spell slot above 4th.

name: Mass Suffocation
components: V, S, M (a vial containing some of your breath)
description:
When you cast this spell, choose up to 10 creatures that you can see within range, no two of which may be more than 30 feet apart. Each of
 these creatures must make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, a target is stunned for one round as they attempt to gasp for breath. On a failed save, a target’s breath is forcibly drawn from their lungs, and they begin to suffocate. At the beginning of each of their turns, a target may repeat the Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, they stave off the effects of the spell and may breathe normally for one round, but begin suffocating again at the start of their next turn. A creature who is suffocating can spend a number of rounds equal to their Constitution modifier without air, after which they immediately drop to 0 hit points and begin dying. A creature at 0 hit points who is still suffocating automatically fails their death saving throw.

name: Nightmare
description: You send a hideous and unsettling phantom to disturb the dreams of a creature you name or otherwise specifically designate. If the target is sleeping, they must make a Wisdom saving throw, or otherwise be plagued with nightmares. These nightmares cause the target 1d10 psychic damage, and prevent them from getting the benefits of a short or long rest while they sleep. The difficulty of the saving throw varies depending on your connection to or knowledge of the target. If you have no knowledge of the target, they get a +10 bonus to the throw; if you have secondhand knowledge (having heard of the target), they get a +5 bonus; if you have met the target, they receive no bonus; if you know the target well, they have a -5 penalty to the saving throw. If you have a likeness or picture of the target, they receive a -2 penalty to the saving throw; if you have a possession of theirs, they receive a -4 penalty; if you possess a body part of theirs, or something such as a lock of hairs or nail clippings, they receive a -10 penalty to the saving throw. If the target is awake when you cast the spell, you may choose to enter a trance-like state until the target is asleep, at which point you automatically know the target is asleep, and awaken from the trance to begin casting the spell. While in this trance, you are unaware of your surroundings, and if you are disturbed for any reason, you must make a Constitution saving throw as if you were concentrating on the spell. You may choose to freely end this trance at any time.

name: Orb of the Void
components: V, S, M (a black gemstone of any kind worth 50 gp)
description: When you cast this spell, you summon a 5 foot diameter sphere of weightless, black energy in an unoccupied space within range. As a bonus action, you may move the sphere up to 30 feet on your turn. If the sphere enters the space of a creature, it stops moving. If the sphere enters the space of a creature, or a creature passes through the sphere’s space or ends their turn there, they must make a Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion.

name: Overwhelming Presence
description: When you cast this spell, all creatures within 100 feet of you that can see you must make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the creature is stunned for one round. On a failed save, affected creatures believe they are within the presence of a divine being, and attempt to prostrate themselves immediately. Creatures affected in this way fall prone, are considered stunned for the duration of the spell, and any attack within 5 feet which hits them is an automatic critical hit. Flying creatures which can not hover must use all of their movement on their turn to attempt to land in order to prostrate themselves. A creature affected by this spell may make another saving throw at the beginning of each of their turns and whenever they take damage, ending the effect on itself on a success. When you cast this spell, you may designate any number of targets within 100 feet that you can see to be unaffected by this spell.

name: Pain Strike
description:
Choose one creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d6 psychic damage and has disadvantage on all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks until the start of their next turn. At the start of each of their turns, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw, suffering the same damage and effect on a failed save, or ending the effect on themselves on a success. If the target succeeds on their original saving throw, they take 4d6 psychic damage, and the spell ends.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell’s damage increases by 1d6 for each level of the spell slot above 2nd.

name: Polypurpose Panacea
description:
You touch an ally, granting them one of several minor effects related to their health, well-being, or entertainment, chosen from the list below. Each effect has a different duration listed with it.
 Analgesic: For 1 hour, the target is able to shrug off minor aches and pains such as from a cold or hangover, granting you resistance to necrotic damage.
 Clarity: The target gains a +1 bonus to the first ability check you make within the next minute.
 Hallucination: The target has pleasant hallucinations for 1 hour, which they can tell are not real, but are still distracting, giving them disadvantage on all Wisdom (Perception) checks.
 Intoxication: For 1 hour, the target becomes comfortably intoxicated.
 Resistance: The target gains a +1 bonus to all saving throws made within the next hour.
 Sobriety: The target becomes completely sober for 1 hour, negating any penalties from being drunk; this does not end the effects of the drunkenness, but merely delays them.
 Tenacity: The target gains a number of temporary hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting modifier.
 Wakefulness: For 24 hours, the target does not suffer the effects of missing a single long rest. After 24 hours, if the target has since missed a long rest, they suffer the full effects of doing so.

name: Repulsion
components: V, S, M (a pair of canine statuettes worth at least 50 gp)
description:
When you cast this spell, you create an invisible field of force with a radius of 10 ft., centered on you, which prevents creatures from approaching you. Any creature which enters the radius of the spell or starts its turn there must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes unable to willingly move towards you for the duration of the spell or until they exit the radius of the spell’s effect. If a creature succeeds on their saving throw, they become immune to the effects of the spell until they leave the spell’s radius or the spell ends. If a creature leaves the radius of the spell and attempts to re-enter, they must make another saving throw. This spell does not prevent you from approaching creatures who have failed their saving throw, or prevent a creature from which has failed its saving throw from attacking you if you are within their reach.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the radius of the spell’s effect increases by 10 feet for every level of the expended spell slot above 6th.

name: Selective Invisibility
description:
When you cast this spell, choose one creature that you can see within range. You turn invisible, as per the invisibility spell, but the chosen creature can still see you. You may attack that creature without ending the effects of the spell, but attacking any other creature causes the spell to end.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the number of creatures which can still see you and which you can attack without ending the spell increases by one for every level of the spell slot above 3rd.

name: Sense Vitals
components: V, S, M (a drop of blood)
description:
This spell causes your eyes to shine blood red, and allows you to see the vital areas and weak points of creatures within 30 feet of you as a warm red glow. While affected by this spell, once per round whenever you have advantage on an attack roll made with a finesse or ranged weapon, you deal an additional 1d6 damage if the attack hits.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the additional damage increases by 1d6 for every level of the spell slot above 2nd.

name: Shifting Shadows
components: V, S, M (a drop of ink)
description: When you cast this spell, choose a space within range. From that area, an inky blackness begins to swell forth, filling a 20-foot radius with thick darkness. This darkness does not blind, but instead makes it harder to keep track of creatures. While in this area, any creature may treat any other creature as an ally for the purposes of flanking. Further, creatures provoke attacks of opportunity from allies and foes alike. Whenever a creature would provoke an attack of opportunity from an ally, the ally must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they fail to properly stifle their instinct to attack, and lose their reaction for the round.

name: Sleepwalk
components: V, S, M (a sprig of belladonna)
description:
When you cast this spell, you touch an unconscious or sleeping creature, causing them to slowly rise and stagger about, as if in a half-wakened state. For the duration, the target moves at half speed, can not take actions or reactions, and automatically fails all Strength and Dexterity saving throws and ability checks. You may use a bonus action on your turn to command the target to move to a spot both you and the target can see. Once the target has reached the spot, they cease moving, and will simply stand in place until the spell ends or until given another command. If the creature takes damage, it may automatically make a Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect spell on a success.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the duration increases to 4 hours. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the duration increases to 8 hours.

name: Sound Burst
description: You unleash a burst of cacophonous sound at a point within range. Each creature in a 10-foot radius centered on the chosen point takes 1d8 thunder damage, and must make a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of their next turn. Creatures that can not hear automatically succeed on this saving throw.

name: Synaptic Overload
description: Your touch causes a creature’s synapses to overload, sending energy coursing through their body. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 8d10 lightning damage, and is incapacitated until the end of their next turn. On a success, they instead take half damage, and are not incapacitated.

name: Telekinetic Storm
description: You create a 40-foot radius burst of powerful psychic energy, centered on you. Any creature in the spell’s area of effect must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, creatures take 18d6 force damage, and are stunned until the end of their next turn. On a success, they take half damage and are not stunned. When you cast this spell, you may designate any number of creatures you can see within range to be immune to the spell’s effect.

name: Toxic Rupture
description: You rupture the poison glands of one creature that you can see within 30 feet, causing their poison to spread through their own body. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw against the effects of their own poison. Any subsequent saving throws beyond the first use the poison’s normal DC rather than your spell save DC.

name: Venomous Bite
components: V, S, M (an injury poison worth at least 75 gp, consumed in the casting)
description: You touch the vial of poison to a creature, and it magically drains, filling the target’s teeth instead. For the duration, the target gains a bite attack with which they are proficient. The bite deals 1d6 slashing damage on a success, and on a hit, the bite also inflicts a creature with a dose of the poison contained within the vial. This spell has no effect if the creature already has a poisonous bite attack.

name: Waves of Exhaustion
description: When you cast this spell, you unleash a 60-foot cone of necromantic energy from your hands. All creatures caught in the cone must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, creatures in the cone suffer two levels of exhaustion. On a success, they instead suffer one level of exhaustion.

name: Aggression
description: Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Thoughts of violence flood the target's mind, spurring it to bloodlust. For the duration of the spell, the target has advantage on the first attack roll it makes on each of its turns. If the target reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee weapon attack, it must use its reaction to make another attack with the same weapon against a different target within reach. At the end of each of its turns for the duration of the spell, if the target did not successfully hit a creature with an attack this turn, it takes 2d4 psychic damage as its unfulfilled desire for violence drives it to madness.

name: Accelerate
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when you make an initiative roll
components: V, M (the feather of a hummingbird)
description: Knowing that the first move is often the most important, you use magic to push your body's limits, acting before you even have a chance to think. Immediately after initiative is rolled, regardless of your result, you can choose to move up to your speed, make a single weapon attack, or cast one cantrip that you know. After doing so, combat resumes as normal. On your first turn in this combat, your speed is reduced to 0, and you can only take an action or bonus action, not both.

name: Admiral's Order
casting_time: 1 reaction, which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell
description:
You bark orders at a creature in the process of casting a spell, attempting to assert your will against its own. If the creature is casting a spell of 6th level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 7th level or higher, make a Charisma (Intimidation) or Charisma (Persuasion) check, with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level + the creature's spellcasting ability modifier. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.
 Raid. If you used the Attack action this turn and successfully hit a creature, you can instead cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher.

name: Absolute Grace
description: When you finish casting this spell, choose up to five willing creatures that you can see within 30 feet. AEach of those creatures becomes bathed in an aura of golden light. For the spell's duration, the chosen creatures are immune to necrotic and poison damage, and have advantage on saving throws made to avoid becoming exhausted, frightened, or poisoned.

name: Temur Battle Rage
description:
Wisps of red energy gather around the hands and weapons of the target, coalescing into the shape of fiery red claws which lash out with unrestrained fury. Until the start of your next turn, whenever the target takes the Attack action, they can make an additional unarmed strike with the claws, dealing 3d8 force damage on a hit.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the unarmed strike deals an additional die of damage for each slot level above 2nd.
 Ferocious. If the target has a Strength score of 18 or higher, the unarmed strike with the claws deals 3d10 damage instead.

name: Alms of the Vein
description:
As you cast this spell, a pair of large fangs burst from your mouth, which you use to make a melee spell attack against a creature within range. If the attack hits, the target takes 2d8 piercing damage and 2d8 necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt. If you are a vampire, the spell deals an additional 1d8 piercing and 1d8 necrotic damage.
 Madness. When you cast this spell, you can instead choose to cast it as a 1st-level spell. If you do, the spell deals half as much damage, and you can't cast this spell again until the end of your next short or long rest.

name: Bound by Moonsilver
components: V, S, M (manacles made from silver, worth at least 50 gp)
description: As you cast this spell you touch a charmed, restrained, or unconscious creature. Manacles of sliver light appear around the target, binding it in place. Until the spell ends the target is restrained, and can't take the Attack action. If the target is a shapechanger, it can't change forms and must remain in its true form for the duration of the spell. The target can make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. For the spell's duration, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks made to interact with the target, and you can use an action on each of your turns to cause the target to automatically take 1d4 radiant damage. During the spell's duration, if the target is reduced to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to transfer the effects of the spell to one charmed, restrained, or unconscious creature you can see within 10 feet. You can do this only once before the spell ends.

name: Hope Against Hope
components: V, S, M (a stick of incense)
description: You draw upon life's greatest power, hope, to fuel the fight against overwhelming darkness. Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. For the spell's duration, the target's weapons emit dim light in a 30-foot radius, and its weapon attacks deal an additional 1d4 radiant damage for each allied creature within 30 feet of it. If the target is a human, it also has advantage on initiative rolls and can act normally during a surprise round.

name: Rise from the Tides
components: V, S, M (a bit of seaweed and a pearl worth 500 gp, consumed in the casting)
description: When you cast this spell, it magically creates a number of undead servants equal to or less than the number of spell slots you have expended since the end of your last long rest. Choose a number of corpses within range equal to the number of undead you are attempting to create. The corpses must be from Medium or Small humanoids. Each corpse becomes a zombie under your control (the GM has the creature's game statistics). If there is a large body of water within range, such as a large lake, a sea, or the ocean, at the GM's discretion the spell may instead animate a number of dead bodies from the body of water, without requiring the corpses to be in range.As a bonus action on each of your turns, you can mentally command any creature you animated with this spell if the creature is within 120 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.The creatures are under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you have given it.

name: Triskaidekaphobia
components: V, M (thirteen teeth from a humanoid, thirteen fingernail clippings, and a vial filled with thirteen drops of blood)
description: While others only consider the number thirteen to be unlucky, you know that it holds a dark power, for those willing to traffic in such things. When you cast this spell and at the start of each of your turns for the spell's duration, choose a creature that you can see within 90 feet. If the target's current hit points are equal to multiple of 13 (13, 26, 39, etc.), it dies. Otherwise the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 2d12 necrotic damage.

name: Torment of Hailfire
components: S, M (a vial of alchemist's fire, or the tongue of a dragon)
description:
As you cast this spell, ghoulish purple fire manifests in your palm and matching streaks of fire begin to rain down from the sky. At the start of each of your turn's for the spell's duration, you can choose one creature that you can see within 90 feet. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d8 fire and 2d8 necrotic damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much on a success. In addition, any creature that begins its turn within 60 feet of you during the spell's duration must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of its next turn.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, at the start of each of your turns you can choose to target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

name: Anson's Temporary Reconstruction
description: When you cast this spell, you touch a single non-function or destroyed magical item within reach. The broken item immediately repairs itself, becoming whole and functioning again. If the item requires attunement, you immediately become attuned to it. For the next hour, the item functions as normal, with no sign of it's having been destroyed. At the end of the hour, you may use a bonus action to expend another spell slot of 1st level or above to keep the object functioning for another 10 minutes. You may do so as many times as you wish. Should you not, the object breaks once more.

name: Artifact Blast
description:
Raising your hand, you aim down your fingers at an object within range, dealing 1d10 thunder damage. If the object is being held or carried, the wearer must make a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the damage done to the object. If the object is magical, this spell deals double damage.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for every slot level above 1st.

name: Artifact Possession
components: V, S, M (a set of tinkerer's tools)
description:
As you finish casting this spell, you touch one magical or non-magical item within reach. If the item is being held or carried, the wearer may make a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the object being touched. You place a minor curse on the object, so that whenever a creature uses the item or performs an action involving the item, they are assaulted with mental visions of failure, dealing 1d6 psychic damage to them. The effects of this spell may be ended early by targeting the affected item with a remove curse spell or similar magic cast at the same level as the expended spell slot used to cast this spell.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration increases to 24 hours. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration increases to one month. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level or higher, the duration becomes indefinite.

name: Artifact Ward
components: V, S, M (a shield worth at least 25 gp, consumed in the casting)
description: This spell allows you to place a ward on a single creature within range, granting them protection from the workings of magical items and constructs. Affected creature have advantage on all saving throws made against effects generated by construct creature and magic items. In addition, the creature gains immunity to all bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage dealt by constructs.

name: Circle of Protection: Artifacts
classes: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
description: You wave your hands in a semicircle around yourself, creating a barrier of silver energy, which quickly fades to become barely discernible. As a reaction, whenever you are targeted by an attack, spell, or magical effect created by a construct or magical item, you may protect yourself from the effects, causing the barrier to flash silver again.

name: Crumble
components: V, S, M (the feeler of a rust monster)
description: Choose one non-magical item that you can see within range. If the object is being worn or carried, the wearer must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or else the object suddenly disintegrates into a number of coins equal to the original value of the item.

name: Damping Field
description: When you cast this spell, choose a point within range that you can see. A shimmering field of force fills a radius of 20 feet surrounding that point. All magical items within the radius cease to function. A creature caught within the radius which is wearing or carrying a magic item may choose a single magic item, shielding it from the effects to allow it to still function.

name: Detonate
components: V, S, M (a bit of black powder)
description:
You snap your fingers, causing a single item that you can see within range to suddenly explode, forcing all creatures within 5 feet of the object to make a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d10 fire damage. If the object is being worn or carried, the wearer must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the object explodes as normal, dealing double damage to the creature carrying it. If the object is magical, the wearer has advantage on the saving throw made to prevent it from being destroyed.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the object deals an additional 1d10 fire damage when it explodes for every slot level above 2nd.

name: Drafna's Restoration
components: V, S, M (a healer's kit, which loses one use)
description: You take the pieces of a single broken object, and by running your hand along them, cause them to fuse back together into their original shape, restoring what was lost. This spell is able to restore items destroyed by other means, even if those means were magical. This includes magic items destroyed by spells or other effects, so long as you have more than 50% of the original pieces. If there are pieces missing, the spell restores them as if they were in place.

name: Energy Flux
components: V, S, M (a magic item with charges)
description: Holding a charged magical item in your hands, you channel its energy back into yourself before releasing it in a concentrated blast. When you cast this spell, if you are attuned to or holding a magical item which has a number of charges, you may use a bonus action to fire a blast of magic at a single target you can see within 30 feet, expending a charge from the item, and making a ranged spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the target takes 10d4 force damage. For the duration of the spell, you may use an action on your turn to expend another charge from the item and make another attack. If you attempt to expend a charge from an item that has no remaining charges, you make an attack as normal, but the item is destroyed, and the attack deals 15d4 force damage.

name: Gate to Phyrexia
components: V, S, M (a single incapacitated living creature)
description: A spell created to destroy powerful magical artifacts, but at a great cost. When you finish casting this spell, the incapacitated creature is sacrificed, immediately reducing them to 0 hit points and killing them. As the creature dies, you touch a single magical item of very rare rarity or less, causing it to crumble into dust. If you cast this spell as a ritual, the creature must remain incapacitated for the entire duration.

name: Haunting Wind
description: This spell surrounds you with an aura of dark energy, which seems to rip and tear at your surroundings like a windstorm. Whenever a hostile creature within 15 feet of you makes an attack using a magic item, or spends a charge from a magic item, this spell deals 6d8 necrotic damage to that creature. The target must then make a Wisdom saving throw, becoming frightened on a failed save. A creature outside of the spell's radius may repeat the saving throw at the start of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.

name: Hurkyl's Recall
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when a magic item uses its last charge
description: This spell is meant to rejuvenate the magic found within a magic item, restoring some of its power at the expense of your own. When a magic item within 30 feet runs out of charges, you may use a reaction to cast this spell, restoring 1d4 charges to the expended item. If the item would normally be at risk of being destroyed when it runs out of charges, this spell prevents that from happening while simultaneously recharging the item.

name: Power Artifact
description: A small spark of magical static leaps between you and a single magical item you touch, granting a bit of your own power to the item. For the duration, the item's bonuses are slightly increased. If the item normally provides a static bonus, that bonus increases by +1 for the duration. If the item normally has a certain number of charges, the number of available charges increase by 1d4 for the duration. If the item can normally be used only a certain number of times per day, it can now be used one additional time before recharging. If the item does not fit into any of these three categories, the spell has no effect.

name: Powerleech
description:
Whenever a creature other than yourself within a 15-foot radius centered on yourself uses their action to use a magic item, you regain 2d8 hit points.
 At Higher Levels. Whenever you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the number of hit points restored increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 3rd.

name: Reverse Polarity
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when you are dealt damage
components: V, S, M (a healing potion, consumed in the casting)
description: After taking damage, you quickly shatter the healing potion in your hand, letting the soothing liquid run over your palm. You regain a number of hit points equal to twice the amount of damage dealt to you by the attack.

name: Shatterstorm
components: V, S, M (a shard of broken glass)
description: A whirling storm of fire and lightning springs up around you, filling a 120-foot radius. Choose any number of magic items and constructs within the radius. Each magic item that is of a rarity less than legendary is destroyed. If the magic item is being worn or carried, the creature holding it may make a Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the item is spared. Each construct chosen must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d10 force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

name: Titania's Song
description:
You begin a light and airy song, one which seems to fill you and your comrades with joy. All items within range which are not being worn or carried suddenly animate, coming to life and moving under their own power, forming three swarms of animated objects (the DM has the statistics). The swarms act on your initiative, and you may mentally issue commands to the swarms with no action on your part. If the swarms are not given a command, they simply attack any creature hostile to you or your allies.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you summon an additional swarm for every slot level above 6th.

name: Transmute Artifact
description: When you cast this spell, you touch a single magical item, converting it into another magical item of equal rarity which you have seen before. If the new item requires attunement, you must have been attuned to the new item at least once before to copy it. If the new item has charges, it begins with half the normal amount of charges. The magic item functions exactly as it would if it were actually the new item. If the new item has charges, the spell ends if the last charge is used before the duration ends.

name: ﻿Artificial Reassemblance
description:
You touch an object which has been broken, such as the hilt of a sword missing its blade, a shard of ancient pottery, or the clasp of a long-broken locket, or some other fragmented object. When you do, you create an illusory duplicate of the object with an appearance identical to that of the object when it was last whole.
 This duplicate maintains the color, decoration, and other details of the original object, but is semi-transparent. A creature inspecting the object can make a Wisdom (Perception) check or Wisdom (Investigation) check against your spell save DC to identify it as a magical copy. A creature familiar with the original item has advantage on this ability check.
 The repaired form of the object must be no larger than 5 square feet in size, otherwise the spell fails. The duplicate is solid, but breaks easily under light strain, preventing its use as a weapon or armor.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration increases by one hour for each slot level above 1st. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration becomes 24 hours instead.

name: Astral Conjuration
components: V, S, M (an object from space, such as a sliver of meteorite or piece of moon rock)
description:
The air grows dark and cold, and crackles with the smell of ozone. Twinkling stars appear in the darkness, and flaming bits of debris begin to zip past, as you open a tear in the fabric of space around you. Each creature in the radius of the spell other than yourself must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 3d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
 Each round you maintain concentration on this spell, it produces additional effects on your turn. The radius of the spell moves with you, but while concentrating on the spell, you are unable to move more than 30 feet on your turn.
 Round 2. The gravity in the area of the spell is weakened, forcing each creature in the spell’s radius to succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be lifted 30 feet into the air. Creatures with a flying speed automatically succeed on this saving throw. Creatures that fail the saving throw hover in the air, and their speed is reduced to 0. At the start of your next turn this effect ends, causing each creature that failed the save to fall to the ground, taking falling damage as normal.
 Round 3-4. Small meteorites begin to shoot through the air, forcing each creature other than yourself to make a Dexterity saving throw to avoid them. A creature that fails this saving throw takes 4d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.
 Round 5-6. Blinding cosmic light, unleashed by pulsars and supernovas, tears through the spell’s radius, causing each creature other than yourself to take 2d8 radiant damage. Each creature that suffers this damage must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the start of your next turn.
 Round 7. You summon three large meteoroids, which strike the ground at three spots of your choice you can see within the spell’s range, kicking up a large cloud of debris and exuding intense heat. Each creature within 30 feet of a chosen point must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 fire and 4d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A creature in the area of more than one impact is only affected once. Each meteor leaves a 15-foot wide radius of difficult terrain centered on its point of impact.
 Round 8. Dark shapes, the shadows of things left over from before the creation of light, shudder at the edges of the star-studded darkness, forcing each creature other than yourself in the spell’s radius that can see to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save an affected creature takes 4d6 psychic damage, immediately loses concentration, and is frightened until the spell ends.
 Round 9-10. The stars revealed by the spell fade away, plunging the spell’s area into total darkness. A creature with darkvision can’t see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can’t illuminate it. If any of this spell’s area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell, the spell that created the light is dispelled. Frightened creatures within the spell’s radius must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of their turns or take 3d6 psychic damage.

name: Ceaseless Wracking
description:
Intense pain fills the body of one creature of your choice that you can see within range, striking with a burning intensity and forcing the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the target takes 10d10 necrotic damage. On a failed save, the target takes 10d10 necrotic damage and is crippled by the pain, reducing its speed to 10 feet, and giving it disadvantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws until the end of its next turn.
 Epic. Once you cast this spell, you can cast it any number of times without expending a spell slot, and can not cast other spells of 1st-level or higher, until the end of your next short or long rest.

name: Chaos Rift
components: V, S, M (an emerald worth 300 gp, consumed in the casting)
description:
A rift in time and space opens in an unoccupied space you can see within range, connecting your plane with another random location in the multiverse. This rift takes the form of a circular, 2-dimensional portal, oriented in any direction you choose. The portal lasts for the duration.
 The front of the portal provides a view into the plane that it is connected to, while the back of the portal appears as an opaque, multicolored shape. Travel through the portal is impossible, and any creature that attempts to enter the portal from either side passes harmlessly through.
 When the portal is created, a number of random creatures or objects from elsewhere in the multiverse are forcibly drawn through it, appearing in the nearest unoccupied spaces on your side of the portal. You gain no special control over any creatures conjured this way, and they are free to act as the GM deems appropriate. They might flee, attack you, attack others, or even actively help you.
 Any creature summoned by the portal, as well as any equipment it is carrying or wearing, is returned to its previous location when the spell ends. Creatures summoned by the portal act at the end of each of your turns, including the turn in which it was summoned, unless noted otherwise.
 Roll a d20 on the table below to determine what appears from the portal.
 1: Ten random beasts of challenge rating ½ or below. The GM determines the type of beasts that appear, which might all be the same type of creature, or several different types.
 2: 1d6 bandits of various races, led by a two-headed bugbear.
 3: A gelatinous cube, whose appearance is not immediately obvious due to its transparency.
 4: A doppelganger that already has the same appearance as the nearest creature to it.
 5: An owlbear in the middle of hibernating. It wakes up if dealt damage, or whenever a creature enters a space within 5 feet of it and fails a DC 15 Dexterity (Stealth) check.
 6: Two elephants, each ridden by a kobold.
 7: A weretiger mercenary, who offers their services to the highest bidder.
 8: 1d4 fiends of challenge rating 5 or below, all of the same type, with a 40% chance of being demons, a 40% chance of being devils, a 10% chance of being yugoloths, and a 10% chance of being none of the above. If devils, they will prioritize fighting any nearby demons above any other target and vice-versa.
 9: A single celestial of challenge rating 4 or below.
 10: A cloud of living fog that expands from the space it is summoned in at a rate of 5 feet in every direction at the start of each of your turns. Any creature that starts its turn in the fog must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or take 2d8 poison damage and become poisoned until the spell ends.
 11: A tamed giant boar, complete with saddle and reins, which allows itself to be ridden with a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Animal Handling) check. A creature that attempts to ride the boar and fails the check is thrown from its back, landing prone in its previous space.
 12: A bard that comes equipped with a specialized instrument to act as a one-man band. The bard has a 50% chance of beginning a comedic song about nearby characters, and a 50% chance of telling a courageous epic poem. If performing the song, creatures within 60 feet of the bard that can see and hear it subtract 1d4 from all attack rolls and saving throws. If performing the poem, creatures within 60 feet of the bard that can see and hear it add 1d4 to all attack rolls and saving throws.
 13: Thirteen crawling claws appear, which all occupy the same space, act on the same turn, and move as one entity.
 14: A single, random card from the deck of many things, which appears face-down. The first creature to touch the card is immediately subject to its effects, which last only until the spell ends, at which point the effects of the card are reversed.
 15: Two gladiators, each with half of their normal hit points, caught in a life or death struggle. Each refuses to respond to outside intervention until the other is unconscious or killed.
 16: A flesh golem, which uses its first turn to take the Dash action and move in a random direction. The following round, 3d4 commoners appear, carrying torches and farming implements, attempting to chase and kill the flesh golem.
 17: A large, golden sarcophagus, inside of which is a mummy lord, currently in a state of suspended animation. On each of the mummy lord’s turns after it is summoned, including the first, there is an additional 10% chance that it wakes from its slumber and leaves the sarcophagus.
 18: Three werewolves– one in its human form, one in its hybrid form, and one in its wolf form, all of which are incapable of polymorphing into a different form for the duration.
 19: A shambling mound that begins at Medium size, and grows by an additional size category, up to a maximum of Huge, each time it takes lightning damage or reduces a creature it has engulfed to 0 hit points.
 20: A vampiric mist that does not take damage from sunlight, and spends each of its turns seeking an area of dim light or darkness. If it begins its turn in dim light or darkness, it transforms into a vampire. If the vampire begins its turns in sunlight, after taking radiant damage it transforms back into vampiric mist.

name: Cityscape
components: V, S, M (a scale-model replica of the area affected by the spell, of a value determined by the area’s size)
description:
You imprint the signature of your magic onto a large area within a village, town, or city, creating a deep and lasting bond between yourself and the chosen surroundings. The area affected by the spell must be no larger than 1500 square feet. This is usually equivalent to a medium farmstead, a town square, or a city block. You must remain within the area you are marking for the duration of the spell’s casting.
 The scale replica of the spell’s area of effect used in the spell’s casting must be an exact duplicate, replicating both buildings and other structures within the area as well as any other major geographical features. Your GM has the final say on what counts as a feature prominent enough to be included in the scale replica. Building interiors and underground structures do not need to be represented in the model, but the scale of the model must have a moderate degree of accuracy. Constructing such a model usually requires 1 day and 3 gp for every 5 square feet represented in the model.
 When you finish casting the spell, the area you have designated via the scale model becomes your domain, granting you a number of magical benefits, both while in the area and outside of it. The area of the domain stretches to 50 feet beneath the ground of the marked area, and 50 feet above the tallest building in the area.
 While within the boundaries of your domain, you know the location and type of any creature of size Tiny or larger within the domain. Additionally, you can communicate telepathically with any creature in the domain capable of understanding at least one language, even if you and the creature do not share a language. While within your domain, you can use an action to teleport to any other location inside of the boundaries of your domain. If you attempt to teleport to a location occupied by another creature or object, you are shunted into the nearest unoccupied space, taking 1d10 force damage for every 5 feet you are moved in this way.
 While both inside and outside of your domain, as long as you are on the same plane as your domain, you are capable of automatically detecting when another creature that is Tiny or larger enters or exits the domain.
 When you finish casting the spell, you may also choose one of the following effects, which last for the duration of the spell:
 Charmed Respite: Choose a secondary area no larger than 50 square feet that is within the area of the spell. This area is blessed with magical charms and protections. Creatures in the area can not be charmed or frightened, and are immune to magical scrying. Any creature that finishes a long rest within the area recovers all lost hit points and is cured of any diseases or poisons.
 Magnificent Mansion: You create a magical entryway on a surface of your choice within your domain, which leads to an extradimensional dwelling of the same type as if you had cast the magnificent mansion spell. The dwelling and its entrance remain accessible for the duration of the spell, and is accessible only to you and creatures that you designate when casting this spell. Creatures and objects not created by the spell’s effects that are in the extradimensional space when the spell ends are expelled into the open spaces nearest to the entrance.
 Teleportation Circle: You create a semi-permanent teleportation circle at a location of your choice within your domain, as if you had cast the spell of the same name. You choose the sigil sequence for the circle.
 If you cast this spell on the same location every day for 30 days, its effects become permanent. You can change which of the three additional features are in effect each time you cast the spell. However, when the spell’s effects become permanent, the additional chosen effect also becomes permanent, and can no longer be changed.

name: Color Shift
description:
By touching an object no larger than 5 cubic feet in size, you change the color of the object’s surface, which remains the chosen color for the spell’s duration or until you use a bonus action on your turn to dismiss the effect. Scratching, scraping, or otherwise exposing another layer of the object reveals its true color.
 If you cast this spell multiple times, you can affect up to 10 objects at a time. If you attempt to cast the spell on another object, the effects of the oldest casting of the spell wear off.

name: Contaminate Water
components: V, S, M (a piece of rotting flesh, consumed in the casting)
description:
Your touch corrupts a body of water, infusing it with a poisonous contamination that renders it dangerous for consumption. This water source can consist of up to ten 10-foot cubes, and must be no larger than 7500 gallons– this could be a barrel of water, a well, or even a small pond.
 Any creature that consumes water from the contaminated source must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become poisoned. Creatures living within the water source immediately begin to suffocate, unable to breathe the water normally. A creature poisoned in this way loses 1d4 points of Strength at the end of each long rest, at which point it may repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. An affected creature can also be cured with lesser restoration, remove curse, or similar magic. A creature whose Strength is reduced this way recovers 1d4 Strength for each day of downtime it spends resting after being cured. A creature whose Strength is reduced to 0 dies immediately.
 A contained water source, such as a barrel or keg, remains contaminated indefinitely. A filtered source, such as a well or pond, is contaminated for 7 days, after which the contamination clears naturally. A contaminated source can be cleared with the dispel magic spell, or by casting the hallow spell on any portion of the water source. The contamination can also be cleared using the purify food and drink spell, but only if the water source is contained entirely within the area of the spell.

name: Dazzling Orb
components: V, S, M (a vial of several colors of dye or pigment)
description:
With a faint popping noise, a brightly colored orb of swirling colors and lights appears in an unoccupied space of your choice, hovering a few feet from the ground. Each creature that can see the orb and starts its turn within 30 feet of it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the start of their next turn. If a creature succeeds on this saving throw, it is immune to the spell’s effects for the rest of the spell’s duration.
 As a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns for the spell’s duration, you can move the orb up to 15 feet. The orb can pass through creatures, objects, and walls and any attempt to physically interact with the orb fails. If the orb moves out of your line of sight or further than 60 feet away from you, the spell automatically ends.
 When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures within range as immune to the spell’s effects.

name: Discern Fauna
description:
By touching the body part of a creature, you are able to identify specific characteristics about the creature the body part came from. The body part may be as small as a tooth or claw, or as large as an entire limb. When you touch the body part, you are granted knowledge of the type of creature that it came from, such as aberration, celestial, humanoid, etc.
 If the creature was a beast, dragon, monstrosity, or plant you are also able to identify the defining characteristics of the creature in question. For example, touching the tooth of a dragon would allow you to identify the color of dragon it came from, while touching the skull of a fox would allow you to identify it as such.
 If you are a druid and you cast this spell on the body part of a beast, the knowledge gained by use of the spell is enough to allow you to assume its shape using the Wild Shape class feature.

name: Empathic Feedback
description:
You reach out with your mind, empathically sharing the pain and suffering of your own wounds with the synapses of your attacker. For the spell’s duration, each time a creature within 20 feet of you hits you with an attack, it automatically takes 1d8 psychic damage. If the damage is from a critical hit, the attacker instead takes twice as much damage.
 A creature damaged by this spell has disadvantage on any resulting saving throw made to maintain concentration.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage dealt to the attacker increases based on the level of the spell slot used: 1d10 at 6th and 7th level, and 1d12 at 8th and 9th level.

name: Ensnare Undead
description:
You attempt to take control of an undead creature that you can see within range. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and it does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it comes under your control until the spell ends or you or your companions do anything harmful to it. If the target’s Intelligence is 4 or less, it automatically fails this saving throw.
 While under your control, the creature obeys all verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required). If the target;s Intelligence is 5 or greater, at the end of each of its turns, or if the target is given a command that would cause direct harm to it, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the spell on a success.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

name: Floral Eruption
description:
Reaching deep into the earth, you draw forth an explosive bounty. Choose a point within range. The ground within a 60-foot radius of that point bursts with an immense tangle of plant-life, which quickly grows to an enormous height.
 If there are already plants in the spell’s radius of effect, these plants become thick and overgrown. Otherwise new plants appear in the area, of a type which would be expected for the environment. None of the new plants that appear are edible, and do not provide sustenance.
 A creature moving through the area must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves. The plants are tall and dense enough that any Large or smaller creature in the area is lightly obscured and benefits from half-cover.
 When you cast this spell, you may choose one of the following types of plants to also appear in the area, causing additional effects based on the type of plant chosen. You can also designate up to four creatures, including yourself, as immune to the effects of the plants in the area.
 Pain Bush. A creature that enters the area for the first time on its turn or that starts its turn in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. A creature that leaves the area can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
 Poison Ivy. A creature that enters the area for the first time on its turn or starts its turn in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or suffer from an extreme rash. Creatures suffering from this rash have disadvantage on Dexterity-based ability checks and saving throws made to maintain concentration.
 Stinging Nettle. If a creature enters the area of the spell, or starts its turn in the area and moves at least 5 feet on its turn, it must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d6 acid damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

name: Flying Sparks
components: S, M (a piece of charcoal or flint)
description: With a flourish, you toss a handful of burning embers in a 10-foot cone, forcing each creature in the area to make a Dexterity saving throw. Creatures that fail this saving throw take 2d6 fire damage and are blinded for 1d4 rounds by the ash and sparks. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw takes half as much damage and is not blinded. If a creature is blinded by the spell, it or another creature within 5 feet of it can use an action to wipe the soot from the blinded creature’s eyes, ending the condition on it.

name: Forgeman’s Touch
components: S, M (raw materials equal in value to the gp cost of the crafted item)
description:
Under your hands, the raw materials used as components in the casting of this spell shape themselves into a single nonmagical item equal or lesser in value than the raw materials used to create it. The spell consumes an amount of the raw materials necessary to create the item, leaving the remainder untouched. If the created object is of a liquid or gaseous material, it can be caused to automatically appear in an empty container nearby when you finish casting the spell.
 The crafted item can be a suit of armor, a shield, a weapon, or some other mundane item, but must be something which could conceivably be made with the raw materials at hand. You could not, for example, create a mirror using wood, or a candle out of steel.
 The crafted item is of a high enough quality that its uses and statistics remain the same. However, a trained craftsman, such as the type that might normally buy a similar object, is able to determine at a glance that the handiwork is shoddy and amateur, and will often refuse to purchase or sell such items.
 You can use this spell to replicate the appearance of a specific object if that object is within your sight for the duration of the spell’s casting, allowing you to duplicate an object such as a key or a weapon with a unique appearance. A creature familiar with the object that inspects it can tell it is a copy by succeeding on an Wisdom (Investigation) check against your spell save DC.
 An object created by the spell remains whole for 72 hours, at which point it breaks back down into its constituent components. A creature wearing, carrying, or otherwise using an object crafted by this spell at the moment the spell’s effects end suffers no negative consequences from this process. If an object created by this spell was consumed during the spell’s duration, such as a candle, perfume, or soap, it is consumed for good, and its materials do not reappear when the spell ends.

name: Fuse Flesh
description:
As your fingers brush against the target’s skin, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have its flesh begin to ripple, shifting and fusing together to create a seamless whole, trapping the creature under a smooth blanket of its own skin. Shapechangers, amorphous creatures, and creatures without flesh automatically succeed on this saving throw.
 While under the spell’s effects, the target is prone, its automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws, its speed is reduced to 0, and it is incapacitated. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, its face also fuses over, blinding and deafening it. If this happens, the target can still breathe, eat, and drink. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
 In order to cast this spell as a ritual, the target must be restrained or unconscious. If you do, the duration increases to 1 hour, and can not be ended by a successful saving throw. However, you can end the spell using a bonus action on your turn.

name: Holzur’s Hidden Home
components: V, S, M (a polished and gilded silver mirror worth at least 200 gp, consumed in the casting)
description:
This spell hides a structure from view, disguising and obscuring it from prying eyes. Choose a structure that you can see within range that is no larger than 2000 cubic feet, such as a townhome, a small guildhouse, or a workshop. You craft an illusion over the building and its surrounding environment that hides it from view.
 Other creatures can not see the structure, and do not notice any signs that the structure is there. For example, if you cast this spell on a townhome, other creatures do not see the building, but also see no evidence of a “gap” between the surrounding buildings. Creatures with truesight can see through the illusion, and detect and interact with the structure as normal.
 When you finish casting this spell, you can designate any number of creatures within range as being immune to the spell’s effects. The chosen creatures are able to see and interact with the target as normal. You can also choose a password which, when spoken within 60 feet of the target, allows the speaker to detect the structure as normal. Speaking this password while within 60 feet of the target also allows you to choose a new password, as well as designate any number of additional creatures as being immune to the spell’s effects.
 If a creature is attempting to locate the target and knows its position, but can not detect the structure due to the spell’s effects, it can make a Wisdom saving throw to attempt to find the building. If the creature fails the saving throw, the target remains hidden from it, and it can not repeat the saving throw for 12 hours. Otherwise the creature sees through the illusion, allowing it to detect and interact with the target as normal.
 If you cast this spell on the same target every day for 30 days, the effects of the spell become permanent. As long as the duration of each casting of the spell overlaps, and the spell does not end for the target, any creatures chosen by you to be able to see through the spell’s effects remain immune to the illusion, and any password chosen continues to function as normal.

name: Howling Gale
description:
You create a storm of powerful, shrieking winds which buffets the battlefield and assaults the senses of those nearby with thunderous noise. When you cast this spell and as a bonus action on each of your turns for the spell’s duration, you can harness the power of the wind storm for your own purposes. Choose a point you can see within range. The area within a 30-foot radius around the chosen point is pummeled by the winds, which howl and rage.
 Objects within the radius that are not being worn or carried are thrown 30 feet in a direction of your choice. Each creature within the radius must make a Strength saving throw, followed by a Constitution saving throw. Deafened creatures and creatures that can not hear automatically succeed on the Constitution saving throw.
 Creatures that fail the Strength saving throw are pushed 5 feet in a direction of your choice and knocked prone, while creatures that fail the Constitution saving throw take 4d8 thunder damage and are deafened until the end of your next turn.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the distance a creature is pushed increases by 5 feet, and the thunder damage dealt increases by 1d8, for each slot level above 6th.

name: Ice Spike
components: V, S, M (a flask of water)
description:
The temperature of the air around you drops suddenly, and your breath begins to mist as the cold leeches the heat from your surroundings. When you cast this spell and as an action on each of your turns for the spell’s duration, you can cause a 30-foot tall, 5-foot radius spike of ice to burst from the ground at a point of your choice that you can see within 300 feet.
 When the spike appears, any creature in the spike’s radius or in the air above it must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d8 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature that fails the saving throw and takes the cold damage is also affected by the extreme cold, reducing its movement speed by half until the start of your next turn.
 The spike is large enough to provide full cover for a creature behind it, though clear enough that creatures can be seen almost perfectly through the ice. The ice spike melts when you create another spike, when it is exposed to high heat, or 10 minutes after the spell ends.

name: Invigorating Earth
description: Choose a point that you can see within range. The ground around the chosen point becomes blessed by nature’s bounty, infusing a radius of up to 15 feet surrounding the chosen point with regenerative power. Whenever a creature touching the ground within the radius of the spell’s effect is reduced to 0 hit points, it immediately gains a number of temporary hit points equal to 5 x your spellcasting modifier. These temporary hit points disappear when the spell ends. If this reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it is knocked unconscious but immediately stabilizes.

name: Maximilian’s Autumn Cloak
description: A swirling gust of red, orange, and yellow leaves fills the air in a 40-foot radius centered on the point where you cast the spell, spinning and dancing on the breeze. The leaves surround you, hiding you from sight as you vanish and reappear in another unoccupied space of your choice in the spell’s radius. For the duration of the spell, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to vanish and reappear in another unoccupied space of your choice in the spell’s radius.

name: Produce Produce
description: A gourd of a type of your choice, such as pumpkin, butternut squash, or watermelon, appears in your hand if you have a hand free, or on the ground in your space otherwise. The gourd’s size is equivalent to the time spent since your last use of this cantrip. If it has been 24 hours or longer, the gourd is large enough to fully feed 4 people. If it has been between 12 and 24 hours, the gourd can feed 2 people. If it has been between 6 and 12 hours since you last cast this spell, the gourd can feed one individual. If it has been less than 6 hours since your last casting of this spell, the gourd is too small to comfortably use in a meal, and is suitable only for decoration.

name: Replicate Cantrip
classes: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
description:
When you cast this spell, choose any cantrip on the spell list for a class that you have the Spellcasting feature for. You replicate the effects of that cantrip perfectly, as if it were on the list of spells that you know, except that it does not require the normal spell components. The range and duration of the cantrip remain the same.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can instead replicate any cantrip, whether it is normally available for your class or not.

name: Restorative Bonfire
description:
You create a bonfire on the ground at an unoccupied point you can see within range. The light from the fire is soothing, and its warmth is restful. Until the spell ends, the magic bonfire fills a 5-foot cube. Any creature that successfully completes a short rest while within 40 feet of the bonfire automatically regains a number of hit points equal to half their hit point maximum. In addition, any creature that spends hit dice during this short rest automatically regains 1 additional hit point for each hit die spent this way.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration becomes 8 hours instead, and when a creature successfully completes a long rest while within 40 feet of the bonfire, it regains all spent hit dice.

name: Revealing Light
description:
At your touch, the lantern used as the spell’s material component shines with enchantment, casting a magical light in a 60-foot cone that reveals that which has been hidden. The light can not be put out through normal means, and disappears when the spell ends. The spell ends immediately if you let go of the lantern.
 If you shine the beam of light on a trap, secret entryway, or invisible creature or object, it is outlined in an unearthly light, revealing its location. The beam of light does not reveal the mechanism controlling a trap or secret entryway, and anything which moves out of the light is no longer highlighted.
 If the beam of light passes over a magical object, it outlines the object in a glowing light, the color of which is determined by the school of magic affecting the object, if any. If the object is affected by several different schools of magic, the outline is multicolored, and does not reveal the exact school of magic.
 Abjuration: Yellow
 Conjuration: Green
 Divination: Blue
 Enchantment: Purple
 Evocation: Red
 Illusion: Indigo
 Necromancy: Black
 Transmutation: Orange

name: Shadow Stalker
components: V, S, M (a vial of ink or a piece of charcoal, consumed in the casting)
classes: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Warlock, Wizard
description:
The ink or charcoal used in this spell’s casting transforms into a tiny, 2D shadow, which leaps from your hand into the shadow of a creature you can see within range. That target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the created shadow merges with the target’s shadow, unnoticed and invisible. Otherwise the spell fails.
 The shadow created by this spell trails the target for the duration, staying within the target’s shadow at all times and allowing you to sense the direction to the target’s location as long as it is on the same plane as you. The shadow disappears when the spell ends, if the target travels to a different plane, or it enters an area where a shadow could not convincingly exist.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration increases by 1 hour for each slot level above 4th. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you no longer need to maintain concentration on the spell’s effects.

name: Spreading Affliction
description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range that is suffering from the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, or poisoned condition. If a creature is suffering from more than one of these conditions, choose one. Each creature within 20 feet of the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or also be afflicted with the same condition, as if it had come from the same source.
 Creatures immune to a chosen condition automatically succeed on this saving throw. Creatures charmed or frightened by this spell are charmed or frightened by the original source of the effect.
 Each creature affected by the spell can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the original target of the spell is cured of the chosen condition, the condition also ends for all creatures inflicted with it through use of this spell.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius of the spell’s effect around the original target increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Subtle Repetition
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken immediately after a creature you can see within range ends its turn
description:
Twisting time around the target, you bind them in a bubble that forces them to repeat themselves once more. At the start of the target’s next turn, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the target can take its turns as normal. On a failed save, the target has to take the same actions and bonus actions on this turn that it did on its last turn. The target can move as normal, and can choose new targets for any attacks it makes or spells it casts.
 If the target did not take any actions on its previous turn, it can’t take any on the turn it is affected by this spell. The target can still make reactions as normal, but can not take actions or bonus actions on its turn that it did not take last turn. If the target for some reason can not perform the same action or bonus action, its attempt to do so fails, and its action or bonus action is wasted. If the target cast a spell last turn, it must cast the same spell, using a spell slot of the same level. If the target can not cast the same spell again using a spell slot of the same level, its attempt to cast the spell fails, and the action or bonus action used in the attempt is wasted.

name: Summon Swarm
components: V, M (a bit of decomposing flesh)
description:
You summon fey spirits that take the form of a swarm of bats, insects, rats, ravens, or quippers, your choice. The swarm appears in your space, and fills the area around you, working to defend you from harm.
