 The GM has the creature’s statistics, except that the swarm is also considered a fey, it gains a number of temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting modifier, and its attacks deal additional damage equal to your spellcasting modifier.
 The swarm can not leave your space, and if for any reason you and the swarm are separated, or if the swarm is reduced to 0 hit points, it disappears and the spell immediately ends.
 Whenever a creature ends its turn within 5 feet of you while you are surrounded by the swarm, the swarm attacks it. If you would take damage while surrounded by the swarm, roll a d20. On a result of 10 or higher, the swarm shields you, causing it to take the damage instead. The swarm can be targeted by attacks and spells as normal.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the swarm gains an additional number of temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting modifier for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Transmute Energy
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when a creature you can see within range would take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage
description: You can cast this spell using your reaction when a creature you can see within range would take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage. With a flourish, you transform one source of energy into another, changing the damage type that would be dealt. Choose one damage type from the list above. Instead of the damage it would take, the target takes damage of the type you chose. This spell does not change the amount of damage that is dealt, but if the target is weak, resistant, or immune to the new damage type, the damage is increased, reduced, or negated as normal.

name: Weeping Curse
components: V, S, M (a vial of tears or a small pouch of salt)
description:
One creature of your choice that you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be filled with a deep and creeping sadness, causing them to begin weeping. While crying, the target is blinded, and its words are difficult to understand, requiring any creature that hears the target to succeed on a Wisdom (Perception) check against your spell save DC to understand it.
 In addition, if the target attempts to cast a spell that requires a verbal component, it must succeed on a spellcasting ability check against your spell save DC or fail in its attempt to cast the spell. Doing so does not expend the spell slot used to cast the spell.
 A remove curse spell ends the spell's effects on the target.
 At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is 8 hours. If you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the spell lasts until it is dispelled. Using a spell slot of 5th level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

name: Whimsical Warmth
description: At your touch, a creature is filled with warm memories, happy thoughts, and visions of joy, giving them advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

name: Zazyx’s Flavor Spice
description: You touch a liquid or food, and override its current taste with flavor notes of cinnamon, ginger, pumpkin, nutmeg, allspice, and cloves. If the food has been tainted in some way, such as by being poisoned, rotted, or otherwise corrupted, the spell fails. You are not aware if the spells fails in this way.

name: Zazyx’s Pine Armor
components: V, S, M (a bundle of pine needles)
description:
A thick coating of pine needles sprouts from the skin of a willing creature that you touch, covering their body and providing a warm layer of protection. Until the spell ends, the target has resistance to cold damage, and advantage on saving throws against the effects of cold weather.
 In addition, while standing still the target is indistinguishable from a small pine tree or bush. If it moves, this disguise is ruined, but otherwise a creature must succeed on a Wisdom (Perception) check against your spell save DC in order to determine that the target is a creature.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the target instead becomes immune to cold damage, and automatically succeeds on all saving throws made against the effects of cold weather.

name: Ancient Craving
components: V, S, M (a clam shell, octopus tentacle, and fish's eye, all consumed in the casting, as well as an idol carved from ebony worth at least 1200 gp)
description: Through a combination of intense meditation and a complex magical ritual, you reach across the stars and make contact with beings of unfathomable age and thought. These elder beings plumb your mind, reading your desires, and automatically answer three questions you are seeking the answer to.The elder beings provide a correct answer to each question in as few or as many words as they like. Unless they have a specific reason to hide the information, the answer they give is clear. Because you are in contact with many elder beings at once, they are very likely to have specific information related to the questions at hand, unless they involve information that has been specifically hidden from them.After casting this spell and receiving the answers, the strain of this communication affects both your mind and body, causing you to suffer three levels of exhaustion as well as three long-term madnesses which last until all levels of exhaustion are removed.

name: Armistice
components: V, M (a metal stamp worth 50 gp, marked with an arcane symbol of your own devising)
description: With binding magic, you force a tenuous, but iron-clad, truce between you and one creature you can see within range. For the duration of the spell, you and the target are magically prevented from attacking the other, or targeting the other with spells or abilities. You and the target both become immune to all damage dealt by the other, and whenever one of you regains any number of hit points, the other regains an equal amount.If you cast this spell as a ritual, the duration instead becomes 1 hour, and you and the target are unable to lie to each other for the duration. Casting this spell as a ritual requires an additional material component of a piece of paper marked with the target's name or a physical depiction of the target.

name: Blazing Salvo
description: As you slide your hand along the blade of the weapon used in the casting of the spell, rivulets of fire begin to roll down its length. The next time you make an attack with the weapon before the spell ends, splashes of magma and fire spray from the weapon. If the attack hits, the target takes an additional 2d6 fire damage. Whether the attack hits or misses, the target and up to two other creatures of your choice within 5 feet of the target must each make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 1d6 fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a success.

name: A Good Thing
description: When you cast this spell, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your current hit point total. At the start of each of your turns after casting this spell, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to twice your current hit points + the number of temporary hit points you currently have. Then, if you have 1,000 or more temporary hit points, you automatically suffer five levels of exhaustion, lose all temporary hit points, and this spell automatically ends.

name: Ambition's Cost
components: S, M (a signet ring worth at least 250 gp, marked with a symbol of your own design unique to you)
description: When you cast this spell, you convert your own life force into raw magical luck, granting you great strength but placing your life on a timer. Until the spell ends, you gain resistance to all forms of damage, and all attacks made against you are made with disadvantage. In addition, whenever you would roll a d20, you can instead choose to automatically treat the result of the roll as an 18. You must decide whether to do so before making the roll. At the end of your third turn after casting the spell, you are immediately reduced to 0 hit points and begin dying.

name: Act of Authority
components: V, M (a metal bar engraved or stamped with the image of a crown)
description: When you cast this spell, choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, one object of your choice held by the target is transported to an inaccessible demiplane created by this spell, or the effects of one spell of your choice currently affecting the target are suppressed until the end of that target's next turn.At the start of your next turn, the target of the spell can choose another creature. The new target must make a Charisma saving throw, suffering the same effects on a failed save. This process repeats at the start of each of your turns for the spell's duration, with the spell's target on the previous turn choosing the target of the spell on the next turn.If a sentient magical item would be transported to the demiplane created by this spell, it can make an additional Charisma saving throw, preventing the spell's effects upon itself on a success. A sentient magical item that fails this saving throw and is transported to the demiplane can repeat the saving throw at the end of each round. On a success, the sentient magical item is transported back to the Material Plane, appearing in either the space it previously occupied, or next to the person which was holding it at the time it vanished, its choice.At the GM's discretion, certain powerful magic items such as artifacts or legendary items may be immune to the effects of this spell.

name: Academic Dispute
description:
Long claws of flame wreathe your hands and fingers, writhing and lashing with heat. Until the end of your next turn, you gain an additional 5 feet of reach with all weapons, and attacks you make deal an additional 1d6 fire damage.
 Learn. Immediately after casting this spell, you can use your reaction to cast one cantrip that you know, or one spell that you know and have prepared that has the lesson tag.

name: Force of Virtue
components: V, S, M (a feather, dipped in melted silver worth 50 gp)
description: As you finish casting this spell, choose up to five creatures that you can see within range. You feel divine inspiration flow through you and into the chosen targets. For the duration, creatures affected by the spell gain a +1 bonus to all attack and damage rolls, and their attacks ignore damage resistances. In addition, affected creatures gain a +1 bonus to AC and resistance to all bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. You can also choose to cast this spell as a reaction when you or a creature you can see within range makes an attack. To do so, you must also expend a spell slot of 4th level or higher in addition to the spell's normal casting costs.

name: Savage Swipe
components: V, S, M (the claw of a bear)
description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target can use its reaction to make a single melee weapon attack. If the target's CR (or the target's level if it doesn't have a challenge rating) is equal to or less than 2, it has advantage on the attack roll and deals an additional die of damage if it hits.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the target gains the additional benefits to its attack if its CR is less than or equal to twice the level of the expended spell slot.

name: Scale Up
components: V, S, M (a bit of shed snakeskin)
description:
This spell transforms a willing creature that you can see within range into a new form. The spell has no effect on a shapechanger or a creature with 0 hit points. The transformation lasts until the start of your next turn, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. The new form can be any beast or monstrosity whose challenge rating is equal to or less than (1/2) the target's CR (or the target's level if it doesn't have a challenge rating). The target's game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast or monstrosity, except that it retains its mental ability scores, alignment, and personality. The target assumes the hit points of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked unconscious. The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it may not be able to speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech. The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.
 Overload. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can instead target any number of willing creatures that you can see within range.

name: Arc Trail
components: S, M (a bit of wool and a piece of flint)
description: A bolt of lightning streaks from your fingers toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 6d8 lightning damage, and small bolts of electricity begin to arc off of its body. Each creature within 15 feet of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d8 lightning damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. Any creature wearing metal armor has disadvantage on this saving throw.

name: Call the Coppercoats
components: V, S, M (a copper emblem marked with the insignia of a military or mercenary group)
description:
Raising the emblem high, you call for allies in your time of need, summoning a number of spectral spirits equal to the number of hostile creatures you can see, up to a maximum of 10 spirits. Each of the summoned spirits uses the statistics of a guard (your Gm has the creatures' statistics) and acts immediately after you in initiative.You can verbally command the summoned spirits on your turn (no action required) determining where they move and what actions they take on their next turn. If you issue no commands, the spirits act to defend both themselves and you from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.The spirits summoned by this spell and any equipment summoned with them disappear when the spell ends, or if they are reduced to 0 hit points.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the number of spirits summoned is instead equal to twice the number of hostile creatures you can see, up to a maximum of 20 spirits.

name: Illuminate
description:
You wave your hand through the air, and a blinding flash of light bursts from your palm. Up to two creatures in range must each make a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d10 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
 Kicker. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 2nd. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, if you're a sorcerer, the spell now affects all creatures in range; if you're a Wizard, any creature which fails the saving throw is blinded until the end of your next turn. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level, both effects occur, regardless of your class.

name: Fight with Fire
description:
When you cast this spell, you summon a powerful burst of fire from beneath the feet of one creature that you can see in range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d10 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level the damage increases to 10d10 and you can target any number of creatures in range.

name: Blind Obedience
description:
You utter a short command, 15 words or less in length, to a creature that you can see within range. At the start of each of its turns for the spell's duration, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command. The spell has no effect if the target doesn't understand your language. If the command is harmful to it, the target has advantage on the saving throw, and whenever the target takes damage as a result of the command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the spell on a success. At the beginning of each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to extort all creatures affected by the spell. If you do, each creature affected by the spell takes 1d4 necrotic damage, and you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the total damage dealt this way.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or above, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 4th. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

name: Shadow Slice
description:
You craft a wickedly sharp dagger from insubstantial shadow and launch it at a creature with range, making a ranged spell attack as you do so. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 piercing and 1d4 necrotic damage, or 1d6 piercing and 1d6 necrotic if the target is in dim light or darkness.
 Cipher. After casting this spell, choose a willing creature that you can see within 60 feet. For as long as you maintain concentration on this spell, whenever that target deals damage to a hostile creature, you can use your reaction to summon and launch another shadow dagger at a creature within range.

name: Stolen Identity
description: Choose a creature that you can see within range. The shadows around you morph and congeal into an exact duplicate of that creature, which appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within 5 feet. The duplicate is an exact copy; it has the same statistics as the target, and appears wearing and carrying the same equipment the target was wearing and carrying when you cast this spell. Any magical items duplicated in this way are nonmagical, but all other equipment functions as normal. For example, any keys duplicated in this way work to open the doors they match, and any written text on duplicated objects is copied exactly. Any magical written text, such as that found on magical scrolls or any magically protected text, is not copied. Any equipment removed from the duplicate or any objects taken from its hands immediately disappear, transforming into black smoke.The duplicate can't cast spells, and any attempts by the duplicate to talk result in garbled nonsense, which can not be understood through any means. The duplicate obeys any verbal commands you issue to it (no action required). If not given a command, the duplicate follows you and acts to protect itself, but otherwise takes no actions.For the duration of the spell, whenever the duplicate deals damage to a creature with an attack, you can use your reaction to cause the duplicate to transform into the creature it attacked. This transformation functions exactly as if you had targeted the damaged creature with the original spell. The transformation is indefinite, until the duplicate attacks another creature and you use your reaction to transform it again. When the spell ends, the duplicate, as well as any equipment or objects created by the spell, disappear in wisps of black smoke.

name: Voidwalk
description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. With a wave of your hand, the target begins to dissipate into mist, and must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target and any objects it is wearing or carrying are transformed into mist, becoming transparent and insubstantial, though the creature's form is still recognizable. During this time, the target is immune to damage, can not be targeted by spells or magical abilities, can not speak or move, and any objects it is wearing or carrying can not be interacted with. Though the target can still take actions, it can not hit other creatures or objects, deal damage to them, or cast spells. At the end of the target's next turn, the transformation ends, and it is returned to its normal form.
 Cipher. After casting this spell, choose a willing creature that you can see within 60 feet. For as long as you maintain concentration on this spell, whenever that target deals damage to a hostile creature, you can use your reaction to choose and target another creature with the spell, forcing it to succeed on a Charisma saving throw or suffer the spell's effects.

name: Alchemist's Gift
components: S, M (a healing kit or a poisoner's kit)
description:
Your touch imbues a creature's strikes with poisonous magic, designed to either cripple their targets or suck the life from their veins. Choose deathtouch or lifelink. Until the start of your next turn, it gains the chosen benefit:
 Deathtouch: The target's weapon attacks deal an additional 1d6 necrotic damage, and any creature hit by the target has its maximum hit points reduced by an amount equal to the damage dealt.
 Lifelink: Whenever the target hits a creature with a weapon attack, it regains a number of hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

name: Conflux
components: V, S, M (a pearl, an emerald, a ruby, an onyx, and a sapphire, worth a total of 5000 gp, consumed in the casting)
description: You crush the gems in your hand, one by one, and feel their raw primordial power flowing through you. After casting this spell, choose one spell of 7th-level or below from the cleric spell list. Then do the same for the druid, sorcerer, warlock, and wizard spell lists. As an action on each of your turns for the duration of the spell, you can cast one of the chosen spells without expending a spell slot, though you must still supply the spell's material components. You can cast each of the chosen spells only once in this way. If all five of the chosen spells were of 6th-level or higher, you automatically suffer one level of exhaustion when the spell ends, whether you cast the chosen spells or not.

name: Bathe in Light
description: As you cast this spell, choose an alignment. Until the start of your next turn, the target and each creature in 60 feet that shares an alignment with it can't be the target of spells or abilities of creatures of the chosen alignment, and take half damage from all attacks made by creatures of the chosen alignment.

name: Blockbuster
components: V, S, M (a flask of alchemist's fire)
description:
As you cast this spell, you use the alchemist's fire to burn a symbol into an object or the ground. For the duration, this symbol is hot to the touch, and glows red with heat. When you lose concentration on this spell or travel to another plane, the symbol roils with magical fire, exploding outward in a 300-foot range surrounding the symbol. Each creature in the blast must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 16d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Flammable objects and structures caught in the blast catch on fire. At any time while concentrating on this spell, you can use an action to render the symbol inert, causing the spell to end with no further effect.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by 2d6 per slot level above 7th.

name: Brainspoil
description:
Your touch rots a creature's brain from inside out, forcing the target to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 4d4 psychic damage, and their Intelligence score is reduced by half the amount of damage dealt. If a creature's Intelligence score is reduced to 0 in this way, they fall unconscious until their Intelligence score increases by at least 1 point. On a successful saving throw, the target instead takes 8d4 psychic damage, and their Intelligence is unaffected.
 Transmute. If you have this spell prepared, you can choose to spend 10 minutes in concentration and expend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher in order to replace it on the list of spells you have prepared. The new spell must be of the same level as this spell or lower.

name: Brightflame
components: V, S, M (a bit of blackpowder wrapped in herbs)
description:
A blast of flame roars outward from a point you can see within range, splitting into rivers of flame that scorch your enemies and leave your allies untouched. Each hostile creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the chosen point must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 12d8 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners, but leaves flammable objects and items untouched.Each allied creature in the fire's radius is unaffected by the flames, instead drawing strength and warmth from the flames, causing them to regain 6d8 hit points.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th-level, it instead deals 14d8 damage to hostile creatures in the affected radius, and allied creatures in the radius regain 8d8 hit points.

name: Clutch of the Undercity
components: V, M (a vial of sewer slime, consumed in the casting)
description:
You toss the vial at the feet of a creature you can see within range that is in contact with the ground, causing it to shatter and splatter the slime contained within. The slime rises up as gripping tendrils, which wrap around the target, crushing the air from its lungs and forcing it to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is restrained by the tendrils and it is dragged into the ground below it, which softens and parts beneath it before closing again.While trapped under the ground, the target begins to suffocate. If it fails the initial saving throw by 5 or more, the air is forced from its lungs, and it instead begins to choke. The target can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, escaping from the tendrils and ending the spell's effects on a success. Once the spell has ended, the target or another creature within 5 feet of it must use an action to pull the target from the ground, allowing it to breathe again.If this spell is cast while in an area containing the sewers that the material component was taken from, the target has disadvantage on saving throws related to the spell.
 Transmute. If you have this spell prepared, you can choose to spend 10 minutes in concentration and expend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher in order to replace it on the list of spells you have prepared. The new spell must be of the same level as this spell or lower.

name: Doubling Season
components: V, S, M (two crystals, each worth 500 gp)
description: You channel the power of pack predators, enhancing your ability to aid others and draw upon their strengths. For the duration, whenever you use your Wild Shape, another creature of the same type is automatically summoned in an unoccupied space of your choice within 5 ft. The summoned creature acts at the end of your turn, and is friendly to you and your allies. You can use a bonus action on your turn to command the summoned creature, which otherwise attacks any creature hostile to you and your allies. In addition, whenever you cast a Conjuration spell that summons a creature, an additional creature of the same type is summoned, and whenever you cast a spell which restores hit point, it restores twice that many hit points instead.

name: Incite Hysteria
description: With just a few words, you plant a smoldering flame in the minds of a group of nearby creatures, watching as it ignites into a frenzy. Choose a creature that you can see within range. That creature and each ally of the creature within 30 feet that can both see and hear it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become panicked for the spell's duration. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell's effects on itself on a success.After casting this spell, and at the start of each of your turns for the spell's duration, roll a d8 and assign a direction to each die face. At the start of each of a panicked creature's turns, it uses all its movement to move in that direction. If this movement would place a creature in danger, it moves as close as possible and then stops.

name: Lightning Helix
components: V, S, M (a bit of wood and charcoal)
description:
As you raise your arms above your head, a sphere of burning lightning appears before streaking towards a creature that you can see in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 lightning damage, and you regain that many hit points.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Reroute
description: You can cast this spell using your reaction when you or a creature within range becomes the target of a spell or magical ability. You twist the spell, morphing it and pointing it at a new target of your choice within range. If the new target is the creature which originally cast the spell, they suffer the full effects of the spell, but regain a spell slot of the same level.

name: Shred Memory
description:
For the duration of this spell's casting, you must remain in physical contact with the target, which must be grappled, restrained, unconscious, or willing. If at any point during the casting of the spell you lose physical contact with the target for longer than 1 round, the spell fails and has no effect.After casting the spell, you gain access to all memories the target has made in the previous month, and can choose to erase up to 4 total hours worth of these memories. Memories erased by this spell can be restored through the use of the greater restoration spell or other magic. After casting this spell, the target knows that its memories have been tampered with, and may notice the gaps in its memories. However, the target may not be able to tell who tampered with its memories if it was not conscious for the duration of the spell's casting, or if the memory of the casting was also erased.
 Transmute. If you have this spell prepared, you can choose to spend 10 minutes in concentration and expend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher in order to replace it on the list of spells you have prepared. The new spell must be of the same level as this spell or lower.

name: Wojek Siren
description:
You unleash a powerful battle-cry, which rings out above the sound of battle, its volume magically enhanced. You and each creature of your choice within range that can hear you can use a reaction to make a single melee weapon attack.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the volume is enhanced, increasing the range of the spell by 5 ft. for each slot level above 1st.

name: Curse of Bounty
description: A creature of your choice that you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you place a curse on the target. For the spell's duration, the first time a creature hits the target with a weapon attack each round, both you and the attacking creature can each take one additional bonus action or reaction before the end of your next turn.

name: Acrobatic Maneuver
components: S, M (a dried frog or gecko leg)
description: For the duration of the spell, you gain a climbing speed equal to your movement speed, your jump distance is tripled, and you have advantage on all Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks.In addition, once per round for the spell's duration, when you become the target of a melee attack you can use your reaction to attempt to dodge the attack by making a Dexterity (Acrobatics) check against the attack roll. On a success, the attack misses, and you can move up to 5 feet as part of the same reaction. You must choose whether to use your reaction dodge before you know the result of the attack roll.

name: Arcane Denial
casting_time: 1 reaction, which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell
description:
You interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell, disrupting the arcane energy it needs, and breaking it down into a smaller form. If the creature is casting a spell of 2nd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. Immediately afterwards, you and the creature each regain one expended spell slot of 1st level.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used. In addition, the level of the spell slots regained is one less than the level of the spell the creature attempted to cast.

name: Angelic Exaltation
description: Your body becomes surrounded in either holy light or hellish fire, and you slowly rise to a hovering position 20 feet in the air above your current space, and are unable to move for the duration of the spell.Choose an allied creature that you can see within 60 feet to designate as your champion. For the duration of the spell, as long as the chosen ally remains within 30 feet of you, at the start of each of its turns it gains a bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, saving throws, and ability checks equal to the number of its allies, including yourself, within the spell's radius, up to a maximum of a +5 bonus. This benefit remains until the start of its next turn.If your chosen champion is knocked unconscious or killed, you can choose a new champion at the start of your next turn. You can choose to end the spell early as a bonus action on your turn. If you do, any benefits granted to your champion end immediately.

name: Aerial Assault
description:
Choose up to three non-hostile flying beasts that you can see within range. You temporarily bind the chosen creatures to your service, enhancing their innate danger with your own magic as you do so.Immediately after casting this spell, each of the chosen creatures can move up to twice their speed, and then make a single melee weapon attack against a target of your choice within reach. If the attack hits, it deals an additional 4d4 force damage, and you regain a number of hit points equal to half the force damage dealt this way.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can bind an additional creature to your service for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Adverse Conditions
description: Choose a point that you can see within range. The ground within a 40-foot radius of the chosen point suddenly begins to wither, its color draining away as latticed cracks appear, weakening the surface strength and transforming the area into difficult terrain. Each creature within the radius of the spell's effect must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone and have its speed reduced to 0, as its legs sink into the weakened surface, trapping that creature. A trapped creature can use an action on its turn to make a Strength saving throw or Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC, freeing itself on a success. A creature within 5 feet of a trapped creature can also use an action to attempt to pull a trapped creature free by making a successful Strength (Athletics) check.After casting this spell, an eldrazi drone bursts from the ground in the chosen point, or the nearest unoccupied space. The eldrazi drone acts at the end of each of your turns, and obeys any mental commands you issue to it (no action required). The drone remains until it is killed, or until the end of your next long rest, at which point it automatically dies.

name: Gifts Ungiven
components: S, M (a set of four matching silver statuettes, worth 100 gp each)
description: Your magic has allowed you to speed up the process of studying the spells you know, encoding the information of their casting into your magic itself. When you cast this spell, choose four spells of 6th level or lower that you know and that are listed in your spellbook, but that you do not have prepared. Number the spells 1 through 4 in the order they were chosen, then roll 2d4. After rolling the dice, compare the results to the list of chosen spells, and automatically add each spell whose number appeared as a result on the dice to your list of prepared spells, where it remains until the end of your next long rest. Then choose any spell from the list that was not added to your list of prepared spells, and you may use your reaction to cast that spell. If both dice have the same result, instead add two spells of your choice from the list to your list of prepared spells.

name: One with Nothing
description: You empty your mind of all distractions, all thoughts, and temporarily, all memories. When you cast this spell, all of your remaining spell slots are immediately expended, and until the start of your next turn, you automatically succeed on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

name: Bar the Gate
description: You place a spatial lock on the area around you, a warping field that prevents creatures and objects from being conjured into the space near you. Whenever a creature within range, including yourself, attempts to cast a conjuration spell, you must make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.After casting this spell, and whenever you successfully prevent a spell from being cast, you may venture into the dungeon.

name: ﻿Absorb Weapon
description:
You harmlessly absorb a single light weapon that you are currently holding into the skin of your arm, leaving nothing but a small birthmark in the shape of the weapon. The absorbed weapon does not restrict your range of movement, and can not be detected in any way, though detect magic does reveal a magical aura around the spot. At any time, you may use a bonus action to touch the spot, causing the absorbed weapon to reappear in your hand, so long as your hand is empty. If you make an attack with the weapon in the same round you summon it, you gain advantage on the first attack roll made with it due to catching the target by surprise. If the spell ends while the weapon absorbed, the weapon reappears, either in your hand if it is empty, or otherwise on the ground within reach.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration of the effect doubles for each level of the spell slot above 2nd, up to a maximum of 36 hours.

name: Absorption
description: When you cast this spell, a shield of magic briefly surrounds you, before quickly fading. Whenever you are targeted by a ranged spell attack, this magical shield instead absorbs the attack, granting you a number of spell slots equal to the level of the absorbed spell. These additional spell slots remain for the duration of the spell or until expended. You may use any number of the spell slots to cast spells that you know, subtracting the level of the spell cast from the total level of spell slots absorbed. The shield can absorb up to 1d4+6 spell levels, determined randomly by the DM at the time of the casting. If a spell that targets you exceeds the number of remaining levels to be absorbed, the spell does not take effect, but you do not gain the absorbed spell slots, and the protective shield dissipates, ending the spell.

name: Abyssal Army
components: V, S, M (a ruby worth at least 500 gp, consumed in the casting)
description: As you finish casting this spell, a small fissure appears in the ground, and a hot fog begins to rise from its depths. A group of 2d4 dretches appear within unoccupied spaces within range. Ten minutes later, 1d4 babau appear, followed by a single vrock ten minutes after that. The demons summoned are charmed by you, and follow your orders for the duration of the spell. You may use a bonus action on your turn to telepathically command any number of the demons. You do not need to share a language with them to do so. You may use an action to dismiss any number of the demons. When the spell ends, any demons which have not yet been dismissed are no longer under your command, and can not be dismissed at will.

name: Acid Sheath
components: V, S, M (a handful of fire ants, consumed in the casting)
description:
You crush the handful of fire ants, spreading the resulting liquid on your skin, watching as it slowly expands to cover your entire body in a thin film of acid. The acid is harmless towards yourself, and while present, you may still breathe and act as normal. For the duration, any creature which hits you with a melee attack takes 10d4 acid damage. While grappled, any creature you are grappling automatically takes 10d4 acid damage at the start of each of their turns. Also for the duration, whenever you cast a spell which deals acid damage, the spell automatically deals an additional 5d4 acid damage.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage for the spell, and for spells which deal acid damage while cast during its duration, increases by 2d4 for each level of the spell slot above 5th.

name: Acid Storm
components: V, S, M (a flask of acid, consumed in the casting)
description:
When you cast this spell, choose a point within range that you can see. Whirling green storm clouds rapidly form, and acid rain begins to fall in a 20-foot radius, 30-foot high cylinder centered on the chosen point. Each creature in the cylinder must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 14d4 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the radius and height of the cylinder both increase by 5 feet and the damage increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 6th.

name: Aiming At The Target
description: Casting this spell allows you to enhance your ability to focus on another spell which you have already cast, giving you advantage on all Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on a spell which you are currently concentrating on. The effects of this spell last for as long as you maintain concentration on the previously casted spell, up to 10 minutes.

name: Air Breathing
components: V, S, M (a short piece of reed or straw)
description: When you cast this spell, you may touch any number of creatures within reach. Creatures touched gain the ability to breathe air freely if they did not have the ability to do so before. This does not prevent creatures from breathing underwater or in any other substances.

name: Aligned Fang
components: V, S, M (a sprig of mistletoe)
description:
When you finish casting this spell, you may touch a single willing beast within reach, causing their attacks to be treated as magical for the purposes of overcoming damage resistance.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may target an additional beast within reach for each slot level above 2nd.

name: Allegro
components: V, S, M (the tail feather of a bird of prey)
description: When you cast this spell, any number of creatures that you can see within range gain an additional 30 feet of movement for the duration, up to double their original speed.

name: Amanuensis
description: By touching a piece of writing while holding blank parchment in your other hand, you can cause the words written to magically copy themselves onto the blank parchment, at a rate of up to 50 words per round. The copied text is an exact duplicate of the original. The spell does not copy magical text or illustrations. If concentration is broken on the spell before the text is fully copied, all progress on the copied text is lost as the magically copied text fades away.

name: Amplify
description: With a wave of your hand, you cause all noise within a 20 foot radius centered on a point within range to become amplified, greatly reducing the difficulty in hearing voices and other noises from within the area. Creatures within the radius do not realize the sounds they make are being amplified, and continue to hear things at a normal level. You may choose to target a specific creature within range, attaching the effect to them, and causing the radius of the spell’s effect to move with them as they do so. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the spell takes effect as normal. On a success, the creature becomes aware that they have been targeted by a spell, though they may not not the origin of the spell. Casting this spell within the radius of a silence spell causes both spells to end, and vice-versa.

name: Anarchic Water
components: V, S, M (25 gp worth of powdered iron, consumed in the casting)
description: Casting this spell allows you to create water infused with the power of chaos. This water works exactly like holy water, except that it affects celestials and fey instead of fiends and undead.

name: Animate Elements
description:
Taking a bit of physical material, such as mud, water or fire, you animate it, transforming the material into a small, mindless servant. The animated creature is a tiny construct, with 5 hp and an AC of 11, and a movement speed of 15 feet. The construct can understand and speak up to two languages of your choice, and follows your commands to the best of its abilities. When the spell ends, the construct dissolves, transforming back into an inert pile of material.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration becomes 48 hours. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration becomes one week. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the effects become permanent, but can still be ended by a dispel magic spell targeting the construct.

name: Anticold Sphere
description: You summon a sphere of warm air around yourself, giving off a deep sense of comfort. All friendly creatures within a 10 foot radius centered on yourself gain immunity to cold damage. Hostile creatures within that radius instead gain vulnerability to fire damage.

name: Appraising Touch
description: This spell grants you intuitive insight into the exact worth of an object you touch, allowing you to estimate exactly how much the object is worth in any chosen currency.

name: Arc of Lightning
components: V, S, M (two small iron rods)
description: A bolt of electricity crackles between the two iron rods in your hands, mimicking the larger bolt of lightning stretching between creatures nearby. Choose up to two creatures within range. A bolt of lightning leaps between the creatures in a straight line, dealing 5d6 lightning damage to each of the creatures, and any creature caught in the line between them.

name: Argent Rain
classes: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
description: Choose a point within range. You summon a shower of white and blue molten metal droplets, which rain in a 10-foot radius centered on the chosen point. Each creature in the radius must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 1d8 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Until the start of your next turn, any creature which begins its turn in the radius or enters the radius must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 1d8 fire damage on a failed save. Flammable objects hit by this spell ignite if they are not being worn or carried. This spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

name: Armor of Darkness
components: V, S, M (a small piece of ebony)
description: You envelop a creature you touch with a shroud of darkness, which seeps out to cover their body. This shroud grants the creature half-cover for the duration, resistance to radiant damage, and darkvision out to 60 feet. If the target already has darkvision, then they gain an additional 60 feet of darkvision. Undead creatures affected by the spell also have advantage on saving throws made to avoid being turned or destroyed.

name: Arrow Mind
description: The weapon in your hand begins to feel like an extension of your own body, and you wield it more fluidly and with greater ease. For the spell’s duration, you do not have disadvantage on ranged attack rolls made within 5 feet of hostile creatures.

name: Bee
description: You summon a single honey bee at a point within range, accompanied by an annoying buzzing sound. When the bee is summoned, roll 1d10. On a roll of 9 or below, the bee is frustrated with its new situation, and stings the first creature upon which it lands. If the creature is concentrating on a spell or effect, they immediately lose their concentration. On a result of 10, the bee is unbothered by its situation, and simply flies about without concern.

name: Color Orb
description: You summon a shimmering globe of brilliant energy in your hand, and toss it at a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 radiant damage, and is stunned until the start of their next turn. This spell’s damage increases when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

name: Noonday Sun
description: Your body begins to glow with the light of the very sun itself, forcing all creatures within 20 feet of you that can see you to make a Constitution saving throw. Creatures which fail this saving throw are blinded for 1 minute. A creature may repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Oozes and undead caught within the spell’s area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 10d6 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. If the creature is specifically affected by sunlight, they instead take twice as much damage. Plant creatures exposed to this light are instead healed for the same amount.

name: Pandorym’s Cry
description:
From your mouth springs a silent scream, heard only within the deep reaches of the mind. Choose a single creature within range that you can see. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d6 psychic damage, and until the end of their next turn, their speed is reduced by half and you have advantage on all attack rolls made against them. On a success, they take half as much damage, their speed is not reduced, and you do not gain advantage on attack rolls against them.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for every level of the spell slot above 1st.

name: Spirit Fetch
components: V, S, M (special oils worth 20 gp, expended in the casting)
classes: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
description:
Upon completing this ritual, you summon a small, indistinct spirit, shaped like a creature of your choice. You give the spirit a small command of 10 words or less, and send the spirit to a creature that you can visualize, whose name you know, or to whom you have a physical representation, such as hair or blood. The spirit seeks out the creature wherever it is, and once there, delivers the command to the recipient. The spirit then remains as a reminder, staying for 12 hours, or until the command has been completed, whichever happens first. The spirit is immune to all damage and can not be harmed or interacted with. It can not be dispelled, but casting dispel magic on the spirit does cause it to disappear for 24 hours.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spirit remains for up to 24 hours. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, it remains for up to 1 week. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, it remains for up to 1 month.

name: Spirits of the Shadowed Moon
description: As you cast this spell, you outstretch your hands, creating a 15-foot radius of whirling shadows and sparkling lights centered on you. While in this radius, you and your allies are obscured from sight. Creatures have disadvantage on ranged attacks against you, and you and your allies are considered to have enough cover to make Dexterity (Stealth) checks to become hidden. Hostile creatures which enter the radius do not benefit from the effects of the spell, and may be seen as normal.

name: Worms
description:
Choose a single creature that you can see within range. You summon a swarm of biting maggots to tear at the target’s flesh, forcing them to make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes 2d8 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. You then regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage dealt.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each level of the spell slot above 2nd.

name: Blight Mound
components: V, S, M (a bit of rotting plant or animal matter, wrapped in swamp grass)
description: When you cast this spell, a bulbous growth appears somewhere on your body, swelling to roughly the size of your head before bursting open in a process that does no damage to you. A pest appears from the opening, and drops to the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice within 5 feet. Your GM has the pest's statistics.The pest is friendly to you and your allies, acts immediately after you in initiative, and obeys any commands you mentally issue to it (no action required). As long as the pest is within 60 feet of you, it gains a bonus to AC, attack rolls, and damage rolls equal to your spellcasting modifier. Whenever a pest summoned by this spell is killed, you absorb a portion of its life essence, causing you to regain a number of hit points equal to 1d6 + your spellcasting modifier.For the duration of this spell, whenever you deal damage to one or more creatures with a spell, you can use your reaction to summon another pest, which appears in the same manner as the first. You can have a maximum number of pests created in this way at a time equal to your spellcasting modifier. If you already control the maximum number of pests and attempt to summon another, you instead regain a number of hit points equal to 1d6 + your spellcasting modifier.

name: Bite of the Black Rose
description:
When you cast this spell, choose up to four creatures that you can see within 30 feet. Then you and each of the chosen creatures, in initiative order, votes for sickness of psychosis.If sickness gets more votes, each of the chosen creatures must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 5d6 poison damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much on a successful one. A creature that fails this saving throw is also poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.If psychosis gets more votes, each of the chosen creatures must make an Intelligence saving throw. A creature that fails this saving throw is stunned for 1 minute. A stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th.

name: Ach! Hans, Run!
components: V, S, M (the bone of a humanoid slain by a lhurgoyf, a lich, or a tarrasque)
description: As an action on each of your turns for the duration of the spell, you can shout "Ach! Hans, run! It's the..." and then name a non-humanoid creature of CR 8 or less. If you do, you summon the named creature, which appears in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 100 feet.The summoned creature acts at the end of your turn, and is not inherently friendly to you or your allies. The GM determines how the summoned creature reacts to the situation.The creature disappears at the end of its turn, or if it is reduced to 0 hit points.

name: Aether Tide
components: V, S, M (an unbroken clam shell)
description:
Choose up to three creatures that you can see within range. Each of those creatures must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, an affected creature is temporarily transported to an empty demiplane created by the spell. At the start of each of your turns after casting the spell, one creature teleported to the demiplane, chosen at random, reappears in the space it previously occupied or the nearest unoccupied space. Once all creatures affected by the spell have been returned, the spell ends.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

name: Sword-Point Diplomacy
description: Brandishing your weapon, you attempt to coerce a creature into revealing their secrets. Choose a creature that you can see within range. You ask the target three questions, one after another. After each question, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target must answer the question truthfully, to the best of their ability. On a successful save, if the target chooses not to answer, it automatically takes 3d10 psychic damage. If the target chooses to answer a question and attempts to lie about the answer, it must make a Charisma (Deception) check against your spell save DC. On a failed check, it automatically takes 3d10 psychic damage, and you know that it lied.

name: Walk the Plank
description: Choose a creature that you can see within range. You feel the ancient bloodlust stirring in the tooth, reaching out for it and the spirit of the shark it once belonged to. A spectral shark appears beneath the feet of the target, leaping up from the ground beneath them, as if to swallow them whole, forcing the target to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save the target takes 4d10 psychic damage as the shark's teeth pass through its body, and it is frightened for 1 minute. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and is not frightened. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target has a swim speed of at least 30 feet, it instead takes half as much damage on a successful save, and no damage on a failed save. If you are underwater when you cast this spell, it instead deals twice as much damage.

name: Pacifism
components: V, S, M (a crown of flowers)
description: Choose one creature that you can see within range, forcing them to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save the target is overcome by feelings of warmth, peace, and tranquility. Creatures immune to being charmed automatically succeed on the saving throw. For the spell's duration, all creatures have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to interact with the target, and the target can't take the Attack action or cast spells, and can't use its reaction to make opportunity attacks. At the start of each of its turns, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the target can take the Attack action or cast a spell that turn but then returns to docility. The spell's effects automatically end if the target takes damage, or if another creature uses its action to shake the target out of the trance.

name: Ajani's Mantra
description:
You begin a hymnal chant, consisting of soothing words filled with healing magic. You regain a number of hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier. At the start of each of your turns for the spell's duration, you can use a bonus action to continue the chant. If you do, you regain an additional number of hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. If you do not, the spell immediately ends.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the number of initial hit points regained increases to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier, and the hit points regained on subsequent turns increases to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier.

name: Aether Snap
components: S, M (a pearl and an ebony gem, each worth at least 200 gp, both consumed in the casting)
description: Each creature within the spell's radius that is not native to the plane, including yourself, must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or immediately be returned to its native plane. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw instead takes 4d6 psychic damage. In addition, any spell of 5th-level or lower affecting a creature in the radius automatically ends.

name: Electrify
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when a creature within range moves or makes an attack
description: Lightning sparks from your open palm, quickly surrounding a creature which moves makes an attack while within range, forcing the target to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 4d10 lightning damage and is stunned until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and is not stunned.

name: Failure // Comply
casting_time: 1 reaction, which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell
description:
You attempt to reverse a spell cast by a creature in range, using your reaction to make an ability check with your spellcasting ability, with a DC equal to 10 + the level of the spell. On a success, the spell fails and has no effect, and the creature that cast the spell regains a spell slot of the spell's level.
 Aftermath. When you cast this spell, you can also choose to expend an additional spell slot of 1st-level or higher. If you do, in addition to the spell's normal effects, the target must make an Intelligence saving throw. If the target fails the saving throw, you then choose a spell. The target can't cast the chosen spell until the end of their next short or long rest.

name: Hapatra's Mark
description: As you cast this spell, you touch a willing creature, granting it a blessing against poisons both magical and mundane. The target is cured of the poisoned condition and any poisons currently affecting it, and gains immunity to poison damage until the start of your next turn.

name: Haze of Pollen
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when a creature within range makes an attack
components: S, M (the seed pod of a poppy flower)
description:
You can use your reaction to cast this spell when a creature that you can see within 10 feet makes an attack. You fling out your hand, creating a thick burst of pollen, which settles in a thick cloud around the attacking creature's face, forcing it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes stunned until the end of its next turn, and its attack automatically fails. If the target does not need to breathe, it automatically succeeds on this saving throw.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can cast a single cantrip that you know as part of the same reaction.

name: Liliana's Mastery
description: As you cast this spell, you can feel the temperature of the air drop around you, and see the shadows around you grow thick and heavy. A thick aura of necromantic energy appears in a 60-foot radius around you, which remains for the spell's duration. Any undead creature in this radius has advantage on all attack rolls and saving throws, and automatically regain 1d8 hit points whenever it starts its turn in the aura's radius or enters it for the first time on its turn. In addition, when you cast this spell, choose any number of undead creatures of CR (1/2) or below that you can see within 60 feet. Each of the chosen creatures becomes charmed by you for the spell's duration. Creatures charmed in this way are friendly to you and your allies, and obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.

name: Never // Return
components: S, M (a vial of desert sand)
description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. Like a sandstorm at night, a whirlwind of black dust begins to swirl and scream around the target, forcing it to make a Constitution saving throw. If the target is able to breathe underwater, it has disadvantage on this saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 8d10 necrotic damage and is blinded and deafened until the start of your next turn. On a success the target takes half as much damage, and suffers no additional effect.
 Aftermath. When you cast this spell, you can also choose to expend an additional spell slot of 4th-level or higher. If you do, the spell deals an additional 4d10 necrotic damage, and if this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it automatically dies. If a humanoid is killed this way, it is resurrected at the start of your next turn as a zombie under your control. This zombie acts at the end of each of your turns, and obeys any verbal commands you isse to it (no action required by you.) If not given any commands, the zombie follows you if you move, but otherwise takes no actions.

name: Painful Lesson
components: S, M (an inkpen and a bottle of ink)
description: Choose a willing creature within range. At your touch, the target's flesh begins to burn like acid, as ink spreads across a patch of their skin in the shape of magical runes and rituals. The target takes 10 necrotic damage, and its maximum hit points are reduced by the same amount. Choose a cantrip that you know. Until the end of the target's next long rest, it gains the ability to cast the chosen cantrip. The creature's spellcasting ability for the spell is the same as your own. If you cast this spell as a ritual, instead choose a 1st-level spell that you know. Until the end of the target's next long rest, it can cast the chosen spell a number of times equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

name: Scarab Feast
description:
After casting this spell, a wave of scarabs pour from your mouth, swarming up to three undead creatures of your choice that you can see within range. At the start of each of the chosen creatures' turns, they must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d6 necrotic damage, and has disadvantage on all attack rolls until the start of its next turn.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can cast a single cantrip that you know as part of the same action.

name: Trespasser's Curse
description:
When you cast this spell, you set a magical trap designed to ensure secrecy and privacy. Choose an object or an area within range that is no larger than a 20-foot cube. Magical symbols briefly appear and cover the chosen object or area, then fade away. Until the spell ends, whenever a tiny or larger creature touches or enters the warded area, the trap triggers and the runes flash, and the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes cursed, causing it to take 1d4 necrotic damage when it becomes cursed and an additional 1d4 necrotic damage every hour that it remains cursed until the spell ends. When you cast this spell, you can designate creatures that won't set off the trap. While the target is cursed in this way, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to automatically determine the cursed creature's direction and distance from you. In addition, whenever the cursed creature takes an action while within 30 feet of you, it takes an additional 1d4 necrotic damage and you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. At any time, you can touch a creature affected by the curse and use an action to end the curse's effects on the creature, without ending the spell warding the area.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 2nd. When you cast this spell using a higher level spell slot, the duration of the spell increases- at 4th level, the duration becomes 24 hours; at 6th level, the duration becomes 1 week; at 8th level the spell's effects remain until dispelled.

name: Breeding Pit
components: V, S, M (a bit of flesh and a cauldron, barrel, or other container for holding liquid)
description: You set the storage container on the ground, and it begins to fill with a black, viscous liquid. As you drop the flesh into the container, the liquid begins to bubble, and a thrull climbs its way out of the container, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. At the beginning of each of your turns for the duration of the spell, you can choose to summon another thrull from the container, taking 2d10 necrotic damage if you do so. If you do not, the liquid stops bubbling, and the spell ends.Thrulls summoned from the cauldron act at the end of your turn, and obey any verbal commands issued by you (no action required). If not given a command, the thrulls take no action. Any thrull summoned in this way automatically dies when the spell ends.

name: Dash Hopes
casting_time: 1 reaction, which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell
description:
You pluck the tangled webs of fate and magic, attempting to interrupt a spell being cast by another creature by drawing their life force into it. If the creature is casting a spell of 2nd level or lower, it must choose to take 1d10 damage per level of the spell being cast. If it doesn't, the spell fails and has no effect.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, it can affect spells of a level less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

name: Baffling Defenses
components: V, S, M (the scale of a dragon)
description: Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you become immune to all damage that would be dealt to you by the target for the spell's duration. Whenever you deal damage to the target, or if the target attacks you or targets you with a spell or magical ability, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the spell on a success.

name: Aerial Formation
components: S, M (one feather of a sea-bird for each target of the spell)
description:
Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Until the end of your next turn, that creature's speed is increased by 10 feet, and it gains a flying speed equal to its movement speed. If that creature already has a flying speed, its flying speed increases by 20 feet instead.When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless it can stop the fall.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the target's speed increases by an additional 5 feet for each slot level above 1st. In addition, you can target one additional creature when you cast this spell at 4th level or higher (up to two creatures), and 7th level or higher (up to three creatures).

name: Aether Web
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when a hostile creature enters a space within range
components: V, M (a bit of spider web, wrapped around a twig)
description:
Thick strands of sticky, magically reinforced webbing burst outward from a point you can see within range, filling a 15-foot square centered on the chosen point. Each creature other than you within the radius of the webbing produced by the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be restrained. A restrained creature can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, or use its action to make a Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC, freeing itself on a success.If you are in the radius of the webbing when you cast the spell, instead of causing you to be restrained, the webbing raises you slightly into the air and wraps around you, forming a protective shield. For the duration of the spell, your speed is reduced to 0, you gain a +1 bonus to AC, and have half-cover against all ranged attacks.All webbing created by the spell disappears after the spell's duration, if you lose concentration on the spell, or if you choose to dismiss it using a bonus action.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level the webbing instead fills a 20-foot square, if cast using a spell slot of 6th or 7th level the webbing expands to a 25-foot square and provides three-quarters cover against ranged attacks, and if cast using a spell slot of 8th level or higher the webbing fills a 30-foot square around the chosen point and provides you with full cover against all ranged attacks for the duration of the spell.

name: ﻿Building Tension
components: V, S, M (a bit of spider webbing or an animal bone)
description: When you cast this spell, you touch a creature or object, subtly transforming it in ways that inspire a creeping sense of dread in those nearby. Whenever a creature that can see the target begins its turn within 60 feet of the target, that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the target for the spell’s duration. A frightened creature can repeat this saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that can no longer see the target has advantage on this saving throw, while a creature that can still see the target has disadvantage. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the spell’s effects for the duration. When you cast this spell, you can choose up to five creatures that you can see within 30 feet, including yourself, to be immune to the spell’s effects. When you cast this spell as a ritual, the duration instead becomes concentration, up to 1 hour.

name: Dancing Shadows
components: V, S, M (a vial of liquid smoke, consumed during the casting)
description:
You uncap the vial of liquid smoke, and pour its contents onto your own shadow, watching as it evaporates just as it touches the darkness. Strange shapes begin to writhe and move within your shadow, and you become aware of a presence dwelling within it. Until the end of your next long rest, you gain the following benefits:
 While in dim light or darkness, you have advantage on initiative rolls and can not be surprised. While in bright light, you have disadvantage on initiative rolls.
 If you begin your turn in an area of dim light or darkness, you automatically regain a number of hit points equal to your spellcasting modifier. If you begin your turn in an area of bright light, you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d10 radiant damage.
 Whenever you hit a target within 60 feet with a spell attack, you can use a bonus action to command your shadow to lash out and attack as well. If you do, the attack deals an additional 2d6 necrotic damage. If the target is in dim light or darkness, this damage is doubled.

name: Dazzling Ornamentation
components: S, M (a freshly polished silver mirror)
description: You touch a willing creature that must be wearing metal armor for this spell to work. If the target is not wearing metal armor, the spell fails. You watch as the target’s armor begins to shine, turning into a polished, reflective silver. For the duration of the spell, the target is immune to any effect that requires eye contact, such as a medusa’s Petrifying Gaze or a vampire’s Charm. In addition, whenever the target takes fire, lightning, or radiant damage, it’s armor briefly flashes with a dazzling display of reflected light. When this happens, each creature of the target’s choice within 10 feet must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, an affected creature takes 1d8 radiant damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a success, an affected creature takes half as much damage and is not blinded.

name: Disguising Overgrowth
components: V, S, M (a bit of kudzu vine)
description:
Choose a single, free-standing structure within range that is no more than two stories high and that takes up a space no larger than 2000 square feet. As you finish casting this spell, illusionary vines, crawling plants, and flowering bushes overgrow the structure’s exterior, then vanish. For the duration of the spell, any creatures farther than 30 feet from the structure automatically perceive it as a large patch of greenery. If a creature moves within 30 feet of the structure, the plants vanish from its view, and the true appearance of the structure becomes obvious. When you cast this spell, you can choose up to five creatures other than yourself, which are automatically able to discern the illusion from any distance. When the illusionary plant growth appears, you can allow it to automatically take a natural form, or you can determine which types of plants appear and where, customizing the illusion to your desire.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level, the duration becomes 2 weeks. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the duration becomes 1 year.

name: Frail Guidance
components: V, S, M (a porcelain mask worth at least 200 gp, consumed in the casting)
description: When you cast this spell, a shell of ghostly, translucent porcelain briefly appears around you before fading away. For the duration of the spell, you become vulnerable to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and you have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

name: Ghost Touch
components: V, S, M (the finger of a creature that was hanged to death)
description: The edges of your body begin to flicker with a ghostly, liminal light, and anyone looking would almost think they could see right through you. For the duration, you can use an action on each of your turns to briefly enter the Ethereal Plane, returning to your plane of origin at the end of your turn. You can see and hear the plane you originated from, but everything there looks gray, and you can't see anything more than 60 feet away. While on the Ethereal Plane, you can only affect and be affected by other creatures on that plane. Creatures that aren't on the Ethereal Plane can't perceive you and can't interact with you, unless a special ability or magic has given them the ability to do so. You ignore all objects and effects that aren't on the Ethereal Plane, allowing you to move through objects you perceive on the plane you originated from. For the duration, you can use an action on each of your turns to make a melee spell attack against any creature you can see within 30 feet. If the attack hits, the target takes 2d12 necrotic damage. This spell has no effect if you cast it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn't border it, such as one of the Outer Planes.

name: Mindless Work
description: As part of casting this spell, you perform a short, simple activity no longer than 30 seconds in duration. After doing so, magical energy continues to repeat the process until the spell ends. The activity must occur in one location, no larger than a 5-foot by 5-foot square, and can not require more than 10 lbs of force. For example, the spell could loop beads on a necklace or sweep dirt from the porch of a storefront, but could not hammer a blade or move heavy objects. If you move further than 60 feet from the area where the activity is occurring, the spell ends.

name: Power Word Wound
description: You speak a word of power that rips and tears at the body of one creature you can see within range. If the target has 100 hit points or fewer, a deep gash appears on its body, and begins to bleed. Otherwise, the spell has no effect. While the target suffers from this injury, at the beginning of each of its turns, it automatically takes 2d10 necrotic damage, and must make a Constitution saving throw.
