If the target fails the saving throw, the pain of the injury overwhelms it, and its speed becomes 0 and it is incapacitated until the start of its next turn. The injury can not be healed naturally, and remains until the target receives healing from a spell of 8th-level or higher, or the injury is healed using a wish spell or similar magic.

name: Sphere of Snow
components: V, S, M (a bit of shaved ice, a carrot, and a piece of coal)
description: A 5-foot diameter sphere of snow appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range and lasts for the duration. Any creature in the sphere’s space must make a Strength saving throw. A Huge or larger creature succeeds on this saving throw automatically, and a Large or smaller creature can choose to fail it. On a failed save, a creature is restrained by the sphere and engulfed by the snow. At the end of each of its turns, a restrained target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Any creature that ends its turn inside of the sphere or within 5 feet of it must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d8 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The sphere can hold up to one creature at a time. If the sphere restrains another creature while it already has a creature restrained, the previously restrained creature falls out of the sphere and lands prone in a space within 5 feet of it. As a bonus action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet. Any creature restrained by the sphere moves with it. If you move the sphere into a creature’s space, that creature must make the saving throw to avoid being restrained, and the sphere stops moving this turn. The sphere automatically stops moving if it reaches a barrier at least 5 feet tall or a drop greater than 10 feet. If the sphere moves over a source of flame, you must make a spellcasting ability check against your spell save DC. On a failed check, the spell automatically ends. When the spell ends, any creature restrained by the sphere is knocked prone in the space where it falls, and the sphere bursts into a flurry of snow.

name: Wild Surge
description: Snaking tendrils of red energy, whirling in random and chaotic patterns, spread from your fingertips across the skin of a creature that you touch. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. If the target succeeds on the saving throw, nothing happens and the spell automatically ends. If the target fails the saving throw, for the duration of the spell whenever the target casts a spell of 1st-level or higher, it must roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to create a random magical effect, rerolling any result of 01-02 or 99-00. If the target has the Wild Magic Surge feature, it instead rolls twice.

name: Banishing Knack
description: Choose one nonmagical object that you can see within range. With a snap of your fingers and a flick of your wrist, you attempt to temporarily pull that object out of reality, stashing it in an inaccessible demiplane. The target object must occupy a space no larger than 5 square feet. If the object is being carried or worn by a creature, that creature can make a Wisdom saving throw, preventing the spell's effects on a success.When the spell ends, the object reappears on the ground in a space of your choice within 5 feet of where it vanished from. If the object was being worn or carried when it disappeared, it instead reappears within 5 feet of the creature that was previously carrying or wearing it.

name: Caress of Phyrexia
components: S, M (a vial of black oil)
description: You magically draw the oil from the vial, splashing it on a creature you can see within range, and watch as it seeps into their skin, taking hold within their blood. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target takes 4d6 poison damage, and its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage dealt. The target then gains a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls and is charmed by you for the duration of the spell. At the start of each of its turns, the charmed creature automatically takes an additional 2d6 poison damage, and its hit point maximum is reduced by that amount. Then the creature can make another Constitution saving throw, ending the spell and the charmed condition on a success. If the target succeeds on the original saving throw, it takes the initial damage and its hit point maximum is reduced, but nothing else happens.

name: Mind Culling
description: You look deep into the eyes of a creature that you can see within range, connecting your mind to theirs, siphoning their mental energy away and with it, their secrets. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save it takes 6d6 psychic damage and you learn three secrets that the target knows, of the DM's choice. Alternatively, if the target is a spellcaster, it loses one spell slot of its highest available level and you regain one expended spell slot of the lowest available level. On a success, the target takes 10d6 psychic damage, and nothing else happens. If the target's Intelligence is 4 or less, the spell fails, and you take 4d6 psychic damage.

name: Phyrexian Unlife
components: V, S, M (a vial of black oil)
description:
You dip your fingers into the oil, and dab it thick around the eyes of the target, as more pours from their mouth and fingertips. For the spell's duration, the target does not fall unconscious and can't die as a result of being reduced to 0 hit points, and can't die from massive damage. Whenever the target takes damage while at 0 hit points, it instead suffers one level of exhaustion. The target can still regain hit points, and can still die as a result of exhaustion.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the duration becomes concentration, up to 8 hours. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the duration becomes 24 hours, and the spell does not require concentration.

name: Triumph of the Hordes
components: V S, M (a bone from a diseased animal)
description: When you cast this spell, choose any number of willing creatures that you can see within range. Each of the chosen creatures deals an additional 1d8 poison damage on all melee weapon attacks, and can use a bonus action on its turn to make an additional melee weapon attack. Whenever a target hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have its maximum hit points reduced by an amount equal to the damage dealt and suffer one level of exhaustion. The effects of this spell last until the start of your next turn.

name: Angelic Accord
description: This spell transforms the magic you use to heal abrasions, close cuts, and knit skin back together into something greater than magical medicine, allowing it to empower its recipients in addition to healing them. Once per round, for the duration of this spell, whenever you provide a willing creature with magical healing through another spell or feature, you can choose to give that creature a +1 bonus to its AC and a flying speed equal to its movement speed until the start of your next turn. In addition, any creature that receives magical healing from you automatically regains an additional 1d8 hit points.If you provide magical healing to several creatures at once through the same spell or feature, only one of those creatures can be granted the bonus to AC and flying speed. However, all of the affected creatures regain the additional hit points provided by this spell.

name: Aethersnatch
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when you see a creature within 60 feet casting a spell
description: You attempt to steal a piece of magic from its caster, causing the spell to fail and have no effect. As part of the same reaction used to cast this spell, you can then cast the spell the target was attempting to cast.You do not need to know the spell, and it does not have to be on the list of spells available for your class. You must still supply all material components required for the spell. You choose targets for the spell as normal, and the spell uses your spell attack bonus or spell save DC.

name: Adventure Awaits
description:
You attune yourself and your magic to the land, gaining a benefit based on the terrain you are currently in. These benefits last until the spell ends, you leave the designated terrain type, or you are reduced to 0 hit points.
 Arctic: You automatically succeed on saving throws against the effects of extreme cold.
 Coast: You gain the ability to breathe underwater, and a swim speed equal to your movement speed.
 Desert: You are immune to the effects of dehydration for the duration, and cannot become lost except by magical means.
 Forest: You have advantage on ability checks made to track other creatures, and gain a climb speed equal to your movement speed.
 Swamp: You have advantage on saving throws made to resist the effects of diseases and poison, and are not slowed by nonmagical difficult terrain.
 If the terrain type is the same as one of your favored terrains, when you cast this spell you can choose up to three willing creatures within 10 feet to also gain the spell's benefits.

name: Aura of Dominion
description: Choose up to four willing humanoids you can see in range. You bind the chosen creatures together through a magical oath of loyalty, which lasts for the duration of the spell or until one of the targets chooses to end the spell's effects as a bonus action. Once per round, when you or one creature affected by the spell takes a turn in combat, that creature can choose to allow another of the spell's targets to take a turn on this initiative instead. The original creature does not receive a turn in combat this round, and is unable to take actions or reactions. The chosen target instead takes a second turn this round in place of the original creature, in addition to their normal turn this round.

name: Commander's Insignia
components: V, S, M (a stamp of an insignia designed by you, made from rare metals and worth at least 250 gp)
description: You press the stamp against a willing creature, and a symbol made of magical light in the shape of insignia on the stamp appears on both the creature and yourself, in the location you placed the stamp. The insignia magically marks the creature as an ally, and can only be seen by yourself and any other creature stamped with the same insignia. You can use a bonus action to cause the insignia to disappear from a stamped creature at any time, over any distance. Otherwise the insignia, and the magical benefits it provides, remain for the spell's duration.You can automatically detect the location of any stamped creature that is on the same plane of existence as you and vice-versa, and can telepathically communicate with stamped creatures at a distance of up to 1 mile. You receive a mental alert if a creature stamped with an insignia you created is knocked unconscious or killed while on the same plane as you.Any creature magically stamped this way automatically adds 1d4 to its attack rolls and saving throws while within 30 feet of you or another creature stamped with the same insignia, and two creatures stamped with the same insignia can telepathically communicate while within 60 feet of each other.As an action, you can choose to automatically teleport yourself up to 10 miles to the location of a creature stamped with an insignia you created, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice within 5 feet of the target. You can teleport in this way up to three times per long rest.

name: ﻿Dreadful Visage
description: Your face twists into a dreadful mockery of itself, and all creatures within 5 ft. of you must make a Sanity saving throw against fear.

name: Fear of the Grave
description: You choose a creature within range, and begin to flood its mind with grim reminders of its own impending mortality. The creature must succeed on a Sanity saving throw or take necrotic damage equal to 1d8+ your spellcasting ability modifier. So long as you maintain concentration on this effect, the creature takes the damage again at the start of each of your turns, and suffers from the lesser insanity known as thanatophobia. If you maintain concentration on this effect for a full minute, the creature permanently gains the lesser insanity thanatophobia. The creature may end this effect on itself with a successful Sanity saving throw at the beginning of each of its turns.

name: Inflict Madness
description: Choose a creature within range. They are assaulted with hallucinations of their own past, powerful flashbacks, and rapid thoughts. The target must succeed on a Sanity saving throw or take 4d6 psychic damage and suffer from a greater insanity. If the creature succeeds on the saving throw, it takes half damage instead, and suffer from a lesser insanity. This insanity is cured after they finish a long rest. If this spell is cast as a ritual, the duration of the insanity is instead permanent, until cured through some other means such as greater restoration.

name: Inspire Resolve
description:
You give a speech or performance which inspires courage in the hearts and minds of up to 8 targets within range, including yourself. Those creatures gain advantage on Sanity saving throws against fear for the duration of the spell.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, affected creatures gain advantage on Sanity saving throws against horror as well. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, affected creatures gain advantage on Sanity saving throws against madness as well.

name: Startle Beasts
description: You shout and gesture, forcing all beasts within range to succeed on a Sanity saving throw or roll on the fearful reaction chart. Beasts with an Intelligence of 4 or higher are immune to this effect.

name: Anticipate
description: Your touch grants a creature a brief glimpse into the future, for a small look at the possibilities it may hold. The target rolls three d20s, then chooses and records one of those results. The next time before the start of your next turn that the target makes an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check, it can choose to replace the result of that roll with the recorded result.

name: Regna's Sanction
description: You summon a glowing mass of energy into your hand, which splits into streaking beams of light that seek out any number of creatures that you choose within range. For your allies it is a soothing warmth during battle, and for your enemies it is a searing heat. For each creature targeted, choose friend or foe. Friends targeted by the spell gain a number of temporary hit points equal to (10 x your spellcasting modifier). Make a ranged attack roll against each foe. On a hit, the target takes 6d10 radiant damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute. A blinded creature can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Acid Rain
components: V, S, M (a vial of acid)
description: You summon a bank of sickly green storm clouds, shrouding the area within range in dim light. Choose a point within range. All creatures within a 30 foot radius centered on the chosen point must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Plant creatures take twice as much damage from this spell. As an action on each of your turns for the duration of the spell, you may repeat this effect, choosing a new point to center the effect each turn.

name: Alabaster Potion
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when a creature within range is targeted by an attack
components: V, S, M (a healing potion, consumed in the casting)
description:
You break the potion in your hand, converting its magic into a protective aura, which surrounds any ally, guarding them from harm. The target gains 2d4+2 temporary hit points.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the target gains 4d4+4 temporary hit points instead. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the target gains 8d4+8 temporary hit points. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the target gains 10d4+20 temporary hit points.

name: All Hallow's Eve
components: V, S, M (a broken piece of tombstone)
description: When you cast this spell, you surround yourself in an aura of necromantic magic. For the duration of the spell, once each round, you may choose a single creature that you can see within 30 feet. The chosen creature gets a single scream die, which remains even if they are reduced to 0 hit points, for the duration of the spell. When you lose concentration on the spell, or the spell ends, any creature which had a scream die who was killed or reduced to 0 hit points during the spell's duration is immediately revived, regaining a number of hit points equal to 8d8 + your spellcasting modifier.

name: Angelic Voices
description:
Choose up to 6 creatures within range. The chosen creatures become enveloped in a blinding white aura, accompanied by angelic singing, which shields them from harm. For the duration, the chosen creatures have advantage on all saving throws, attacks made against them have disadvantage, and they take half as much damage from all sources. The effects of the spell end if any of the chosen creatures make an attack or cast a spell for the duration.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, you may instead choose up to 12 creatures in range, all attacks made against the chosen creatures automatically miss, and they become immune to all damage.

name: Anti-Magic Aura
components: V, S, M (a sprig of holly)
description: A powerful magical ward envelops the target, protecting them from magical- but not mundane- harm. The touched creature can not be targeted by spells, and has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Whenever the creature is targeted by a spell, you must make a spellcasting ability check. The DC of the ability check is equal to 10 + the level of the spell cast. On a failed check, the shield shatters and the spell ends, causing the shielded target to take 6d8 force damage, but protecting them from the effects of the spell. The spell lasts for 1 hour, or until the shield breaks.

name: Arboria
components: V, S, M (an emerald worth at least 500 gp, consumed in the casting)
description: For the duration of the spell, all creatures within the radius of the spell's effect become immune to all damage. If a creature takes an action, bonus action, or reaction, they lose this immunity until the start of their next turn.

name: Avoid Fate
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when you make a saving throw to avoid a spell
description:
You may cast this spell as a reaction when a spell of 1st level or lower forces you to make a saving throw. You automatically succeed on the saving throw, instead taking 1d4 psychic damage.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may instead cast it in response to a spell of equal level to the spell slot expended.

name: Backdraft
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when a creature in range makes a spell attack
description: You may cast this spell when a creature that you can see within range makes a spell attack. You make a small gesture using the mirror in your hand, causing the magic of the target's spell to brush back against them. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw, taking force damage equal to half the damage dealt by the spell on a failed save.

name: Backfire
components: V, S, M (a length of rope tied into a knot)
description: Choose up to two targets within range that are no more than 10 feet apart from each other. For the duration, whenever one target deals damage to you, the other target takes damage equal to half that amount.

name: Bloodlust
components: V, S, M (a vial of the target's blood, consumed in the casting)
description: With a blood-curdling war cry, you spill the blood of a nearby ally, driving them into a mad frenzy. For the duration, whenever the target ally hits a creature with an attack, they may sacrifice any number of hit points to deal additional damage equal to half the number of sacrificed hit points, rounded down.

name: Boomerang
description: You touch a weapon which has the Thrown property, tying it spiritually to the creature holding it. For the duration, whenever a creature makes a ranged attack using the weapon, the weapon automatically returns to them at the end of their turn. They may catch the returning weapon with no action on their part, so long as they have a free hand with which to grab it when it returns.

name: Burning Crevasse
description: Placing your hands upon the ground, you cause an illusionary crevasse to open beneath the feet of up to 5 creatures in range. Each target may be no more than 5 feet from another target. Each of the creatures must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a target believes flames are bursting from the crevasse beneath their feet. If the target has resistance to fire damage, they lose that resistance; otherwise the target becomes vulnerable to fire damage. This spell has no effect on creatures who are immune to fire damage. An affected target may repeat the saving throw at the start of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.

name: Cavern of Despair
components: V, S, M (a ruby worth at least 500 gp, consumed in the casting)
description: Choose a point within range. All light within a 60 foot radius of that point begins to fade, leaving the entire radius cloaked in dim light. Whenever a creature starts their turn within the radius, they must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes unable to take an action until the start of their next turn. In addition, any attack which hits them is an automatic critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of them.

name: Chains of Mephistopheles
description: Spectral chains burst forth from the ground surrounding you, wrapping around both you and the target, forcing it to make a Charisma saving throw. On a successful saving throw, the target takes 4d6 psychic damage and the spell ends. On a failed save, what actions the target can take each turn becomes restricted, allowing it to only take the same action on its turn that you took on your last turn. If you cast a spell or take the Attack action, the target can do either. At the start of each of its turns while affected by the spell the target can choose to take no action, instead attempting another Charisma saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target takes 2d6 psychic damage. On a success, the spell ends and you take 4d6 psychic damage.

name: Cleanse
description: When you cast this spell, choose a point within range. A blinding light appears, filling a 20 foot radius centered on that point. Each creature in the radius must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is blinded for 1 hour. If the creature is a fey, fiend, or undead they also take 10d10 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

name: Cocoon
components: V, S, M (an empty cocoon, consumed during the casting)
description:
During the casting of this spell, you slowly walk in circles around a willing target, who must be present for the duration of the casting. Once the spell is cast, a cocoon of string slowly envelopes them, rendering them unconscious. The cocoon remains for 30 minutes, during which time the target becomes unconscious, is immune to damage and can not be targeted by spells or magical abilities. The cocoon itself has AC 5 and 15 hit points, and is vulnerable to fire damage. If the cocoon is destroyed before 30 minutes have passed, the spell fails and the target awakens. After 30 minutes have passed, the cocoon falls apart and the target awakens, having grown wings similar to those of a butterfly or moth, which grant them a flying speed equal to their walking speed. The wings remain for 8 hours, after which time they harmlessly break off and turn to dust.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the wings remain for 24 hours instead. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the wings remain for one week.

name: Concordant Crossroads
components: V, S, M (the feather of an exotic bird)
description: When you cast this spell, the terrain within 90 feet of the space in which the spell was cast becomes covered with light plant growth, covering buildings and structures within the area. All creatures which enter the area gain double their movement speed, advantage on all initiative rolls, advantage on all Dexterity saving throws and ability checks, and do not provoke attacks of opportunity when the leave another creature's reach. These effects last until the creature leaves the radius of the spell.

name: Deadfall
components: V, S, M (a tangled ball of string)
description:
When you cast this spell, choose a point within range. A group of thin tree trunks burst forth from the ground, filling a 30-foot radius, 40-foot high radius cylinder centered on the chosen point. The branches of the trees quickly grow into a tangled knot, wrapping around any creature currently flying in the area of the spell, forcing them to make a Dexterity saving throw or become grappled. A grappled creature may escape by making a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks. For the duration of the spell, the area within the cylinder is considered difficult terrain, and provides half cover to all creatures within it.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the trees within the area grow much thicker, preventing any creature larger than Tiny size from flying within the area, and giving all creatures in the area three-quarters cover.

name: Demonic Torment
description:
When you cast this spell, choose a creature that you can see within range, forcing them to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target begins to hallucinate, seeing shocking images and hearing terrifying noises. For the duration, the target is unable to take actions, instead swinging wildly at the empty air on their turn as they attempt to fight off the images. The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on themselves on a success.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

name: Disharmony
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when you are targeted by a melee weapon attack
components: V, S, M (a handful of glitter, consumed in the casting)
description: You may cast this spell using a reaction when a creature within range makes a melee weapon attack against you. You toss the glitter into the air between you and the attacking creature, attempting to briefly distract and charm them. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the target attacks as normal. On a failed save, the target stops its attack, and you may quickly give the target a single word command, which they immediately attempt to perform.

name: Divine Intervention
description: You drop to your knees and immediately begin to pray to your deity. For the next two rounds, you may take no action other than to continue to pray. If you move during this time or lose concentration, the spell ends with no effect. At the end of your second round spent praying, you may choose up to three creatures that you can see within 60 feet. If any of the chosen creatures has fewer than 100 hit points, they die immediately. Otherwise, the spell has no effect. If all three creatures die, you are immediately reduced to 0 hit points and begin dying.

name: Divine Offering
components: V, S, M (a magic item worth at least 500 gp, consumed in the casting)
description: To complete the spell, you touch the magic item, causing it to crumble into dust, before touching a creature that has died in the past 24 hours. That creature returns to life with 1 hit point, and any previously missing body parts are restored. This spell can't return to life a creature that has died of old age.

name: Divine Transformation
components: V, S, M (a pearl worth 500 gp, which the spell consumes)
description: A creature you touch is instilled with a blessing granted directly from your deity. The target grows wings which grant them a flying speed of 60 feet. The wings may resemble those of a bird, a bat, or an insect, your choice. The target's weapons become sheather in brilliant light, dealing an additional 1d8 radiant damage on a hit for the duration. In addition, the target emanates an aura of divine protection. The first time an allied creature enters the aura or starts its turn there during a battle, they regain a number of hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier.

name: Dream Coat
components: V, S, M (the tail of a gecko)
description:
Choose a creature within range that you can see. An unwilling creature must make a Wisdom saving throw to avoid the effect. For the duration, you may use a bonus action on each of your turns to choose a type of damage: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. Until the start of your next turn, the target gains resistance to the chosen damage type, and gains vulnerability to the other damage types. A creature may repeat the saving throw whenever it takes damage of a type it is vulnerable to, ending the effect on itself on a success.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may target an additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. When you select a damage type, you must select the same damage type for all creatures affected by the spell.

name: Dwarven Song
components: V, S, M (a flask of ale)
description:
You may cast this spell using your reaction when a creature that you can see within range makes a Constitution saving throw. The target gains advantage on the saving throw. If the target succeeds, for the next hour, they can not become poisoned, become drunk, or become addicted to any substance.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may target an additional creature for each level of the spell slot above 2nd.

name: Enchantment Alteration
components: V, S, M (a pair of magnets)
description: You may cast this spell using your reaction when a spell you are currently concentrating on would end as a result of a creature being reduced to 0 hit points. You must make a spellcasting ability check, with a DC equal to 10 + the level of the spell. If you succeed, you may cause a different creature that you can see within 30 feet to be affected by the spell you are concentrating on. The spell ends for the previous target.

name: Energy Tap
description:
Choose a creature within range. You grant the target the ability to cast one spell which you know of 1st level or lower until the end of their next turn. The spell save DC for the spell is equal to your spell save DC. If the spell requires an attack roll, the attack is made with you spell attack bonus.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may allow the target to cast a spell of a level equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

name: Equinox
description:
Choose a point you can see within range. You mark the ground surrounding the area as being under your protection. For the duration, spells of 1st level or lower which target a particular area within a 20-foot radius of the chosen point automatically fail unless cast by you.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, spells which target the area automatically fail if they are of a level equal to or lower than the level of the expended spell slot.

name: Eternal Warrior
description: You summon the guardian spirit of an ancestor to watch over a creature that you can see within range. For the duration, whenever the creature is targeted by a ranged weapon attack, reduce the damage from the attack by an amount equal to 1d10+ your spellcasting modifier. If the damage is reduced to 0, the guardian spirit catches the ammunition from the attack. Then, you may use your reaction to command the spirit guardian to throw back the ammunition, making an attack roll using your spell attack modifier against the source of the original attack. The spell ends after the spirit guardian has prevented 20 damage.

name: Eureka
components: V, S, M (a cup of mud, consumed in the casting)
description: You summon an elemental of challenge rating 5 or lower which appears in the nearest empty space. When you do so, roll a d20. On a roll of 11 or higher, the elemental is friendly to you and your companions, and obeys any commands which you verbally give it (no action required by you). On a roll of 10 or lower, the elemental is hostile to you and your companions. You may then repeat this process, until you have successfully summoned either three friendly or three hostile elementals. Roll initiative for the elementals, which have their own turns. If you lose concentration on the spell, only the friendly elementals are dismissed. Any hostile elementals remain for an additional minute after you lose concentration on the spell.

name: Everingham's Leaping Lightning
description:
You roll the coin between your fingers, building up a powerful static charge, only to unleash it in a burst of electricity aimed at a target you can see within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. A creature that takes damage from this spell can then choose to take an additional 1d6 lightning damage to cause the arcing electricity to leap to another target it can see within 30 feet, forcing the new target to make a Dexterity saving throw against the spell's effects. This process repeats until a target chooses not to take the additional damage, or until a target takes no damage from the spell.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both the initial and the additional damage each increase by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Everingham's Great Wall
components: V, S, M (a length of copper wire)
classes: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
description: Choose a creature that you can see within range. Static begins to crawl across the target's skin, making their hair stand on end. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, for the duration, the target becomes vulnerable to lightning damage. If the target had any resistance to lightning damage, they lose that resistance.

name: Falling Star
components: V, S, M (150 gp of adamantine, consumed in the casting)
description: You summon a rain of molten hot rocks from the sky to strike the ground around you. Choose a point within range. For each creature within 60 feet of that point, roll a d20. On a roll of 11 or higher, the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 5d6 bludgeoning damage and 5d6 fire damage, and is stunned until the start of their next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much damage, and is not stunned.

name: Feint
description: You turn an ally into an irresistible target, hoping to lure the enemy right into your plans. Choose an allied creature that you can see within range. Until the start of your next turn, all melee attacks made against the target ally have advantage. Any creature which comes within 5 feet of the target ally automatically knows this. A creature which makes a melee attack against the target ally before the start of your next turn must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacking creature misses, and may take no other actions this round. A creature within 5 feet of the target ally may use a bonus action to make a Wisdom (Insight) check against your spell save DC to recognize the trap.

name: Field of Dreams
components: V, S, M (a stalk of wheat)
description: You choose a point within range, causing a small field of golden, glowing wheat to suddenly appear from the ground in a 15-foot radius centered on the chosen point. Any creature, including yourself, which enters the field of wheat for the first time on its turn or starts its turn within the field must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is charmed, and becomes overwhelmed with a sense of peace and calm. The creature remains charmed until they leave the field of wheat. If a charmed creature takes damage, the charm is broken, and the spell ends. When the spell ends, the field of wheat disappears, turning to dirt and dust.

name: Flash Counter
description: You touch a creature and pump a surge of psychic energy into their mind, forcing them to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target is unable to take reactions for the duration. The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on themselves on a success.

name: Flash Flood
components: S, M (a flask of saltwater, consumed in the casting)
description:
You splash the saltwater from the flash, and it suddenly grows into an overwhelming wave. Each creature in a 10-foot cone must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone, taking 2d6 bludgeoning damage.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd, and the size of the cone increases by 5 feet, to a maximum of 40 feet.

name: Force Spike
description:
You may cast this spell using your reaction when a creature within range casts a 1st level spell which targets you. Both you and the target must make a spellcasting ability check. Whoever has the lower result takes 2d4 psychic damage. If the target has the lower result, the spell is countered otherwise it is cast as normal. If the results are equal, you take 4d4 psychic damage and the spell is countered.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may attempt to counter a spell if its level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

name: Fortified Area
description:
This spell fortifies and strengthens an object, turning it hard as steel. Choose an object or structure within range. When you cast this spell, the object's AC increases to 20. This spell has no effect if the object's AC was already 20 or higher. If you target a structure or wall, you may affect up to a 10-foot cube of material. The affected object or structure develops a dull grey coloration as the spell takes effect.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration becomes 1 year; when you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level or higher, the effects of the spell remain until dispelled.

name: Giant Strength
description:
You touch a creature, granting it unparalleled strength, though only for a short while. Until the start of your next turn, the target's Strength score becomes 21. If the target's Strength score was already higher than 21, this spell has no effect.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the target's Strength score becomes 23. If cast using a 6th level spell slot, it becomes 25; if cast using a 7th level spell slot, it becomes 27.

name: Glyph of Delusion
description:
Choose a point that you can see within range. A symbol which remotely resembles a musical note appears on the chosen point, remaining for 1 round before becoming invisible. Once the glyph is invisible, it is detectable only through magic. Whenever a creature enters the same space as the glyph, they must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed by you for 1 minute. The creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, or whenever they take damage. After a creature activates the spell, the symbol disappears and the spell ends.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the affected creature remains charmed for an additional minute for each slot level above 1st.

name: Glyph of Destruction
description:
Choose a point that you can see within range. A symbol which remotely resembles a flame appears on the chosen point, remaining for 1 round before becoming invisible. Once the glyph is invisible, it is detectable only through magic. Whenever a creature enters the same space as the glyph, they must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. After a creature activates the spell, the symbol disappears and the spell ends.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Glyph of Doom
description:
Choose a point that you can see within range. A symbol which remotely resembles two connected scythes appears on the chosen point, remaining for 1 round before becoming invisible. Once the glyph is invisible, it is detectable only through magic. Whenever a creature enters the same space as the glyph, they must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d6 poison damage and becomes poisoned for 1 minute. On a success, they take half as much damage, and are not poisoned. After a creature activates the spell, the symbol disappears and the spell ends.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Glyph of Life
description:
Choose a point that you can see within range. A symbol which remotely resembles a fountain appears on the chosen point, remaining for 1 round before becoming invisible. Once the glyph is invisible, it is detectable only through magic. Whenever a creature enters the same space as the glyph, they must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. You regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage dealt. After a creature activates the spell, the symbol disappears and the spell ends.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 per slot level above 1st.

name: Glyph of Reincarnation
description:
Choose a point that you can see within range. A symbol which remotely resembles a spoked wheel appears on the chosen point, remaining for 1 round before becoming invisible. Once the glyph is invisible, it is detectable only through magic. When you cast this spell, choose an ability score. Whenever a creature enters the same space as the glyph, they must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on all saving throws made with the chosen ability score for 1 minute. After a creature activates the spell, the symbol disappears and the spell ends.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration on the affected creature increases by 1 minute per slot level above 1st.

name: Gravity Sphere
description: When you cast this spell, choose a point within range that you can see. A 15-foot radius sphere of dim light appears centered on the chosen point. Any creature which begins its turn in the sphere or enters the sphere for the first time on its turn must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 4d8 bludgeoning damage and has their speed reduced by half. If the creature is flying, they immediately fall to the ground. Any creature which falls while under the effect of the sphere takes double damage from doing so. Furthermore, objects within the sphere weigh twice as much as they normally would. You may use a bonus action on your turn to move the sphere up to 30 feet in any direction, including into the air.

name: Great Defender
description: You touch a creature, causing its muscles to tighten and become like steel. The touched creature gains a bonus to their AC equal to their Strength modifier. The effects of the spell end if the creature takes any damage.

name: Greater Realm of Restoration
description: Your divine magic shields you from the common attacks of fiends and undead. For the duration, whenever you would take fire or necrotic damage, you may use your reaction to expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher. When you do so, the damage is prevented.

name: Greed
components: V, S, M (a gold coin worth at least 25 gp, consumed in the casting)
description:
You channel powerful and dangerous necromantic energies through yourself, ready to lay waste to your foes. For the duration, you may use a bonus action on each of your turns to force all creatures in a 15-foot radius centered on you, including yourself, to make a Constitution saving throw. Other creatures take 8d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. You take 4d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, and no damage on a success.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the range of the effect increases to 25 feet, and the damage increases to 12d8.

name: Heaven's Gate
description: Brandishing your holy symbol, you provide a small amount of protection for those you seek to aid. You may cast this spell as a reaction when you or another creature you can see in range takes necrotic or radiant damage. The target and up to three other creatures you can see within range gain resistance to necrotic or radiant damage (your choice) until the start of your next turn, including against the triggering attack.

name: Hell Swarm
description:
You summon a swarm of mutated insects from the Abyss in a space you can see within range. The summoned insects have the same statistics as a swarm of insects, except that half the damage they deal is poison damage. You may telepathically command the swarm on your turn, no action required by you. If you lose concentration on the spell, the summoned insects do not disappear. Instead, you lose control of the swarm, which becomes hostile to all creatures. The summoned swarm then disappears after 1 minute.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may summon an additional swarm of insects for every slot level above 1st.

name: Hellfire
components: V, S, M (onyx stone from the Nine Hells)
description: The chunk of rock in your hand creates a connection to infernal planes, from which you draw forth a searing fire more blisteringly painful than any found on the Material Plane. The first explodes outward in a 120-foot radius centered on you, forcing each creature in the radius to make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 12d10 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A creature which fails this saving throw ignites with hellfire, taking 4d6 necrotic damage at the start of each of their turns for 1 minute. A creature may use their action to attempt to smother the flames, rolling a d20. On a result of 11 or higher, they are successful. Flammable objects in the radius not being worn or carried ignite, and are destroyed immediately by the flames. Fiends and undead in the radius of the spell take half damage on a failed save, and no damage on a success. When you cast this spell, you may choose up to six creatures within range, causing them to take no damage from the spell.

name: Holy Day
description:
You attempt to instill a spirit of celebration and rejuvenation into your allies, granting yourself and up to five allies within range that can hear you a number of temporary hit points equal to 1d8 + your Wisdom modifier.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of temporary hit points granted increases by 1d8 per slot level above 1st.

name: Horror of Horrors
components: S, M (the bone of a creature that has been dead at least 100 years)
description: You touch a willing creature, infusing them with dark power and transforming them into something terrifying. The target's limbs begin to elongate and grow, as their skin pales and their nails grow into claws. For the duration, the target's speed increases by 10 feet, their reach increases by 5 feet, and their Strength score increases by 2. Whenever the target takes the Attack action, they may replace any number of their normal attacks with a claw attack. The target is considered proficient with the claws; any attacks made using the claws are determined using their Strength score, and deal 1d8 slashing damage. In addition, whenever the target is reduced to 0 hit points during the spell's duration, you may expend a spell slot as a reaction to cause the target to immediately regain 1d8 hit points per level of the spell slot expended.

name: Immolating Radiance
components: V, S, M (some flint and a tinderbox)
description:
You strike a spark with the flint and tinder, holding the small fire in your hand and touching it to a willing creature. The target immediately ignites, as their whole body goes ablaze. For the duration, the target is covered in fire which they may control to aid their attacks, but which burns at their skin while it remains. A creature that touches the target or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet takes 2d6 fire damage. In addition, the target's melee weapon attacks deal an additional 2d6 fire damage on a hit. At the start of each of its turns, the target takes 2d6 fire damage; this damage can not be prevented and is not subject to resistance.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage the target deals and the damage the target takes at the start of each of its turns increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

name: In the Eye of Chaos
components: S, M (a vial of water collected during a thunderstorm)
description:
Choose a point within range that you can see. You fill a 40-foot high, 30-foot radius cylinder centered on the chosen point with an oppressive magical aura. The area of the cylinder is marked by dark, swirling storm clouds which appear at the top of the cylinder. For the duration, any creature within the cylinder which attempts to cast a spell of 5th level or lower must make a spellcasting ability check with a DC equal to your spell save DC. If the creature fails the ability check, they take 5d10 force damage as the oppressive magical aura bears down on them, and the spell fails. On a success, the spell is cast without issue. As an action on your turn, you may move the cylinder up to 30 feet to another point that you can see within range; the storm clouds above the cylinder move with it. If a creature within the cylinder casts a spell of 6th level or higher, you must make a spellcasting ability check with a DC equal to 10 + the level of the spell being cast. If you fail the ability check, the spell immediately ends.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the level of spells affected increase by one level. In addition, the damage dealt when a creature fails their ability check increases by 1d10 for every slot level above 6th.

name: Indestructible Aura
description: When you cast this spell, you become surrounded by a 15-foot aura of protection. For the duration of the spell, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to grant a single creature within the aura immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. This immunity lasts until the start of your next turn. You may not select the same target two turns in a row to receive this benefit, and you may not select yourself.

name: Infinite Authority
description: You utter a single, ancient word to empower a creature that you can see within range. For the duration, whenever the target hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, if the creature has 30 hit points or fewer, it immediately dies. Whenever the target is hit by an attack from a creature within 5 feet, if the creature has 30 hit points or fewer, the target may use their reaction to cause the creature to immediately die. If they do so, the spell immediately ends.

name: Instant Darkness
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when you are targeted by an attack
description: You may cast this spell as a reaction when you are targeted by a weapon or spell attack that you are aware of. With a single word, your shadow rises from the ground and engulfs you, rendering you incorporeal until the end of your next turn. During this time you can take no actions or reactions, and your speed is reduced by half.

name: Invoke Prejudice
description: When you cast this spell, choose a damage type: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or necrotic. Choose a point within range that you can see. A 30-foot cube of glowing elemental energy centered on the chosen point springs into existence, filling the area. For the duration, the chosen damage type has a stronger presence in the area, causing creatures and objects in the area to take twice as much damage of the chosen type. The cube dulls the presence of the other damage types, granting all creatures within the area resistance to those damage types. Any creature within the area that is vulnerable to the chosen damage type takes 2d6 damage of the chosen type when it first enters the area on its turn, and at the start of each of its turns for as long as it remains within the cube of energy.

name: Jovial Evil
description:
A spell meant to worsen the afflictions of already injured creatures, perfect as revenge on a foe. Target creature that you can see within range must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target's body is cursed with necromantic energy. For the duration, whenever the target is subject to magical healing which would restore hit points, they regain no hit points and instead take necrotic damage equal to half the hit points restored.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level, the duration becomes one month. When cast using a spell slot of 8th level, the duration is a year and one day. When cast using a spell slot of 9th level, the effects of the spell remain until dispelled.

name: Juxtapose
components: V, S, M (a perfectly symmetric object, worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes)
description:
When you cast this spell, make a melee spell attack against a creature within reach. If the attack hits, choose an ability score. The target must make a saving throw using the chosen ability score. On a failed save, the chosen ability score of the target becomes equal to your own ability score, and your ability score becomes equal to the target's previous ability score. For example, if you were to target a creature with a Strength score of 17 and you had a Strength score of 10, if you hit the target and choose Strength as the ability score and the target fails their Strength saving throw, their Strength score becomes 10 and yours becomes 17. This effect may be removed with dispel magic only if both you and the target are within 30 feet of each other.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 9th level spell slot, the duration increases to 24 hours.

name: Kismet
components: V, S, M (a pair of silk gloves)
description: When you cast this spell, you alter the fate of up to three creatures of your choice in a 30-foot sphere within range. Whenever an affected target makes an Attack roll or attempts to cast a spell, they must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attack automatically misses or the spell fails, wasting the spell slot. If an affected target succeeds on the saving throw three times, the spell automatically ends for all targets.

name: Land Equilibrium
components: V, S, M (a diamond worth 500 gp, consumed in the casting)
description: You supernaturally enhance your own spellcasting abilities for a time, allowing you to respond to threats nearby. Whenever a creature within range casts a spell, you may use your reaction to cast a spell of the same level from your list of prepared spells, expending a spell slot as normal.

name: Land Tax
description: Magic is inherently balanced- you're just making sure it's kept. You create a 30-foot cube centered on a point within range. Whenever a creature concentrating on a spell enters the area for the first time on its turn or begins its turn there, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw or lose concentration on the spell. When you cast this spell, you may designate one creature that you can see within range to be immune to the effect.

name: Land's Edge
components: V, S, M (a burning piece of coal)
description: A sudden wave of magical energy bursts forth from your position, swallowing the battlefield in a deep red mist, which soon fades. Any creature with an Intelligence of 8 or higher within range when the spell is cast gains the ability to cast the burning hands spell at will for the duration of the spell. The DC for the saving throw when an affected creature casts the spell is equal to your spell save DC.

name: Lifeblood
description: The blood of your veins is replaced with molten fire, and your skin glows white-hot. For the duration of the spell, you gain the following effects: You become immune to fire damage. Whenever you are subject to fire damage, you instead take no damage and regain a number of hit points equal to the damage dealt. In addition, any spell you cast which deals fire damage deals an additional 4d6 fire damage. Any creature you grapple for the duration of the spell automatically takes 4d6 fire damage at the start of each of their turns.

name: Living Plane
components: V, S, M (a twig each of holy and oak)
description:
You command the forces of nature themselves, awakening the spirits of the natural world to your call. The ground around your shakes with your power. Your feet become anchored to the ground, preventing you from moving and granting yourself advantage on saving throws made to resist being knocked prone or moved against your will. For the duration, you may use an action on each of your turns to manifest one of the following effects within 120 feet of yourself. Whenever you choose an effect, the previous effect ends, unless stated otherwise.
 You cause the ground to warp around the legs of a creature, forcing them to make a Strength saving throw or become restrained. A restrained creature may repeat this saving throw at the end of each of their turns, freeing themselves on a success. A restrained creature is freed after 1 minute.
 You cause poisonous spikes to grow from the ground in a 30-foot radius, turning it into difficult terrain. Whenever a creature enters the area for the first time on their turn or starts their turn in the area, they take 3d6 poison damage and 3d6 piercing damage, and must make a Constitution saving throw or become poisoned.
 You manifest a burst of elemental energy at a point within range, forcing each creature within 15 feet of the chosen point to make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 6d6 damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. The type of damage is determined by the terrain: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. The DM determines the appropriate type of damage.
 Tendrils of rock, stone, and dirt rise up from the ground in up to three spaces within range of your choice. As a bonus action on your turn, you may cause any number of the tendrils to attack a creature within 10 feet of the tendrils. Make a melee spell attack for each tendril, dealing 4d8 bludgeoning damage on a hit.

name: Mana Drain
description:
You attempt to steal away the magic of a creature casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 1st level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. You then regain an expended spell slot of 1st level. If you have no expended spell slots of 1st level, the magic has nowhere to go, and dissipates instead. If the creature is casting a spell of 2nd level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 12 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect, and you regain an expended spell slot of that level. If you have no expended spell slots of that level, you instead regain a spell slot of your highest expended level that is less than the level of the interrupted spell.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to three levels below the level of the spell slot you used.

name: Mana Drain [ALT]
description:
You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 5th level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 6th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect. If you successfully interrupt the creature's spell, you may cast a spell you have prepared of a level equal to or lower than the level of the interrupted spell without expending a spell slot.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to one level below the level of the spell slot you used.

name: Menges' Marvelous Moat
description: For the duration of the spell, whenever a creature within 120 feet of you attempts to take the Attack action, they are briefly overcome by the sensation of having fallen into a deep moat which has appeared from nowhere. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes incapacitated and flails their arm wildly, attempting to stop the sensation of falling. Creatures with a flying speed automatically succeed on this saving throw. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the effects of the spell for the remainder of the duration.

name: Rushed Imprisonment
components: V, S, M (a small metal cage)
description: When you cast this spell, choose one creature within range that you are aware of. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a spectral cage appears around the target, visible only to the target and creatures with truesight. For the duration, whenever the target attempts to take the Attack action or cast a spell, you may use your reaction to force the target to make another saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d8 psychic damage and is unable to take actions for the turn. On a success, the spell ends, and you take 4d8 psychic damage. If the target attempts to take the Attack action or cast a spell and you do not attempt to use your reaction to prevent them, the spell automatically ends.

name: Venter's Withering Blight
components: S, M (a piece of rotten fruit)
description:
You touch a creature within reach, forcing them to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, black vines begin to grow across the target's body, originating from the point you touched. Whenever the target takes an action, they take 5d8 necrotic damage, and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage dealt when the target takes an action increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Volcanism
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when you are targeted by a melee attack
description:
You unleash a burst of searing energy in front of yourself, distracting your opponent and burning at their skin, granting disadvantage on the attack roll. If the attack hits, the target takes 2d4 fire damage.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st.

name: Advice from the Fae
components: V, S, M (a vial of your own blood, and a silver mirror worth at least 40 gp)
description: You drip blood from the vial onto the surface of the mirror, watching as it spreads to coat your reflection. Your image then fades away, only to be replaced with the face of a powerful archfey from the Feywild. You can ask the archfey that appears five questions, each of which must be no longer than 25 words. The archfey then chooses up to two of the questions and answers them to the best of its ability. While the archfey must answer the chosen questions truthfully, it may choose questions whose answers it has little or no knowledge of, or may use intentionally vague or unclear language when answering.When you cast this spell, you can attempt to contact a specific fey if you know that creature's name and appearance. The fey creature contacted this way does not need to be an archfey, but it must have an Intelligence of at least 10 or higher, and share a language with you. If the chosen fey is willing, it can answer the summons and appear in the mirror, answering your questions as normal. Once a creature has answered your summons and appeared in the mirror when you cast this spell, it can not do so again until the end of your next long rest.If you are a warlock with an archfey patron, you can instead cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher.

name: ﻿Aero
description:
At your touch, the air begins to swirl around the target, cloaking them in a sphere of moving wind. The target gains 5 temporary hit points for the duration. Ranged attacks made against the target while it has these hit points are made with disadvantage.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by 5 for each slot level above 1st. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the target also gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage while they have the temporary hit points.

name: Aerora
description:
You level your hand at a target within range, and the air briefly swirls and collects around your palm, before launching at the target. Make a ranged attack roll. On a hit, the target takes 4d8 bludgeoning damage, is pushed 10 feet, and is knocked prone. Each creature in a line between you and the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take 2d8 bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Aeroga
description:
As you cast this spell, the air around you begins to whirl, eventually become a high-speed vortex, with you at its center. Each creature within 15 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, an affected creature takes 6d8 bludgeoning damage, and is pushed 10 feet away from you and knocked prone. On a success, an affected creature takes half as much damage and is not pushed or knocked prone. Until the start of your next turn, all ranged weapon attacks made against you automatically miss, as the missiles are turned away by the powerful gusts of wind in your area.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the radius of the affected area increases by 5 feet and the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

name: Aeroja
description:
Choose a point that you can see within range. The pieces of the twig rise into the air and begin to spin in circles at the chosen point, faster and fast until their movement creates a miniature tornado. Each creature within 5 feet of the tornado must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled inside its currents, becoming trapped in the tornado and unable to move out of it. Creatures trapped in the tornado have a speed of 0, and disadvantage on all attack rolls and attack rolls made against them are made with disadvantage. The tornado can hold up to 6 Small or Medium creatures, or up to 3 Large creatures. Creatures that are Huge or larger are unaffected by the spell. At the start of each of its turns, a creature trapped in the tornado automatically takes 4d8 bludgeoning damage and then repeats the saving throw. On a failed save, the creature remains trapped. On a success, the creature is thrown from the tornado 10 feet in a random direction. If this movement is stopped by a creature, wall, or another object, both take 2d8 bludgeoning damage. As an action on each of your turns, you can choose to move the tornado up to 20 feet in a direction of your choice. If this movement causes the tornado to move further than 100 feet away from you or into a space that you can’t see, the spell automatically ends.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the affected radius around the tornado increases by 5 feet and the tornado can hold two additional Small or Medium or one additional Large creatures for each slot level above 7th.

name: Bio
description:
Dozens of small, floating orbs of a sickly-green color appear in the air around a creature of your choice that you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d12 necrotic damage and is afflicted with a potent disease for the spell’s duration. On a successful save the target takes half as much damage, and the spell immediately ends. At the start of each of its turns and whenever it takes the Attack, Dash, or Dodge action, an afflicted creature must make another Constitution saving throw, taking 2d4 necrotic damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a success.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the initial damage increases by 1d12 and the secondary damage increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 3rd. You can target two creatures with this spell if you cast it using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, and three creatures if you cast it using a spell slot of 8th level or higher.

name: Bioga
description:
As you cast this spell, you begin to grow pale and sickly, making you appear as if you were at death’s door, and a cloud of green smoke pours from your skin, filling a 15-foot radius sphere around you before dissipating in the air. At the start of each of your turns for the spell’s duration, you automatically take 1d12 necrotic damage. Whenever a creature begins its turn in the radius of the smoke or enters it for the first time on its turn, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, an affected creature takes 4d12 necrotic damage and becomes poisoned for 1 minute; on a success, an affected creature takes half as much damage and is not poisoned, and is immune to the spell’s effects for the duration. At the start of each of its turns, a poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw, taking an additional 2d4 necrotic damage on a failed save and ending the effect on itself on a success.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the initial damage increases by 1d12 and the secondary damage increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 5th.

name: Biora
components: S, M (a rusty nail and a vial of poison, expended in the casting)
description:
When you cast this spell, choose a creature you can see within range. A cloud of green toxins wells up from the ground around the target, soaking into its skin, hair, and clothes. At the start of each of its turns for the spell’s duration, the target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 4d12 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. When the spell ends, if the target has 50 hit points or fewer remaining, it dies.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d12 for each slot level above 7th.

name: Blind
description:
You create a sudden and powerful flash of light centered on a point of your choice within range. Each creature of your choice within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the start of your next turn.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 1st. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, each creature that fails the saving throw is permanently blinded and stunned for 1d4 rounds.

name: Blizzard
description:
You choose two creatures that you can see within range, that are both within 30 feet of each other. A thin blue line of magical energy connects the creatures, preventing them from moving more than 30 feet from each other. At the start of each of you turns, both targets must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 1d6 cold damage on a failed save.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target three creatures instead; when you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can choose four targets instead, up to one of which can be an object or structure.

name: Blizzara
description:
You launch a flurry of ice and snow in a 30-foot cone, forcing each creature in the area to make a Constitution saving throw, taking 3d8 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. If a creature fails this saving throw, ice collects around its feet, anchoring it to the ground and reducing its speed to 0 for 1 minute. An affected creature can use its action to make a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check against your spell save DC, freeing itself early on a success. If a trapped creature takes any amount of fire damage, it is automatically freed.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 2d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Blizzaga
description:
Choose up to three unoccupied spaces or objects that aren’t being worn or carried that you can see within range. A magical symbol appears on in the space or somewhere on the surface of the objects, briefly flashing with light before fading away. Noticing the faded symbols requires a successful Wisdom (Perception) check against your spell save DC. The symbols automatically appear to a creature under the effects of the detect magic spell. Whenever a creature moves within 5 feet of one of the symbols it explodes in a burst of ice, forcing each creature within 10 feet of it to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save an affected creature takes 4d8 cold damage and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn; on a success, an affected creature takes half as much damage and its speed is not reduced. When you cast this spell you can choose up to five creatures, including yourself. If a chosen creature moves within range of one of the symbols, it will not activate, but such a creature is still affected if it is within range of a symbol when it activates.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th. When you cast this spell using a higher level spell slot, you can place one additional symbol at 7th and 9th level.

name: Blizzaja
components: V, S, M (a block of ice weighing at least 1 lb., consumed in the casting)
description: When you cast this spell, the block of ice shreds itself in your hands, turning into a blizzard of snowflakes that seek out up to five creatures of your choice that you can see within range, forcing each of the targets to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the target takes 8d8 cold damage and is encased in ice, becoming petrified for the duration. On a success a target takes half as much damage, and is not petrified. A petrified creature can repeat the saving throw once every minute, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a petrified creature takes any amount of fire damage, the ice begins to melt, and it automatically succeeds on its next saving throw to end the effect. If a target remains petrified for the entire duration of the spell and fails its final saving throw, the petrification becomes permanent and the target and any equipment it is carrying or wearing are transformed entirely into ice.

name: Burst
description:
Sparks fly from your hand, and crackling electricity travels from your fingers along the skin of a creature you touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the target takes 2d10 lightning damage, and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of your next turn.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 2d10.

name: Choke
description:
With a quick and simple motion of your hands, you draw the breath from the lungs of a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or begin to suffocate. A creature that doesn’t breathe, or which breathes water instead of air,is immune to the spell’s effects. While the target is suffocating, it has disadvantage on all Strength and Constitution saving throws and ability checks.
 At Higher Levels. You can target up to two creatures when you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th-level or higher, and up to three creatures when you cast it using a spell slot of 7th-level or higher.

name: Comet
description:
A chunk of fiery stone comes hurtling from the sky towards a point you can see within range. Each creature in a 20-foot radius centered on the point must roll a d100. The comet strikes the creature with the lowest result, forcing it to make a Dexterity saving throw. If two or more creatures are tied for the lowest result on the d100, a comet strikes each of those creatures. A creature takes 5d6 fire damage and 5d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.
 At Higher levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the fire damage and the bludgeoning damage each increase by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Meteor
description:
A blazing orb of fire comes hurtling to the ground at a point you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot radius centered on the point must roll a d100. The meteor strikes the creature with the lowest result, forcing it to make a Dexterity saving throw, dealing 10d6 fire damage and 10d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Each creature within 20 feet of the creature with the lowest result must also make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d6 fire damage and 5d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. The spell damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren’t being worn or carried.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher the fire damage and the bludgeoning damage each increase by 1d6 for each slot level above 6th.

name: Dark
casting_time: 1 reaction, taken when you hit a creature within range with a melee weapon attack
classes: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
description:
You can use your reaction to cast this spell when you hit a creature within range with a melee weapon attack. You draw power from the target’s spilt blood, enveloping it in a chilling shadow the leeches its life away. The target must make a Constitution saving throw.
