On a failed save the target takes 2d6 necrotic damage, and its maximum hit points are reduced by an amount equal to the damage dealt. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and its maximum hit points are not reduced.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, if the target fails the saving throw, you regain a number of hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt this way.

name: Darkra
classes: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
description:
You veil yourself in a cloak of chilling shadow, which reaches with wispy tendrils to sap the life from those around you. For the duration, whenever you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature takes an additional 3d6 necrotic damage, and you regain a number of hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt this way.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 4th.

name: Darkga
description:
Tendrils of shadowy darkness begin to spread across the ground, lashing and writhing as they suck the life from the area around you. Each creature in a 20-foot radius centered on you must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 6d6d necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You then gain a number of temporary hit points equal to half the total necrotic damage dealt this way.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 6th.

name: Darkja
components: V, S, M (a shard of obsidian worth at least 500 gp, consumed in the casting)
description: Choose up to three creatures that you can see within range. A swirling mass of blue-black shadows begins to envelop the chosen creatures, draining their life away and forcing each target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature loses a number of hit points equal to half its maximum hit points, rounded up. If this reduces the creature to 0 hit points, it immediately dies, and its body crumbles into black ash. You then regain a number of hit points equal to the total hit points lost by all creatures affected by the spell.

name: Death
description:
You bring utter death to one creature that you can see within range. If the creature’s CR is divisible by 5, and it has 50 or fewer hit points remaining, it dies instantly. Otherwise, the spell has no effect. If the target doesn;t have a CR, use its level instead.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level, it affects creatures whose CR is divisible by 4 and have fewer than 100 hit points remaining. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level, the CR must be divisible by 3, and it must have fewer than 150 hit points remaining. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level, the CR must be divisible by 2, and it must have fewer than 200 hit points remaining.

name: Firaga
description:
You launch a small ball of fire at a creature or object within range, which turns and veers to seek the best path towards its target. Make a ranged spell attack against the target, ignoring half cover and three-quarters cover. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 fire damage and the ball of fire explodes, dealing 1d4 fire damage to each creature within 5 feet of the target.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you launch an additional ball of fire and both the initial and splash damage each increase by one die for each slot level above 1st.

name: Magnega
description:
You create a small but powerful vortex in an unoccupied space that you can see within range, which begins to draw in creatures and objects around it. Creatures and objects of your choice within 30 feet of the vortex that are Medium or smaller must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be drawn 10 feet towards the vortex. Creatures and objects that touch the vortex or are pulled into the vortex’s space are drawn fully into the vortex and immediately take 1d8 bludgeoning damage, and an additional 1d8 bludgeoning damage at the start of each turn they begin inside the vortex. Because space is compressed in on itself within the confines of the vortex, any number of creatures and objects can fit inside the vortex. A creature drawn inside the vortex is restrained until freed and can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, freeing itself on a success. A creature freed from the vortex is dropped into a randomly chosen unoccupied space within 10 feet of the vortex and has advantage on saving throws made to avoid being pulled back in. When the spell ends, creatures and objects still caught in the vortex are launched 30 feet in a random direction from the vortex’s previous space, landing in the furthest unoccupied space. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks. If a creature or object thrown this way would pass through the space of another creature or object, both take 1d8 bludgeoning damage and the creature or object stops moving.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the radius of the vortex’s pull increases by 5 feet and the bludgeoning damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd. The size of creatures and objects affected by the vortex’s pull increases when you cast this spell at higher levels, affecting Large creatures and objects at 5th level or higher, and Huge creatures and objects at 7th level or higher.

name: Thundaga
description:
Dark clouds briefly appear above the head of a creature that you can see within range, and a bolt of lightning leaps from the cloud to strike the target. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d10 lightning damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. If the target fails its saving throw, then each creature within 15 feet of it must also make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 1d10 lightning damage on a failed save or half as much on a success.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, both the initial and secondary damage increase by 1d10 for each slot level above 3rd. In addition, the radius of the secondary effect increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Austere Command
description:
A trail of yellow smoke circles your hand, forming a symbol like a spiral with a mushroom and a mountain growing from it. When you cast this spell, choose two of the following options:
 Conclude: Choose any number of creatures or objects that you can see within range. Any spell of 8th-level or lower currently affecting one of the chosen targets immediately ends. In addition, each of the targets are cured of any of the following conditions: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned.
 Crush: Choose any number of creatures that you can see within range. If a chosen creature has 100 or fewer hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is immediately reduced to 0 hit points. If the target succeeds on the saving throw or has more than 100 hit points, the spell has no effect on that creature.
 Humble: Choose any number of creatures that you can see within range. If a chosen creature has more than 100 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is immediately reduced to 100 hit points. If the target succeeds on the saving throw or has 100 or fewer hit points, the spell has no effect on that creature.
 Ruin: Choose any number of nonmagical objects or up to three non-sentient magical objects that you can see within range. Each of those objects are instantly destroyed, and crumble to dust. If a chosen object is being worn or carried by a creature, that creature can make a Constitution saving throw to avoid the effect.

name: Cryptic Command
casting_time: 1 reaction, which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell or making an attack
description:
A blue mote of light swirls around your outstretched palm, forming a symbol like a circle with four branches. When you cast this spell, choose two of the following options:
 Counter: You attempt to interrupt a creature that you can see within range in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 8th level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect.
 Embrace: You attempt to interrupt a creature that you can see within range in the process of making an attack. The target must make a Strength saving throw. If it fails the saving throw, its attack fails and it can't make any additional attacks until the end of its next turn.
 Remember: You regain one expended spell slot of 5th level or below.
 Restrain: Magical bands of blue light form around a creature within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw or become paralyzed for 1 minute. At the end of each of the target's turns, if it took damage since the end of its last turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Ashes to Ashes
components: V, S, M (ash from a cremated corpse)
description:
You rub the dust between your hands, feeling the necromantic energy wash over your palms, practically burning away at your skin. You swing your arms wide, launching two arcs of black shadow at up to two creatures you can see within range. You take 2d8 necrotic damage for each arc launched, and each creature targeted by the spell must make Constitution saving throw, on a failed save taking 6d8 necrotic damage and suffering one level of exhaustion for each arc targeting them.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the number of arcs created and the number of creatures you can target each increase by one. This number increases to four arcs and four creatures using a 7th-level spell slot or higher, and five arcs and five creatures using a 9th-level spell slot.

name: Benefactor's Draught
components: V, S, M (a number of 1 gp vials)
description:
You touch up to two empty glass vials used as part of the spell's casting. Each touched vial becomes filled with a colorful, shimmering liquid. A creature can use its action to drink the liquid from a vial, causing it to regain a number of hit points equal to 4d4 + your spellcasting modifier.Any potions created this way lose their potency at the end of your next long rest.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can create one additional potion for each slot level above 4th. Each additional potion created in this way requires one additional vial as part of the material component necessary for casting this spell.

name: Aerial Modification
components: S, M (a feather, bat wing, or some other form of aerial locomotion)
description: You touch a vehicle or willing creature. The target gains a flying speed of 60 feet, if it is a creature, or 2 mph, if it is a vehicle, and can magically hover.If the target is a vehicle, the spell's duration is 24 hours; if the target is a creature, the spell's duration becomes 1 hour. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless it can stop the fall.

name: Army of Allah
components: V, S, M (a ritual golden dagger, worth at least 250 gp)
description:
When you cast this spell you force any number of creatures that you can see in range that have taken damage since the end of your last turn to make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes 5d6 necrotic damage on a failed save.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

name: Cyclone
components: V, S, M (the feather of a bird which died in a storm)
description: When you cast this spell, you summon a 30-foot radius column of spinning, high speed wind, centered on a point you can see within range. This cyclone reaches 120 feet into the air. Any creature within the radius of the cyclone when it forms must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 8d6 bludgeoning damage and is pushed 15 feet directly away from the cyclone as it is lifted off its feet and tossed outwards. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage, and is not pushed. Flying creatures have disadvantage on this saving throw. While concentrating on this spell, you can use a bonus action on your turn to move the pillar of air up to 30 feet. This movement ignores difficult terrain. Any creature which enters the cyclone for the first time on their turn or begins their turn in its radius must make a saving throw or suffer the effects stated above. If the cyclone leaves your sight, the spell automatically ends. While concentrating on this spell, you must expend one spell slot of 1st level or higher at the start of each of your turns. The cyclone deals an additional 1d6 bludgeoning damage equal to the level of the expended spell slot until the start of your next turn. If you fail to expend a spell slot at the beginning of your turn, the spell automatically ends.

name: Desert Twister
description: A searing hot sandstorm begins, tossing dust and debris around you in the range of the spell. Choose a creature that you can see within range. A twisting spiral of hot desert sand descends upon the target from the sky, forcing them to make a Constitution saving throw. Flying creatures have disadvantage on this saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 6d12 bludgeoning damage and 6d12 fire damage and becomes blinded. On a success, the target takes half as much damage, and is not blinded. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the blindness. On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use your action to call down another twister in this way again, targeting the same creature or a different one. If you are outdoors in a sandstorm when you cast this spell, the spell gives you control over the existing storm instead of creating a new one. Under such conditions, the bludgeoning damage and the fire damage of the spell each increase by 1d12.

name: Eye for an Eye
description: Either by twisting fate or through the use of righteous vengeance, you inflict upon your enemies what they inflict upon you. You can use your reaction to cast this spell when you take damage from a creature within 30 feet, forcing the creature that dealt the damage to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes damage equal to half the amount of damage done to you. This damage is of the same type of damage dealt to you.

name: Figareld's Tale of Shahrazad
components: V, S, M (a book of exactly 1001 pages in length)
description: When you cast this spell, choose up to 8 creatures within 120 feet of yourself. Each of the chosen creatures must make a Charisma saving throw. You and any creatures which failed their saving throw are transported to a small demiplane, which exactly resembles the area you just left, out to a radius of 600 feet. Beyond this radius the land ends, and falling off this edge automatically reduces a creature to 0 hit points. While in this demiplane, creatures are unable to teleport to locations other than this demiplane or travel to other planes. Creatures in this demiplane who are reduced to 0 hit points become incapacitated, but do not die. This spell lasts until there is only one remaining creature in the demiplane with more than 0 hit points. When this spell ends, all affected creatures are automatically transported back to their previous location, and are restored to the number of hit points they had remaining before the spell was cast. Any creature reduced to 0 hit points during the duration of the spell then loses half of their hit points, rounded down.

name: Holy Struggle
description:
When you cast this spell, choose one creature which you can see. All allies within 60 feet of you gain a +1 bonus to AC and +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls against that creature. This effect lasts for the duration, until the target is reduced to 0 hit points, or until the target remains out of sight of yourself and all affected allies for 1 full minute.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 9th level spell slot, the chosen target may be any creature which you have met in person or have seen a detailed picture of, the spell affects all allies within a 120 foot radius of yourself, and the duration becomes indefinite and no longer requires concentration. The spell ends when the target is reduced to 0 hit points, or once all affected allies have been reduced to 0 hit points at least once since the spell was cast.

name: Maddocks' Fishliver Oil
description:
You touch up to two creatures within range, and a slick, oily substance spreads from your palm to coat their whole body. For the duration, the targets gain the ability to breathe underwater, and gains a swim speed equal to half their normal movement speed.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the number of creatures you may target increases by one for every slot level above 2nd.

name: Magnetic Mountain
components: V, S, M (a small magnet at least 1 square inch in size)
description: Using the magnet, you touch and enchant a single object or a 5-foot cube of space. For the duration on the spell, all creatures other than yourself within 200 feet of the affected space or object that takes an action, bonus action, or reaction becomes incapacitated until the end of their next turn. A creature unaffected by the spell can use an action on their turn to allow an affected creature they can see to ignore the effects of the spell for 1 round.

name: Poole's Deep Piety
description: When you cast this spell, you begin a prayer to your deity, or a song attesting to the greatness of the gods, inspiring nearby allies. Until the end of your next turn, whenever an ally within 30 feet that can hear you takes the Dodge action, that ally gains an additional +2 bonus to their AC until the start of their next turn.

name: Rushed Metamorphosis
description: You touch a willing or unconscious creature, gaining a number of additional sorcery points equal to the target's remaining hit points divided by 10, even above your normal sorcery point maximum. After gaining these sorcery points, the target immediately drops to 0 hit points and begins dying. You do not regain these additional sorcery points at the end of your next long rest as normal, and any unspent sorcery points gained in this way disappear after 24 hours or at the end of your next long rest.

name: Schuler's Wasting Oubliette
description:
When you cast this spell, choose one Large or smaller creature within range that you can see, focusing on the intention of punishing the creature. The target must make a Charisma saving throw, and on a failed save, vanishes with a faint popping noise. The target is teleported to a small demiplane for the duration of the spell, which takes the form of a 10-foot cube with polished stone walls, a stone floor, and a ceiling of metal bars, through which filters dim lighting. The walls, floor, and bars are immune to all damage, and can be destroyed. Time in this demiplane works differently, with one hour passing for each minute that passes in the Material Plane. Creatures in this demiplane do not require air, food, or water for the duration, do not age while they remain here, and can not benefit from short or long rests. At the end of the spell, the target returns to a randomly determined unoccupied space within 10 ft. of yourself. If there is no unoccupied space in that range, the target reappears in the nearest unoccupied space.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can maintain concentration on the spell for 1 hour, and when cast using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you can maintain concentration on the spell for up to 24 hours.

name: Snoddy's Sandstorm
components: V, S, M (a vial of sand)
description:
When you cast this spell, all creatures which have dealt damage to you since the end of your last turn must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, those creatures take 4d4 slashing damage and are blinded until the start of their next turn. On a success, they take half as much damage and are not blinded.
 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d4 for every slot level above 1st.

name: Unstable Mutation
description: You touch a willing target, and it's body starts to twist and morph, rapidly changing size and structure in a painful process. At the start of each of the target's turns, roll 1d4. The target loses twice that many hit points, then gains a bonus equal to the result to one randomly determined ability score. The increase lasts until the start of the target's next turn.
